Colors may also appear different due to monitor settings.Changes in manufacturing time may happen, such as delays during production or corrections in final product, but I'll give updates ASAP whenever it occurs!

story:
About 'Grief' - A Performance art

Hey all! As most of you know, along with my photography, I also try to explore my creativity by doing performance art shows. I've had the opportunity to perform two pieces in Japan and received positive feedback from people. Most people who attended the show said they had never seen a performance art show before and that it was an unexpectedly beautiful experience. 

I have another project that I'd like to share with you all this fall, a show to portray my art and to ignite that artistic spark in people who are able to attend. A show that will make you forget about your past, present and future, a show that will connect you to your own primitive self.

What I Need 

Right now, I'm still working on the details, and I wouldn't want to say too much without being certain of my creative direction. I'm really looking forward to sharing what I've got planned, and I'll be releasing more information closer to the performance date BUT I'm so excited to perform this show here in Japan this October. 

The exact date and location of the show will be released later on, but right now I want you to hear me out. 

The tickets to the show will cost ¥2500 and will cover the cost of the venue, equipment, props and make-up. If I can make it to ¥200,000 the show will be funded and you can all come and see the performance or stream it online!

So right now, I need your help with covering the costs of the show. And also, if, with your help, we can raise just a little bit extra....you'll be helping me on my way to achieve something even bigger, something even more important. My big move to study art history and curating to London! I'm extremely excited about this move and funding from this show will help to make this dream into a reality.

What you get

Ticket prices are ¥2500

My art shows are an interactive experience - the audience does not simply sit and watch the performance unfold in front of them, the audience engage and participate. The audience becomes the artist. So you get to experience what it's like to be an artist for a few hours. But since things are still a little bit difficult these days due the COVID-19 pandemic, I will also stream the show online. So wherever you may be, you can still experience this performance.

Along with that, I'd also like to offer a little bit more to friends out there who are willing to donate a little bit more. And here what they are;

For donations over     

¥5000 you can get a signed copy of one of my photos.

 ¥10,000 a 2 hour shoot with me as your photographer, for a photoshoot of the concept of your liking.

 ¥15,000 an all day photoshoot around Nagoya city with me as either your photographer or a model (for other photographers) and 3 printed copies of your favorite shots.

Other Ways You Can Help:

Please like and share this page! Even if you can't contribute funds, you can follow me on Instagram and support my art. 

 

Thank you so much

story:
Who We Are

Spotlight on the Arts, a program of California Lawyers for the Arts, provides exposure to the arts and employment for low income high school students ages 14-17 who reside in neighborhoods throughout San Francisco. In 2014-2015 our new cohort of youth have chosen to team up with the community focused art organization, 14 Black Poppies, to develop a collaborative art project:  an exhibition, You Belong Here, that showcases a transdisciplinary and cross-platform investigation into belonging. The project will culminate April 11 during an event that is open to the public. We have raised $2200 and we are seeking to raise $5000 more.

What We Need 

Since 1993, Spotlight on the Arts have served more than 750 youth, placing them in internships at arts organizations and businesses, complemented by job readiness and enrichment workshops that include exploration of careers in the arts, tours of arts facilities and collaborative art projects. While art and community based collaborations have always been an integral part of our mission, we are expanding to include an ambitious project with an arts organization to advance our objective to serve youth and enrich communities through project based learning.

We are requesting your tax deductible financial support to cover an honorarium to the lead collaborator, Jason Wyman, and stipends that fulfill our commitment to reward low income youth with paid work experience in the arts. 

                


The Impact on Our Community

We are currently seeking to expand our involvement with arts and community development by supporting a youth-directed collaboration which will not only serve our participants, but the city of San Francisco.

The project You Belong Here by 14 Black Poppies, is the culminating event of the Where Do You Belong project, which engages artists and community members in creation, exhibition, research, and civic-engagement to explore the concept of belonging across intergenerational and cultural boundaries. 

For more information, please visit: http://www.wheredoyoubelongproject.com/

Our Youth

Trayvon, Izza, and Mosiah

Some reflections from Spotlight youth participating in You Belong Here

TRAYVON -- To actually sit there and hear the feedback on what we should integrate and what we would need to make the film was absolutely amazing, but different for me. I felt like I was actually in charge of something and that our movie actually matters. It was good to see everyone wanting to get engaged into the movie and think of it as their own. Also, I liked how they could visualize the movie in their heads and their bodies. I was pretty sure that everything would go smoothly. The whole experience was great. 

IZZA -- The experience today for me was better than I expected. 1.) Everyone got together really well and respected each other's opinions. 2.) Everyone's points of view were so different but so on point. It really expanded my bubble of what this project/movie can/will be. I also thought that everyone's points of view were expressed in a good way without people clashing/disturbing. The ideas people gave were so wonderful, and a necessary point of view for us to have. My view/thoughts for this movie has really expanded and more and more ideas are flowing in. 

MOSIAH -- Receiving feedback on my movie was good. I heard a lot of good things from experienced people who know what they are doing. Whenever someone gave their feedback it seemed like they weren't criticizing it; they were trying to help make it better. I took what they said to heart and made a change to the movie. I really think it is going to turn out great. 

                      


About Jason Wyman

Jason Wyman is a life-long educator, writer, performer and learner.  He is a consummate connector. His skillful networking, which is rooted in compassion and creativity, has brought over a million dollars of in-kind services and peer-based education to communities across the San Francisco Bay Area with a special emphasis on marginalized communities, youth, seniors and cultural workers. He has worked for OMI/Excelsior Beacon Center, California School-Age Consortium, The Partnership for Children and Youth, San Francisco Unified School District, Youth Development Peer Network/Youth Worker: Collective, Adobe Youth Voices and the YMCA. 

He is currently an Ensemble Member of Outlook Theater Project, a queer community theater company. Their current project, "the GOD project" explores the intersections of faith, religion and spirituality, and gender and sexuality through an online survey, community workshops, live performance and social media. As part of OutLook, Jason has focused on using narrative to bridge diverse, divergent, and disparate communities in order to deepen understanding. 

Our History with Collaborative Projects

Spotlight on the Arts regards our long track record for serving low income, San Francisco youth with arts and community development projects. We are an ideal candidate for supporting this community-based undertaking. We are largely supported by the Department for Children and Youth Foundation to cover most of our operations and staffing, though we need additional funding to accommodate the scope of our ambition with this project.

In 2013, Spotlight on the Arts program provided a platform for teens who were harassed by San Francisco police officers to describe their experiences in a short video, What If This Happened To You?  A preliminary version of the video was shown to a group of youth and police at the Bernal Heights Neighborhood Association’s Youth Summit on May 1, 2014 at Balboa High School. Of the four police officers who attended, an African-American officer commented that he was shocked that “this is still happening in San Francisco today,” describing a similar incident that had happened to him in his youth.


Other Ways You Can Help Us

If you can't give - then share, share, share! On Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, and other social media.

We are an ideal candidate for supporting this community-based undertaking. of the video was shown to a group of youth and police at the Bernal
Heights Neighborhood Association’s Youth Summit on May 1, 2014 at
Balboa High School. Of the four police officers who attended, an
African-American officer commented that he was shocked that “this
is still happening in San Francisco today,” describing a similar
incident that had happened to him in his youth.

story:
Short Summary

World renowned visionary artist, Adam Scott Miller, and aspiring author, Bridey Walker, are pleased to present our story "Across the Rainbow Bridge", a colourful tale of a little angel who dreams of meeting his Earth parents, and journeys through the seven colours of the Rainbow Bridge to wake up on Earth as a human baby.
 
With a complete manuscript and a publishing plan, we need to get the artwork completed in order to submit our work for publishing.

What We Need & What You Get

For our publishing dream to be realised, we need to raise $7000. We have chosen to submit to Pickawoowoo Publishers, a publisher of spiritual books based in Western Australia. Although they are closed for submissions, they offer a trade publishing option for accepted authors who are willing to buy back a certain amount of books. This is called the "authors wish list" and details of this can be found at: http://www.pickawoowoo.com/assets/Publishing/Authors-Wish-Agreement.pdf.
 
In order to submit the story, we need to have the artwork completed. If we are not successful, we will use the funds to self publish through MBS Press, a division of Pickawoowoo Publishers. We would need the same amount to invest in self publishing.
 
Approximately $4000 needs to be invested in the publishing process, and a further $3000 needs to be raised in order to support my amazing illustrator while he is creating the artwork. For more information about the artist, please visit http://www.corpuscallosum.cc/
 
All donations will be rewarded. This ranges from stickers prints and posters, to a signed book, and even a mention in the book.
 

The Impact

"Across the Rainbow Bridge" is my attempt to explain how we all come to be here on planet Earth, and while it is marketed as a children's book, I believe it is the adults who will benefit the most from reading this story. It would appeal to anyone who has children or who dreams of having children, or anyone who is human. When published, "Across The Rainbow Bridge" will be a perfect marriage of text and imagery, and would make an ideal bedtime story.
 
Please note that this book is the first in a series of three books. Stay tuned!!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially, you can support us by sharing this campaign with your networks. We appreciate your love and support. Namaste xx
 
Please scroll down to read the story
 
Across the Rainbow Bridge

High in the sky, where the angels fly,
On a little, puffy white cloud,
An angel lay sleeping, his eyes tightly closed,
Snoring — but not very loud.
 
He dreamed of a man and a woman in love,
Who were living together on Earth.
They wanted the angel to come to them;
And bless them with his birth.
 
When he awoke, his mind was filled
With constant thoughts of this pair.
He wanted to go and meet them on Earth;
He wanted to live with them there.
 
To the big angels this little one went,
And shared with them his plan.
“Please let me journey down to the Earth,
To meet this woman and man.”

“Of course you may go,” the big angels said,
“But the journey is long, you should know.
Close by is a bridge of beautiful colours,
And across it you must go.”
 
The little angel gave up his wings,
And to all of his friends bade goodbye.
He set off towards the Rainbow Bridge,
Connecting the Earth to the sky.
 
Ahead of him, the Rainbow Bridge
Glimmered as bright as the sun.
Through seven colours would he pass;
His journey to Earth had begun.
 
He stepped forward slowly, and violet he saw.
Voices from above he could hear.
Words of love and good wishes they gave,
Whispering into his ear.
 
Next came indigo, an owl in a tree,
A thunder high in the sky.
Memories were fading in the angel’s mind,
Memories beginning to die.

Indigo faded into blue,
The beat of a drum somewhere near.
Earthly music sang from below;
The path ahead was now clear.
 
Continuing through to the colour green,
A sensation of balance he felt;
Neither good nor bad, scared nor brave.
The colour began to melt.
 
Around him swirled yellow, angry like fire
And as bright as the sun at midday.
Feelings of power welled up inside,
And yellow, too, faded away.
 
Next was orange, a colour so clear.
No longer an angel was this boy now;
A physical form was appearing,
Far, far away from his cloud.
 
Red was the colour that surrounded him now,
Tucked in a space small and warm.
Sleep, little baby, inside your womb.
From there you’ll soon be born.

All went black and the boy fell asleep.
By now three seasons had passed.
When he awoke, the world was so bright;
On Earth he was at last.
 
Slowly he focused his eyes and he blinked.
Smiling faces he saw through the blur,
Of the man and woman from his dream;
His mother and father they were.
 
Forgotten now was the Rainbow Bridge,
And the puffy, white cloud way up high.
A proud woman and man gazed down at their boy;
They would love him the rest of their lives.
 
 
With Love
Bridey Walker
© 2006 - 2012

story:
UPDATED REWARD: LIFETIME MEMBERSHIP IS NOW $100 EACH

11/27 In an effort to meet our minimum goal, we have cut lifetime membership to $100. Select the $100 level & get a lifetime membership. Those that have already committed to membership, will receive additional perks & coaching & will be contacted after our compaign to work through those details!

UPDATED GOAL: $10,000

11/27 In order to get our community site up & running, we need funds to help cover design & programming costs. With the site offering so much in the way of services, it's dynamic & will offer an immense value through tools, templates, and resources.  

UPDATED REWARD: MEMBERSHIP IS NOW LIFETIME

11/15 The Membership Package has been updated to a lifetime membership, rather than one year. 

____________________________________________________________________

The Pitch

True North is an online creative community that happens to know their way around business. Join us & you'll become a creative master & idea generator while we work behind the scenes sorting all the business mumbo-jumbo.True North is remarkable in three major ways:

  • A strong focus on various learning styles; translating stuffy business rhetoric into easy to understand forms and templates

  • We'll be here for you whenever you need us. Where? Here. Where? Here. Yes. We're still here.

  • Collaborative & organic environment that adds value each time a creative contributes, asks a question, or posts their success.

Okay we're starting to get it, who's this for?

Hmm, well anyone, but if you want to get particular: maybe an artist, photographer, graphic designer, ceramic artist/potter, fiber artist, metal sculptor, glass artist, foodie, restauranteur or chef, writer, blogger, crafter, or know anyone who is willing to participate & contribute in our community?

The dynamic environment facilitates growth, idea development, & collaboration; while pushing comfort zones & maximizing strengths to build passionate & profitable lives.

What is it exactly?

Community & support are critical elements of any equation. We offer story-features on artists, articles, business tools, thousands of resources, and our undying committment to do whatever we can to help our members dream big dreams and make them happen. This makes our community invaluable.

 

Okay, this sounds really great! But what can True North Creative do?

We find that what's out there is mind-boggling. OR it's totally lacking & doesn't help you actually run your business.

We hand over materials & forms for all learning types with built-in templates in each member's profile page. We make sure your creative empire runs smoothly. Your business to-do list will always be there, your monthly reports will update automatically, your trusty business peeps (that's us) are always here for you!

Imagine if YOU could do the one thing you thought you could never do. What if you were given everything you needed?

 

How can I help?

We would love to say that rainbows & unicorns could make this business work, but we need some funding too, but every penny counts. 

The Financial Break-down:

  • Full time business analysts & a developed operations team
  • Marketing Program Development
  • Graphic Design & Branding
  • Website Design With Dynamic Member Profiles
  • Drupal Programming for Community Website & Forum
  • Computer Hardware/Software
  • Research & Training
  • Access to Market/Industry Statistics & Trends

- If we do not reach our lofty goal, we will scale down the roll-out of the site & instead have several phases as we seek funding to cover costs.

Here's a sneak peak of the website design (still in the draft phase - explains all the latin):

 

What does the future hold?

+ We are creating strategic partnerships with universities, experts, authors . . . and all this good energy will be transferred to you, the people, who matter.

+ If we exceed our lofty goal, we will move forward with plans to develop a Creative Co-Working Space & Business Incubator in our community with graphic design, printing, and shipping services & an array of creative workshops offered to members.

+ Maybe a book or two. Maybe a book about the community. Maybe a book with you in it?

 

So what else you got?

In exchange for your love and undying suppport you get to take home some pretty cool stuff.

The Goods Break Down:

  • $1 Everyone will be recognized for supporting this project & included in a photomosaic to be featured on our website & in our office 
  • $10 Recognition on our website. Be among True North's famous.
  • $15 Tatt it up package with temp tattoos even your mother will love
  • $25 T Shirts, tatts, & being famous. What more could you want?
  • $35 Become part of our team as an Associate Editor. Be the first to set eyes on all of our creative business e-books and materials.
  • $50 Get published and become a contributing writer in the e-books series.
  • $100 Plenty of True North swag to go around with a choice exclusive products from our first clients, Bent Halos Handcrafted Metal Art OR Handmade Glass "True" bead necklaces from Pacific Northwest artist Carolyn Chennualt
  • $200 Become an ORIGINAL member, that is. There's only one first time & you need to be part of it.
  • $500 Featured Creative Story Campaign with tons of Marketing Perks
  • $1,000 Become a Member of the Creative Board of Directors with a listing online & hang with the big boys & girls!
  • $3,000 We'll be Corporate Buds & you'll become our featured sponsor
  • $7,000 You'll hang out with True North to create, collaborate, & become BFFs
  • $10,000 Philanthropy - We will build an altar honoring you with a clay characature in your likeness & worship you each & every single day (or y'know, each day we're in the office)

 

* Any membership ($200) that is "donated" will be matched by True North with TWO additional memberships for an approved organization in your very own community; i.e. Small Business Administration, Micro Enterprise Training Assistance, National Association of Women Business Owners, Start-Up America, & the like. Contact us at hello@followtruenorth.com to coordinate.

 

For $100 Choice Between these two exclusive products from Bent Halos Metal Artisan or Pacific NorthWest Artist Carolyn Chenault. These are some of my favorite swag products!!!

What's included in these swanky business materials you speak of?

The e-books & private business discussion groups will feature some of the following:

  • ENTREPRENEURIAL STRENGTHS & PSYCHOLOGY OF BUSINESS
  • ORGANIZING GOALS & IDEAS
  • DETERMINING WHO YOUR CLIENT IS
  • BUILDING A BRAND; NAME. IDENTITY. LOGO
  • MARKETING & PROMOTION
  • WEB PRESENCE, E COMMERCE & BLOGS
  • IMPORTANCE OF COMMUNITY, ETHICS, & CULTURE
  • OPERATIONS. PROCESSES
  • START-UP CAPITAL & FUNDING
  • FINANCE MODELS & TRACKING
  • CROWDFUNDING CAMPAIGNS (LESSONS FROM THE TRENCHES! I'M TAKING NOTES HERE PEOPLE)

 

Will this really change the world?

Yes. Absolutely. The difference your contribution will make:

  • Impressive international community support is invaluable for anyone starting their business. This project will help develop business & economy, create jobs, and stimulate a renewed appreciation for the arts and creativity
  • With public schools cutting funding on the arts & humanities, we offer a place to hang your hat to develop ideas & create a safe environment which develops a more alturistic & selfless society. It's true.
  • Reaching out globally, specifically to programs in Malawai near S. Africa such as JARDs, a company assisting at-risk youth & those suffering from AIDS
  • Our company seeks to be socially responsible through programs & associations such as the Social Enterprise Alliance & by seeking admittance into the B Corporation Classification
  • Community support for our members is available anytime online with forums managed by experienced business managers who happen to be creatives.
  • We will be offering a scholarship program for those who cannot afford the paid membership, so that everybody has the opportunity to be part of the action.
  • You will be a key factor in driving opportunity to CREATE something that never before existed! How exciting is that?

 

Who's running this show anyhow?

The Founder: Shannon Etnyre, MBA

  • is an artist, a photographer, foodie, and obsessed with all things design
  • has over a decade of experience consulting & working full time for top Fortune companies, non-profits, & private business
  • serves as Executive Director on the Board for Center for Arts & Education
  • holds a Masters of Business Administration in Bus Organization & Entreprenership, an undergraduate in Business Economics, & is a Certified Trainer
  • has written an "all too honest" blog about her life as a working mom of two boys (4yo & 2yo) for the past 4 years at www.livingwithumami.com
  • was a Williams-Sonoma's Featured Publisher & has been choosen twice for Foodbuzz 24x24 event as a foodie blogger. Go here for recipes. They're good. I promise. Check out the "bread pudding souffle".
  • is a HappySpotter for TrendSpotting.com website contributing to trend reports on a world platform
  • grew up in California in the "Valley" to some pretty awesome parents.
  • loves camping, off-roading, & living in Idaho with her husband, 2 boys, & an animal menagerie
  • starts random conversations with strangers & becomes life-long friends in a span of 5 minutes
  • can be found on facebook & twitter & instagram & would love to hear more about your BIG plans!

 

The Advisory Board:

Your Name Here? It can be if you choose the CREATIVE BOARD OF DIRECTORS level!

As a Member of the Board you will be mixing with the likes of a Hollywood Executive Producer, a Serial Entrepreneur, serious Operational Experts, and Non-Profit leaders!

  

Can we help? You know besides handing over the green?

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

[Or login to your twitter & just click this http://clicktotweet.com/1035f]

 

Love in the form of community! @followtruenorth needs your help to make the creative incubator a reality on @indiegogo:http://bit.ly/S4rHCs

[Or login to your twitter & just click this http://clicktotweet.com/8lmU8]

 

Calling all artists, dreamers, entrepreneurs! @followtruenorth is looking for creatives to support this artist business community on @indiegogo: http://bit.ly/S4rHCs

[Or login to your twitter & just click this http://clicktotweet.com/v5grE]

 

2.  Facebook!

Please feel free to use the same messages above to post on facebook, change them to your liking, or write your own.  Please also like us on facebook!

 

What if we are really really good at what we do?

The top Networkers who refer backers & drive traffic to our indiegogo through the facebook, twitter, and email links will be rewarded too! Choose from one of the following or you can even suggest a reward you would like to see (email us at hello@followtruenorth).

  • One Year of Free Above the Fold Advertising For Your Company
  • Featured Monthly Article On Our Site For One Year
  • Or Lifetime Premium Membership (forever or as long as we have the rights to the site)

 

Does this founder lady appreciate the hard work or is it all about her?

The founder, boss lady, creative number cruncher would not be able to do this without:

My husband for wrangling our children while I work feverishly at the dining room table, the couch, the office, the other office, & everywhere else!

My parents who tell me I'm so smart & offered seed funding & never let me believe there was another option.

My sister, Emily, my right hand woman & the greatest Office Manager EVER! Also my biggest fan! Love you Ems!

Epipheo Studios for being AWESOME all around! I love you guys! You totally get me!

Darling Studio for phenomenal graphic design! You have exquisite taste!

Project Zen Online for exceptional Drupal programming! You make programming sound easy & I really appreciate that with such a complex website.

My artist friends who inspire me every day & convinced me this could be done! Particulary Ken & Mary Taylor,Carolyn Chennault & Toni at RC Tees. Oh & the Klatch especially!

 

Where's the press?

Right here of course. Our Press Release: here

The Pitch
True North is an online creative community that happens to know their way around business. Join us & you'll become a creative master & idea generator while we work behind the scenes sorting all the business mumbo-jumbo.True North is remarkable in three major ways:


A strong focus on various learning styles; translating stuffy business rhetoric into easy to understand forms and templates



We'll be here for you whenever you need us. Where? Here. Where? Here. Yes. We're still here.


Collaborative & organic environment that adds value each time a creative contributes, asks a question, or posts their success.


Okay we're starting to get it, who's this for?
Hmm, well anyone, but if you want to get particular: maybe an artist, photographer, graphic designer, ceramic artist/potter, fiber artist, metal sculptor, glass artist, foodie, restauranteur or chef, writer, blogger, crafter, or know anyone who is willing to participate & contribute in our community?
The dynamic environment facilitates growth, idea development, & collaboration; while pushing comfort zones & maximizing strengths to build passionate & profitable lives.

What is it exactly?
Community & support are critical elements of any equation. We offer story-features on artists, articles, business tools, thousands of resources, and our undying committment to do whatever we can to help our members dream big dreams and make them happen. This makes our community invaluable.
 
Okay, this sounds really great! But what can True North Creative do? 
We find that what's out there is mind-boggling. OR it's totally lacking & doesn't help you actually run your business.
We hand over materials & forms for all learning types with built-in templates in each member's profile page. We make sure your creative empire runs smoothly. Your business to-do list will always be there, your monthly reports will update automatically, your trusty business peeps (that's us) are always here for you!
Imagine if YOU could do the one thing you thought you could never do. What if you were given everything you needed?
 
How can I help?
We would love to say that rainbows & unicorns could make this business work, but we need some funding too, but every penny counts.

story: n/a

My name is Casey and I am a 20 year old college student. I study Art Education at Arkansas Tech University. I am an artist of many different mediums, including paint, pencil, ink, and fiber. I'm also a poet and   vocalist and I love to rap!

As a college student, I have always struggled to get funding for school.The university has been unable to offer me any scholarships or other types of
financial aid, so I have tried loans, grants, and government funding. But at
the end of each semester I find I am always left with a negative balance.
I have been able to put myself through 2 years of school so far and have
been able to get by with hard work and the generosity of
my family and friends.

I have managed to keep a job and take care of my studies so far, but the lack of funds makes it very difficult. I was unable to attend this past fall semester due to not having enough money to pay all of the different fees. It left me short on houseing and books. I have also not been able to register for the spring semester and am terribly upset with the setback. I want to continue my education and graduate. The loans and grants are available but not enough. I have spend last semester and will spend this semester working full time and saving as much as possible to put to next years tuition.

           

What We Need & What You Get
I have calculated that with my pay for the next few months and the amount I have already put back for tuition I will be $1450 short for the semester. This is if none of the fees and charges at the school are raised next year.
I can update everyone on my progress, whether it's through email, social media, or through this website. As I stated I am an artist and work with many different types of media. I have come up with a few things that I can offer those who are able to assist me in my time of need.

Even if I don't reach my entire goal, all funds will be put toward my education. All those who contribute will receive a original and unique piece of art from my collection of works. I make many things from drawings to jewelry and love to create and share. Please like me on Facebook and share my story, Tweet me, and add me to any other site you are a member on.



Other Ways You Can Help

I am very aware that some people just can't help me monetarily. But just by looking at my campaign you have helped and I thank you for your time.
You can also help simply by sharing this with your friends and family. Tweet my cause and post my story on your facebook. SHARE SHARE SHARE!
I would like to thank everyone in advance for any help that I receive.

 

 

Created By:

Casey Robbins

story:
Who Am I?

Hello! My name is Lyz Luidens (www.lyzluidens.com), printmaker, teacher, and map enthusiast! I work in my print studio, the Prankster Press (www.facebook.com/pranksterpressprinters), housed in the Riopelle Artist Collective (www.riopelle.co), which contains relief and etching presses, letterpresses, and space for screenprinting. I also teach art part time in schools and art centers. I am completely in love with printmaking, in all of it's various methods and techniques. Teaching other people how to make prints is the best way I know to share this meditative, inky dance between technical process and conceptual process that brings me so much joy.

What is the Detroit Atlas Collaboration?

This collaborative community project combines mapmaking, bookbinding, data and historical map research, and printmaking through free art workshops! As a completed project, the Detroit Atlas will have been a collaboration between Detroiters in a wide range of neighborhoods to map Detroit as they have experienced it, within the bounds of the same art project, all while learning and experiencing the technical, tactile, and interactive process of printmaking. These maps will provide context for one another, a juxtaposition of personal experiences of people who live in the same geographic space, but often very different social, political, and historically contextualized spaces. You can read more in detail at www.detroitatlas.com !

Why Printmaking?

The processes of printmaking (of which there are many!) are already very meditative, and I personally use them as a mindfulness exercise to calm my thoughts and anxieties, focusing on the work my hands are doing with all of the tools involved. It makes perfect sense to me to combine the theme of mapmaking, of remembering how you have experienced particular physical spaces, with this already meditative practice. I believe that making art can be a truly transformative experience, especially when done collaboratively.

There’s also something especially beautiful about a hands on process that is meant to create multiples of a piece of art, meant to be seen and owned and accessed by a wide range of people. It makes for a good collaborative medium, because people can make many copies of their relief block or screen to keep and to share. The multiplicity of printmaking is a welcome contradiction to the inaccessible elitism often imposed on fine art making. I take pride in my craft as a printmaker, but I take more pride in sharing it. 

What is the Goal?

The main goals of this project are:

  • To provide free printmaking and mapmaking workshops in many neighborhoods in Detroit based on the idea of mapmaking
  •  To allow the project to serve as a conversation starter about lived experience in Detroit as compared to the data based and historical depictions of the city, and to serve as a visual documentation of those interactions
  • To connect the themes and ideas that local community organizations, schools, teachers, and artists are passionate about to residents of the city through an accessible form of artmaking; mapping and printmaking are flexible activities, and can change as the conversation with collaborators changes

The true value of this project comes from the variety of perspectives provided by workshop attendees, hosts, researchers and collaborators, all of whom will be credited as collaborators on the project website and any exhibitions of the final work. This is a printmaking project that is also an analog data collection project. It’s a mapping project that is also a mindfulness project. But most importantly, it’s a collaboration.  

In the end, I hope to have a set of Atlases of Detroit, printed by Detroiters, which will be housed in a public space like a library or community center, where this information about the city will always be accessible to anyone interested in it. The maps will also be digitally available on the project website, as well as all of the prompts and lesson plans for the workshops, so that it can be recreated anywhere, by anyone!

What We Need & What You Get

The Detroit Atlas Collaboration began when I received a Knight Arts Challenge Grant of $10,000 and the 2015 Fall Michele Schara Artist Residency. The Residency jumpstarted this project in a high school art class at Detroit Community High School. To fully execute this project, I need to raise a matching $10,000 to receive the Knight Arts Grant, and the supply budget of $3000 for the residency combined with a year of fundraising efforts through events, sales, and other campaigns brings that down to $3,150 left to raise, which is what brings us here!

Your donations will help to pay for the following:

  • Printmaking supplies and materials for the workshops like paper, ink, brayers, lesson plan materials, wood and linoleum blocks for carving, screens for screen printing, and more! One of the best parts of this project is being able to reach out to schools and community organizations and tell them that I have a fully funded printmaking curriculum that just needs participants. 
  • Pay for Artists and Teachers! As soon as I have access to the Knight Foundation grant, I will be able to seek out local artists and teachers to help run some of these workshops and/or complete some prints for the project. Your donations help me to pay these dedicated folks for their time and effort!
  • Research and Creation of screens and relief blocks depicting data based and historically maps of Detroit. Lasercutting relief blocks and burning screens for screenprinting requires access to tools that we will need to pay some fees to use.  
  • You'll receive a variety of handmade rewards for your contributions - check out the perks section to see what kind of printed goodies you can expect in the mail as a thank you for your contribution!

Who are the Collaborators so Far?

  • The CHASS (Community Health and Social Services) Center, where I hosted a printmaking table at their weekly farmers market over the summer.
  • Detroit Community High School, where I taught map based printmaking classes to high schoolers for a year as the Michele Schara Artist in Resident. 
  • Detroitography, run by Alex B. Hill, who has helped me get started on the research portion of this project, and has offered up some of the maps he's made to be converted into screens and blocks for printing. 
  • The University of Michigan Clark Library, which houses a vast collection of maps, and has also aided in the beginnings of the research for this project. 
  • Maptime Detroit: an organization of mapmakers and enthusiasts that aims to host one mapmaking event every month. 
  • Many more schools, galleries, small businesses, artists, mapmakers, and community centers and organizations are being and have been contacted about becoming collaborators on this project. If you would like to collaborate in any way, please email lyz@pranksterpress.com to find out how!

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't donate, you can still support this project!

  • Share the campaign on your social media pages and with your friends and family who may be interested in donating! Personal messages are most effective, and every donation counts! Use the Indiegogo sharing tools to support us with just the click of a button!
  • If you know any artists, teachers, schools, or Detroit based community organizations who may be interested in collaborating or partnering on this project, put us in touch! This project is a collaboration above all else, and that requires more people to get involved and benefit from this funding!
  • Come to a workshop! If you're in the Detroit area, keep an eye on the Prankster Press facebook page or sign up for the Riopelle Artist Collective email list to get updates on the free workshops - the more maps we collect, the more successful and whole the project is!

And that's all there is to it. Thanks so much for your support!
story_txt:
Who Am I?

Hello! My name is Lyz Luidens (www.lyzluidens.com), printmaker, teacher, and map enthusiast! I work in my print studio, the Prankster Press (www.facebook.com/pranksterpressprinters), housed in the Riopelle Artist Collective (www.riopelle.co), which contains relief and etching presses, letterpresses, and space for screenprinting. I also teach art part time in schools and art centers. I am completely in love with printmaking, in all of it's various methods and techniques. Teaching other people how to make prints is the best way I know to share this meditative, inky dance between technical process and conceptual process that brings me so much joy.
What is the Detroit Atlas Collaboration?
This collaborative community project combines mapmaking, bookbinding, data and historical map research, and printmaking through free art workshops! As a completed project, the Detroit Atlas will have been a collaboration between Detroiters in a wide range of neighborhoods to map Detroit as they have experienced it, within the bounds of the same art project, all while learning and experiencing the technical, tactile, and interactive process of printmaking. These maps will provide context for one another, a juxtaposition of personal experiences of people who live in the same geographic space, but often very different social, political, and historically contextualized spaces. You can read more in detail at www.detroitatlas.com !
Why Printmaking?

The processes of printmaking (of which there are many!) are already very meditative, and I personally use them as a mindfulness exercise to calm my thoughts and anxieties, focusing on the work my hands are doing with all of the tools involved. It makes perfect sense to me to combine the theme of mapmaking, of remembering how you have experienced particular physical spaces, with this already meditative practice. I believe that making art can be a truly transformative experience, especially when done collaboratively.
There’s also something especially beautiful about a hands on process that is meant to create multiples of a piece of art, meant to be seen and owned and accessed by a wide range of people. It makes for a good collaborative medium, because people can make many copies of their relief block or screen to keep and to share. The multiplicity of printmaking is a welcome contradiction to the inaccessible elitism often imposed on fine art making. I take pride in my craft as a printmaker, but I take more pride in sharing it. 
What is the Goal?

The main goals of this project are:

To provide free printmaking and mapmaking workshops in many neighborhoods in Detroit based on the idea of mapmaking
 To allow the project to serve as a conversation starter about lived experience in Detroit as compared to the data based and historical depictions of the city, and to serve as a visual documentation of those interactions
To connect the themes and ideas that local community organizations, schools, teachers, and artists are passionate about to residents of the city through an accessible form of artmaking; mapping and printmaking are flexible activities, and can change as the conversation with collaborators changes

The true value of this project comes from the variety of perspectives provided by workshop attendees, hosts, researchers and collaborators, all of whom will be credited as collaborators on the project website and any exhibitions of the final work. This is a printmaking project that is also an analog data collection project. It’s a mapping project that is also a mindfulness project. But most importantly, it’s a collaboration.  
In the end, I hope to have a set of Atlases of Detroit, printed by Detroiters, which will be housed in a public space like a library or community center, where this information about the city will always be accessible to anyone interested in it. The maps will also be digitally available on the project website, as well as all of the prompts and lesson plans for the workshops, so that it can be recreated anywhere, by anyone!

What We Need & What You Get


The Detroit Atlas Collaboration began when I received a Knight Arts Challenge Grant of $10,000 and the 2015 Fall Michele Schara Artist Residency. The Residency jumpstarted this project in a high school art class at Detroit Community High School. To fully execute this project, I need to raise a matching $10,000 to receive the Knight Arts Grant, and the supply budget of $3000 for the residency combined with a year of fundraising efforts through events, sales, and other campaigns brings that down to $3,150 left to raise, which is what brings us here!
Your donations will help to pay for the following:


Printmaking supplies and materials for the workshops like paper, ink, brayers, lesson plan materials, wood and linoleum blocks for carving, screens for screen printing, and more! One of the best parts of this project is being able to reach out to schools and community organizations and tell them that I have a fully funded printmaking curriculum that just needs participants. 

Pay for Artists and Teachers! As soon as I have access to the Knight Foundation grant, I will be able to seek out local artists and teachers to help run some of these workshops and/or complete some prints for the project. Your donations help me to pay these dedicated folks for their time and effort!

Research and Creation of screens and relief blocks depicting data based and historically maps of Detroit. Lasercutting relief blocks and burning screens for screenprinting requires access to tools that we will need to pay some fees to use.  
You'll receive a variety of handmade rewards for your contributions - check out the perks section to see what kind of printed goodies you can expect in the mail as a thank you for your contribution!


Who are the Collaborators so Far?

The CHASS (Community Health and Social Services) Center, where I hosted a printmaking table at their weekly farmers market over the summer.
Detroit Community High School, where I taught map based printmaking classes to high schoolers for a year as the Michele Schara Artist in Resident. 
Detroitography, run by Alex B. Hill, who has helped me get started on the research portion of this project, and has offered up some of the maps he's made to be converted into screens and blocks for printing. 
The University of Michigan Clark Library, which houses a vast collection of maps, and has also aided in the beginnings of the research for this project. 
Maptime Detroit: an organization of mapmakers and enthusiasts that aims to host one mapmaking event every month. 
Many more schools, galleries, small businesses, artists, mapmakers, and community centers and organizations are being and have been contacted about becoming collaborators on this project. If you would like to collaborate in any way, please email lyz@pranksterpress.com to find out how!


Other Ways You Can Help
Even if you can't donate, you can still support this project!

Share the campaign on your social media pages and with your friends and family who may be interested in donating! Personal messages are most effective, and every donation counts! Use the Indiegogo sharing tools to support us with just the click of a button!
If you know any artists, teachers, schools, or Detroit based community organizations who may be interested in collaborating or partnering on this project, put us in touch! This project is a collaboration above all else, and that requires more people to get involved and benefit from this funding!
Come to a workshop! If you're in the Detroit area, keep an eye on the Prankster Press facebook page or sign up for the Riopelle Artist Collective email list to get updates on the free workshops - the more maps we collect, the more successful and whole the project is!

And that's all there is to it. Thanks so much for your support!

story:
Robert Birmelin on his Work : Friday, July 13, at 6 PM

The lecture by Birmelin the juror for Prince Street Gallery's 10th Annual National Juried Show, is scheduled for Friday, July 13 at 6 PM, in conjunction with the exhibit.  Robert Birmelin will discuss his paintings followed by a short Q&A. The evening event will conclude with a reception for the artist and guests.

 

Robert Birmelin, “Calling – In the Empire of the Night,”   Acrylic on canvas, 48” x 96”                                                                     

 

Robert Birmelin,”City Crowd - Cop and Ear”  Acrylic on canvas, 48" x 96", 1981, Collection Metropolitan Museum of Art                                                                           

 

Robert Birmelin 

is a painter whose works are in the collections of many museums, among them the Smithsonian Museum in Washington D.C., the Metropolitan Museum of Art, MoMA, and the Whitney Museum in New York City.  He is represented by the Luise Ross Gallery in New York.  He has been the recipient of numerous grants and awards – among them, a National Endowment for the Arts, and grants from the Joan Mitchell Foundation and the Louis Comfort Tiffany Foundation. After receiving his MFA from Yale, Birmelin was awarded a Fulbright to study at the Slade School in London.  He later spent three years at the American Academy in Rome.  After his return to the United States, Birmelin had a distinguished 24-year teaching career at Queens College of the City University of New York.  Painting Perceptions  recent interview with Robert Birmelin:

http://paintingperceptions.com/interview-with-robert-birmelin/

The Norma Shatan Memorial Lecture Series was named for Norma Shatan, one of the founders of Prince Street Gallery.  She was an influential artist whose vision helped shape the gallery at its inception in 1970.  She exhibited  regularly at the gallery until her death in 2005.  Each talk in the lecture series is given by an artist or writer who serves as juror for our annual national juried show.  Previous lecturers include:

Philip Pearlstein

Robert Berlind (for Irving Sandler)

Susanna Coffey

Yvonne Jacquette

Lois Dodd

Robert Berlind

Stuart Shils

The lecture is free;  however, your donation in any amount will help our lecture series succeed:  The donated funds will support speaker fees and related expenses of this and forthcoming talks.

We offer several benefits for generous donations for reserved seating!            

  •   Reserved prime seating for 1 guest = $15 
  •   Reserved seating for 2 guests = $25 ( a $5 savings  on the second seat)
  •   Reserved seating for 3 or more = $10 each ( a $5 savings per seat)
  •   All donors will receive the Prince Street Gallery 40th Anniversary catalog
  •  All donors will receive confirmation of their donation for tax-deductible purposes via email.  

Prince Street Gallery is a non-profit 501c3, artist-organized gallery dedicated to exhibitions of  contemporary figurative and abstract artists. Now ending its 48th season, the gallery is located at 530 West 25th Street, NYC (646) 230-0246    www.princestreetgallery.com

story:
ScavengArt is the brain child of a local DC area artist who wanted to gift some of her smaller pieces in a new fun way. Once I heard her idea I saw the great potential it had to become something everyone could take part in and enjoy. I am a Washington DC area artist, high school art teacher, and graduate student at Savannah College of Art and Design. As part of my final project to earn my Master's in Arts Administration I am building the ScavengArt brand, increasing participation through promotion, and spreading the word about this new, interactive project. This is just the beginning, I hope in the next year to turn ScavengArt into a small business, create mobile applications, and reach people around the world. 

      

ScavengArt is a way to create a connection between artists and art enthusiasts through the use of gifting free art and posting clues on social media, like a scavenger hunt. It is a concept that allows all artists on all levels to create and gift. When you create something you are an artist and when you hide it as a gift, that is ScavengArt.

To learn more watch our great How To video...

To learn more you can find me on www.facebook.com/scavengart, Twitter or Instagram @scavengart.

In order to raise awareness through promotion and create an informational website I need funding. The money raised will go towards promotional materials such as buttons, stickers, and postcards. The development of a new website that will be hosted on the domain www.scavengart.com. As well as, ScavengArt starter kits that will be given out at the first ever ScavengArt event held on May 15, 2016 to promote and reveal the new brand!


This program offers many GREAT opportunities.

First and foremost, it is about the gifting of art. Whether you are novice or experienced painter you can create something and offer it to others. Whether it is a drawing, photograph, poem, or demo it offers an opportunity for all participants to create and gift. 

ScavengArt allows people to discover works they may not have otherwise seen. In the future I hope to build a business connecting the community to ScavengArt artists. This offers the unique opportunity to new and upcoming artists to show off their work. In order to do this I need to first establish the brand and build a larger network of participants. 

By utilizing social media ScavengArt has the potential to grow and reach people in all communities all over the world. A piece made by a ScavengArt artist managed to make its way to Australia and connected back to the artist. 

Finally, it offers an opportunity for people to get out and enjoy their community. Everyone loves something free and ScavengArt is all about connecting people through the gifting of free art. 

Currently, the biggest issue ScavengArt has faced is due to the lack of brand identity, understanding, and promotion. Through the work I am doing for my final project I hope to increase our participation through promotion both on-line and in-person, as well as, building a central source to learn more about what ScavengArt is and has to offer. 

If you cannot contribute please follow us and share our pages on all social media 

www.facebook.com/scavengart

www.twitter.com/scavengart

www.instagram.com/scavengart/

#scavengart #freeart #giftingart

Also, please share this campaign through the use of the Indiegogo share tools to spread the word of ScavengArt. The hunt for art!

story:
UPDATE:  I've had some delays with production and sourcing an alternate printer so we have not made our production deadline.    I will keep you guys posted as to new delivery dates once I have things sorted out.  Thanks for all your patience and i really cant wait to get these out for everyone to enjoy.

 

 

Lamp Girls of Canada Playing Cards

Creating a classic pinup deck of cards featuring 50+ women from across Canada.

Short Summary

Hi, I’m John Lee – full-time single dad and artists/photographer based in Toronto.

A few years ago I started shooting a series of vintage pinup-style portraits and people loved them. I want to take that theme and turn it into something special, so I’ve decided to create a vintage pinup-style deck of cards featuring women from across Canada! But I need your help to make it happen…

What We Need & What You Get

For this project I will be traveling across Canada doing photo shoots. This coast-to-coast trip will cost about $5,500. Friends have already booked photo shoots so we are almost there, but we still need help!

In return for your contribution, you get access to special limited edition prints, playing cards, letters from the models, postcards from across Canada, and access to our secret Snapchat and Instagram for exclusive behind-the-scenes photos, videos and contests!

The Impact

This is a big deal for me. I have spent the last 18 years of my life raising an amazing young woman into adulthood while working and trying to find time to make art. My daughter is just about to graduate from high school and embark on a journey to spend her gap year in Australia with her aunt. Recently I quit my job and am selling everything I own so I can take a shot at living the life I want to live while my daughter is traveling. This project is the first step toward that goal and I hope you can all be a part of it!

Risks and Challenges

I am taking a leap of faith. I have always played it safe with one foot in the door of photography and one foot in tech to keep the bills paid, the lights on, and my human fed and equipped for teenage life in Toronto. Now that she’s embarking on a journey of discovery, I am about to do the same thing for the first time at the ripe age of 38. I want to set an example for her to go after her dreams because there’s only one life to live as far as we know, with so much world to see and living to do.

So here goes everything.

Other Ways You Can Help

I know a lot of people out there are excited about this project and want to get involved but don’t have the financial resources to do so. Believe me, I know. I’ve taken my camera to many charity auctions, art shows and fundraisers because I knew I couldn’t afford to support the cause with my wallet. I supported with my time instead, as well as the promotional power of my camera.

If you can’t support this project financially, I would be grateful if you would help me promote it by sharing it far and wide using the hashtags #lampgirlscanadatour #lampgirls and @lampgirls.

Thank you!

 

Destination List

 

Halifax, Ottawa, Montreal, Toronto, Thunder Bay, Regina, Saskatoon, Winnipeg, Edmonton, Calgary, Vancouver and more as we book more shoots.

story:
About the Artist
Christine Jimenez, was born and raised in Quezon City, Philippines and resides in London, England. 
Christine has been a fan of Lea Salonga since the age of 6 and with Miss Saigon opening the doors to many Filipino actors including her idol, it also opened her to the world of theatre.  She grew up listening to the songs of Miss Saigon, memorising each and every line.  With the influence of her sister, she started liking Les Misérables, the first professional production of a musical she has seen in Manila.  
From there on, Christine had been painting caricatures and portraits of stage actors and giving it to them at the stage door. Most of them are from Les Misérables or its alumni. She had been featured on Broadway World on separate occasions and in the gossip section of What’s Onstage. (Up to this day, she doesn’t know why they would place a little tidbit on her in the gossip section.) 
In 2009, Christine moved to London. She dreams of one day having an art exhibition showcasing two of her passions, painting and theatre.

Artworks
There would be about 50 paintings are done in watercolour on 15” x 20” paper.  Most of which are signed by West End actors. A small picture of the cast holding their art will be place in the frame, if available.
Several prints of drawings throughout the years will also be displayed.

Names of people drawn in the collection

• Sir Cameron Mackintosh (autographed)
• Jamie Parker, Guys and Dolls (autographed)
• James McAvoy, The Ruling Class (autographed)
• Joshua Maguire, The Ruling Class (autographed)
• Mark Strong, A View From The Bridge (autographed)
• Emun Elliot, A View From The Bridge (autographed)
• Damien Lewis, American Buffalo (autographed)
• Benedict Cumberbatch, Hamlet
• Gemma Arterton, Made in Dagenham (autographed)
• Scott Garnham, Made in Dagenham (autographed)
• Peter Lockyer, Les Misérables (autographed)
• David Thaxton, Les Misérables  (autographed)
• Tom Hiddleston, Coriolanus (Print) (autographed)
• Jon Jon Briones, Miss Saigon (autographed)
• Eva Noblezada, Miss Saigon  (autographed by Eva, Boublil and Schönberg)
• Jonny Purchase, Les Misérables  (autographed)
• Julia Abueva, Miss Saigon  (autographed)
• Christian Marbella, Miss Saigon  (autographed)
• Lea Salonga, Miss Saigon 
• Rachelle Ann Go, Miss Saigon and Les Misérables  (autographed)
• Hugh Maynard, Miss Saigon  (autographed)
• Tanya Manalang, Miss Saigon  (autographed)
• Kwang-Ho Hong, Miss Saigon  (autographed)
• Brian Sears, Book of Mormon
• Stephen Ashfield, Book of Mormon
• Gavin Creel, Book of Mormon (Print)
• Jared Gertner, Book of Mormon (Print)
• Alexia Khademi, Book of Mormon (Print)
• Celinde Schoenmaker, Les Misérables  (autographed)
• Paul Wilkins, Les Misérables  (autographed)
• Michael Riseley, Les Misérables  (autographed)
• Matt Henry, Kinky Boots
• Killian Donnelly, Kinky Boots
• Niall Sheehy, Miss Saigon  (autographed)
• Callum Francis, Miss Saigon  (autographed) and Kinky Boots (Print)
• Matthew Seadon-Young, Urinetown (Print)
• Carrie Hope Fletcher, Les Misérables  (autographed)
• Rob Houchen, Les Misérables  (autographed)
• Michael Colbourne, Les Misérables  (autographed)
• Christian Edwards, Les Misérables  (autographed)
• Jeff Nicholson, Urinetown
• Simon Shorten, Les Misérables  (autographed)
• Alistair Brammer, Miss Saigon 
• Oliver Savile, Wicked (Print)
• Carolyn Maitland, Miss Saigon  (autographed)
• Dale Evans, Miss Saigon  (autographed)
• Amanda Woods, Miss Saigon  (Prince Edward Theatre FOH/dresser)  (autographed)
• Nathan Wright (Choreographer)
• Claira Vaughan (Choreographer)


The Event

I am aiming to have the art exhibition at the Lower Ground Floor of the Menier Gallery in London in April. The private viewing will be held on the first day of the event. 

Artworks will be divided in different sections:
• Les Misérables - This would be the focused of the art exhibition. This will feature the cast from 2014-2016 including Peter Lockyer, David Thaxton, Rachelle Ann Go, Carrie Hope Fletcher, to name a few.
• Miss Saigon - This would be before the Les Misérables display and will have the signed art of Sir Cameron Mackintosh at the end of the section.  
• Plays - This will feature artworks from the cast of A View From the Bridge, The Ruling Class, Hamlet, and American Buffalo.
• Musicals - This would feature actors from different musicals like Book of Mormon, Urinetown, Made in Dagenham and Kinky Boots. 
• Print - This area will be the featured first. Showing different prints of art from the past.  Tom Hiddleston in Coriolanus, Oliver Seville and Callum Francis as Fiyero and Lola from Wicked and Kinky Boots, the original principal cast of the Book of Mormon in which the art was sold to help those affected by Typhoon Haiyan.  


The whole exhibition cost will be over £6000 which will include 
• Gallery fee 
• Transportation
• Insurance
• Frames
•  Print cost
•  Opening day cost

story_txt:
About the ArtistChristine Jimenez, was born and raised in Quezon City, Philippines and resides in London, England. Christine has been a fan of Lea Salonga since the age of 6 and with Miss Saigon opening the doors to many Filipino actors including her idol, it also opened her to the world of theatre.  She grew up listening to the songs of Miss Saigon, memorising each and every line.  With the influence of her sister, she started liking Les Misérables, the first professional production of a musical she has seen in Manila.  From there on, Christine had been painting caricatures and portraits of stage actors and giving it to them at the stage door. Most of them are from Les Misérables or its alumni. She had been featured on Broadway World on separate occasions and in the gossip section of What’s Onstage. (Up to this day, she doesn’t know why they would place a little tidbit on her in the gossip section.) In 2009, Christine moved to London. She dreams of one day having an art exhibition showcasing two of her passions, painting and theatre.ArtworksThere would be about 50 paintings are done in watercolour on 15” x 20” paper.  Most of which are signed by West End actors. A small picture of the cast holding their art will be place in the frame, if available.Several prints of drawings throughout the years will also be displayed.

Names of people drawn in the collection

• Sir Cameron Mackintosh (autographed)• Jamie Parker, Guys and Dolls (autographed)• James McAvoy, The Ruling Class (autographed)• Joshua Maguire, The Ruling Class (autographed)• Mark Strong, A View From The Bridge (autographed)• Emun Elliot, A View From The Bridge (autographed)• Damien Lewis, American Buffalo (autographed)• Benedict Cumberbatch, Hamlet• Gemma Arterton, Made in (Print) (autographed)• Jon Jon Briones, Miss Saigon (autographed)• Eva Noblezada, Miss Saigon  (autographed by Eva, Boublil and Schönberg)• Jonny Purchase, Les Misérables  (autographed)• Julia Abueva, Miss Saigon  (autographed)• Christian Marbella, Miss Saigon  (autographed)• Lea Salonga, Miss Saigon • Rachelle Ann Go, Miss Saigon and Les Misérables  (autographed)• Hugh Maynard, Miss Saigon  (autographed)• Tanya Manalang, Miss Saigon  (autographed)• Kwang-Ho Hong, Miss Saigon  (autographed)• Brian Sears, Book of Mormon• Stephen Ashfield, Book of Mormon• Gavin Creel, Book of Mormon (Print)• Jared Gertner, Book of Mormon (Print)• Alexia Khademi, Book of Mormon (Print)• Celinde Schoenmaker, Les Misérables  (autographed)• Paul Wilkins, Les Misérables  (autographed)• Michael Riseley, Les Misérables  (autographed)• Matt Henry, Kinky Boots• Killian Donnelly, Kinky Boots• Niall Sheehy, Miss Saigon  (autographed)• Callum Francis, Miss Saigon  (autographed) and Kinky Boots Christian Edwards, Les Misérables  (autographed)• Jeff Nicholson, Urinetown• Simon Shorten, Les Misérables  (autographed)• Alistair Brammer, Miss Saigon • Oliver Savile, Wicked (Print)• Carolyn Maitland, Miss Saigon  (autographed)• Dale Evans, Miss Saigon  (autographed)• Amanda Woods, Miss Saigon  (Prince Edward Theatre FOH/dresser)  (autographed)• Nathan Wright (Choreographer)• Claira story:
About

FOCUS (A COVID-19 Charity Zine) is exactly what the name suggests. We are creating a non profit zine (short term for magazine) with the purpose of helping those in need during this COVID-19 pandemic. 

Our goal with this project is to bring ‘focus’ to the often overlooked positivity that occurred and is occuring during the COVID-19 pandemic: people reaching out to relatives, opportunity to pursue hobbies materializing, time for self care and self study appearing. In short, we hope to bring a bit of positivity during these relatively negative times.

In case you missed them, our socials are focuscharityzine on insta and tumblr, and zinefocus on twitter.

 

What we offer:

The zine was brought to light with the help and efforts of our talented team of artists. Themed around the positive occurrences during the pandemic, It’s an all-round feel good zine that we hope will make you smile.

The zine features:

  • 40 + full colour page illustrations (little to no text, so can be enjoyed by anyone)
  • A5 (21 x 14.8 cm) portrait 
  • Soft cover with Perfect binding
  • Made 100% with recycled paper (environment friendly)

Outside the physical zine are available:

  • A collection of digital phone wallpapers of some pieces featured in the zine 
  • A digital version of the zine

Stretch goals

All physical zine purchases have a chance to receive free merchandise made exclusively by the graphic moderators upon hitting sales goals. They are :

35 physical orders - Focus charity button

55 physical orders-  Focus die cut sticker 

70 physical orders- Focus holographic print

We will consider making more stretch goals if sales go well!

 

(this offer is only included for physical copy orders)

 

 

Chosen Charity

It is an understatement to say that COVID-19 has made an impact on us all. 

With it being perhaps the most widespread and influential pandemic of the past century, it is now painfully clear how crucial of a role health plays in our daily lives and the importance of protecting it.

This is why we are excited to be donating to Doctors Without Borders (Médecins Sans Frontières). They are a Swiss-based non-profit charity whose goal is to bring doctors anywhere they are needed, ignoring restrictions that would usually be placed on them due to different governments, budget problems or other forces.

They've worked to provide COVID-19 relief in over 70 countries worldwide through volunteer-led expeditions; these accomplishments, along with our values to help struggling international individuals, made them the perfect choice to fund.

After covering creation, shipping and other budget costs, all of the money will go to ‘Doctors without Borders’, 

 

 

 

 

Funding and Budgeting

While we plan for all of our profits to go towards ‘Doctors Without Borders’, we have several expenses that must be covered to determine campaign success.

Essentially our budget of 750 euros will pay for:

 

 

 If we fail to raise the sufficient amount of money to cover our costs after the campaign ends, we will proceed to continue our campaign on eBay until the minimum production cost is covered.

 

 

 

 

Shipping/Schedule

Pre-orders for FOCUS (A COVID-19 Charity Zine) will run from the 1st of December to the 15th of January

Due to current restrictions on travel and shipment, we have devised a tentative schedule of the projects journey:

  • 1 December- 15 of January- project runs
  • 20th of January- every physical item ordered and digital goods dispensed
  • Production of items will be from 3 to 1 months (incluiding shipping said items to Head Mod Med for checking quality and packaging)
  • Delivery estimated in May- End of July (due to potantial virus-caused delays)

In order to maximise our donation, we ask that customers pay for shipping of any physical orders made.For convenience, the zines will be shipped from France and adjust to local shipping prices.

France:

  Zine- 4 euros

Rest of the World (including Europe) :

Zine - 8 euros

Due to the almost doubling of costs (especially for international orders), we will not be offering ups tracking with the shipping. If you would like tracking on your order regardless, please contact us at focuscharityzine@gmail.com.

 Any stretch goals will be included in the packages at no additional cost

 

 

 

Our Artists

FOCUS is comprised of  16 individual creators who have selflessly volunteered their time and efforts to make a beautiful and positive impact. You can find their relevant social media pages below:

Instagram:

 @eirlysie / @qquoe / @panstarri / @offpeach / @rayleearts / @kur_ui / @fantellerhur / @nataliehaku / @teacloudii / @thesunnygo / @stephaugi / @oletarts / @_speed_riri_

Twitter:

 @enghurrd / @anush_arts / @roker_flower

We’d also like to also say a massive thank you to those who applied but didn’t make it into the final zine. We appreciate all the support that you have given this project!

The Mods

Nice to meet you! This zine started as a passion project between three friends stuck during the first major lockdown in Spain. The negative news projected everywhere made us want to make a positive change, while somehow helping the relief efforts

Our team is made up of three creatives who just wanted to spread a bit of positivity during this pandemic. We’re all avid art-lovers and we figured this would be the best way for us to do our part to help out, even if we are quite new to zine making!

You can find our relevant social medias below our stylized doodles

 

 

Questions and Concerns

We’d like to mention that this is our first time large-scale campaign and, while we’ve tried to have answers to all situations that may arise, if you have any other concerns or questions, please  don’t hesitate to look at our Q&A section or contact us at focuscharityzine@gmail.com or any of our socials. Questions are welcome and help improve the project!

Thank You!

Last, but certainly not least, we’d like to thank everyone who has helped support this project! Whether you’re someone who’s interested in donating, someone who sent in an application, one of our zine artists, or just simply someone who helped us get the word out, we really appreciate every single one of you and couldn’t have done this without your support. This project has been many months in the making and, thanks to you, we’ve been able to do our part and hope to spread a bit of positivity along the way.

Special thank you to Nat Chang (@coldergeist on twitter, tumblr, instagram and carrd) for her endless support during this project. Without her insights, this would not have been possible and her kindness and expertise will forever humble us. Check out her involvement on other zine projects on her socials as well as her personal artwork.

Stay safe

-The moderators

 

 By purchasing a zine copy, you will receive a magazine made by a multiracial team of creatives that will act as a positive momento for the otherwise unpleasant times while indirectly supporting medical professionals and the international virus victims that they are aiding. So thank you!

story:
Hello!

We are Etchr Lab. We believe art makes the world better and so we’re all about helping artists art. That’s how we became obsessed with (and pretty good at) creating highly specialized gear for creatives.

We started back in 2017 by crowdfunding where we raised over US$330K from 1,880 awesome backers to bring the ultimate Artist bag to life. Since then, we’ve been working with independent product designers, artists and art teachers to develop innovative, beautiful and very premium art supplies.

… we know our art supplies are out of reach for some but we’re not here to serve only those that can afford them. We’re here for artists of all walks of life - we’re here for you.

To stand true to this, we decided to take what we’ve learnt at the ultra-high end of town to deliver student-grade materials that we can be proud of, starting with watercolour paints.

 

 Watercolour doesn’t have to be overwhelming. 

 

 

If you want to get serious about mastering watercolour, then at some point you can’t skimp on materials - particularly the paper and paint.

The problem? Paint (and price) differs greatly between manufacturers. How do you even choose?! Unless you want to pay for a super expensive set from one of the ultra-premium brands, watercolour on a budget is… all over the place. It’s almost impossible to get a good set on your first try.

Trial and error is not only expensive but also disheartening – exactly what you don’t need when you’re just setting out on this journey!

 

Watercolour Paints: our Premium Student Series

 

 

We thought it was about time a brand took the guesswork out of paint selection to deliver simply the best student-grade watercolour paints directly to you.

We spent over a year sourcing watercolours from all over the world. We then put every paint through countless rounds of rigorous testing by our panel of professional watercolourists and instructors.

Finally, we hand-picked the best paints that would be priced in the ‘student-grade’ category and put together a set that achieves what we set out to do. These paints each exhibit the key characteristics that will help you develop as an artist: 

 

What is Lightfastness?

Lightfastness is the ability a dye or pigment has to endure light and retain its original colour over time. To sum it up, the better the level, the more resistant the colour is to fading when exposed to sunlight.

We conform to the Blue Wool Scale chart, which classifies lightfastness as listed below:

 

 

*Normal conditions of display: away from a window, under indirect sunlight and properly framed behind a UV protective glass.

For each colours' individual lightfastness level, please refer to the image below:

 

 

All our watercolours use Gum Arabic as the binding agent. As for details about transparency, pigment, or even colour names, we made this table for you:

 

 

What’s in the set?

 

 

Each box comes with:

  • 24 half pans with the colours: Pure White, Lemon Yellow, Just Yellow, Mighty Ochre, Llama Orange, Soft Orange, Simply Red, Rogue Red, Sweet Red, Pretty Pink, Royal Purple, Lime Green, Leaf Green, Emerald Green, Ocean Turquoise, Ultramarine Blue, Prussian Blue, Sky Blue, Cobalt Blue, Umber Brown, Brick Brown, Burnt Sienna, Dark Brown, Soulless Black.
  • Half pans come inside a black metal box for easy carry
  • 230g cold press 100% cotton paper for swatching (from our Etchr Sketchbooks)
  • Durable outer box for safe packaging and delivery (plus, the box is so cool that you can use it for whatever you’d like!)
  • A thank you note - because we could never do this if not for you!

 

PLUS! Stickers! All the stickers!

Everyone who backs our project will receive this exclusive Etchr sticker collection:

What’s In Each Reward?

 

 

Production Timeline

Our estimated delivery time is 2 months from launch date. We’ve been working on the Etchr Watercolour paints for a while now, and production has already kicked off.

After running the numbers, here’s how we believe things will pan out: 

 

 

Meet our Team 

Etchr Lab just turned three years old. Over the past year the team grew a bit bigger and more capable of tackling (lost count of how many) plenty campaigns!
