230g cold press 100% cotton paper for swatching (from our Etchr Sketchbooks)
Durable outer box for safe packaging and delivery (plus, the box is so cool that you can use it for whatever you’d like!)
A thank you note - because we could never do this if not for you!
 PLUS! Stickers! All the stickers!Everyone who backs our project will receive this exclusive Etchr sticker collection:What’s In Each Reward?  Production TimelineOur estimated delivery time is 2 months from launch date. We’ve been working on the Etchr Watercolour paints for a while now, and production has already kicked off.After running the numbers, here’s how we believe things will pan out:   Meet our Team Etchr Lab just turned three years old. Over the past year the team grew a bit bigger and more capable of tackling (lost count of how many) plenty campaigns!

story:
Le festival "Mtl en Arts" a besoin de vous !

The festival " Mtl in Arts " needs you 


Cet été, la rue Sainte Catherine de Montréal est investie par le 16ème  festival Mtl en Arts, manifestation où des artistes professionnels et amateurs exposent en pleine rue. L'événement aura lieu du 1er au 5 juillet 2015. Cette année, nous avons lancé un appel de projet participatif via les réseaux sociaux pour animer les rues du festival et l’engouement fut tel, que nous avons beaucoup de projets très intéressants mais pas assez de budget pour tous les réaliser. 

C’est pourquoi nous avons décidé de tenter l’expérience Indiegogo  pour récolter des fonds !

This summer, Montreal Sainte- Catherine street will litterally be invaded by the 16th edition of festival Mtl in Arts,from July 1 to 5,  with its artists and performers both amateurs and professionnals. This year, we issued an appeal of participative project via the social networks to liven up the streets of the festival and the craze was such, that we got many very interesting projects but not enough budget to realize them all.

That is why we decided to try the experience Indiegogo to collect the necessary funds to realize most of them if not all. 


Mtl en Arts c’est quoi ?

Mtl en Arts est la plus grande galerie à ciel ouvert de l’est du Canada. La GaleRue d’art s’étend sur plus d’un kilomètre sur la rue commerciale la plus importante de Montréal, soit la rue Sainte-Catherine, fermée à la circulation tout l’été dans le centre-sud. Mtl en Arts offre aux visiteurs une occasion exceptionnelle de rencontrer des artistes issus de toutes les disciplines des arts visuels, professionnels ou émergents, et de se procurer une œuvre directement de l’artiste.

Bien plus qu’une exposition en plein air, Mtl en Arts offre une programmation diversifiée : des installations, de la peinture en direct, et plusieurs activités participatives tout le long du parcours de l'événement. Près de 50 000 personnes par jour viennent voir la GaleRue d’art à chaque année.

L’atmosphère conviviale et décontractée crée un terreau fertile pour l’échange et la rencontre grâce auquel le grand public se sensibilise et s’initie à l’art. Les artistes, pour leur part, bénéficient d’une rétroaction directe et immédiate du public, et d’un accès à une toute nouvelle clientèle. C’est ainsi que l’événement, qui en est à sa 16e édition, orchestre annuellement une démystification et une démocratisation majeure des arts visuels.

What's Mtl en Arts?

Mtl en Arts is the greatest open air art gallery in eastern Canada. The BoulevArt expands over a one-kilometre stretch of Montreal’s main artery, Sainte-Catherine Street, closed to the automobile traffic all summer. The event offers festival goers a unique opportunity to meet artists from various backgrounds, professionals and emerging artists, and to purchase artworks directly from the artists. In 2015, close to 120 artists, exhibitors and performers will take the street during 5 days. Over 200 000 people walk on the BoulevArt.

More than an open-air exhibition, Mtl en Arts presents a rich and diversified program: immersive installations, live painting, interactive projects.

Mtl en Arts's convivial and relax atmosphere is a fertile ground for exchanges and encounters, allowing the public to familiarize with art. The artists can benefit from a direct feedback from the public and have access to a whole new clientele. This is how for 16 years, Mtl en Arts has been actively demystifying and democratizing visual arts in the heart of the city of Montreal.




Projets participatifs :

Les projets que nous avons reçus sont tous très originaux. Ils  souhaitent  prendre vie sur la rue Sainte Catherine dans le cadre de Mtl en Arts. Nous voulons tout faire pour pouvoir les réaliser ! Il ne nous manque plus qu’un petit coup de pouce de votre part pour permettre à ses projets de se réaliser et vous aurez le plaisir d'y participer par la suite ! Les projets impliqueraient la participation d’au moins 50 artistes pendant 3 jours comme des projets d’ateliers créatifs pour enfants, création en direct, murales collectives, plusieurs installations, des performances et des interventions participatives.

Cette année s’annonce comme étant très active et très originale ! On compte sur vous !

Participative projects

The projects  we received are all very original. They all want to take a live form  along Sainte Catherine street. We are only  lacking  a little bit of help from you to allow these  projects to come true! We ask you to help us  realize these projects. The projects would involve the participation of at least 50 artists during 3 days, like the collective wall, live children workshops , creation, several installations and performances, and participative interventions.

             A quoi serviront les 10 000$ ?

Les 10 000$ serviront à bonifier le nombre d'animations sur la rue Sainte-Catherine et ce montant sera entièrement utilisé pour les projets participatifs. Le coût de la réalisation de certains projets est élevé mais leur portée sociale peut être très importante. Le cachet des artistes est à prévoir dans la somme ainsi que le coût du matériel. Idéalement, nous voudrions financer quinze projets participatifs qui se dérouleront sur trois jours, du vendredi au dimanche pendant le festival.

Ces projets vont animer et donner de la visibilité au festival, grâce notamment aux partages sur les réseaux sociaux qui devraient être très actifs.

Grâce au hashtag #mtlenarts que nous placerons près des installations, nous voulons privilégier la diffusion d’information pour donner envie au public de venir fouler la rue Sainte Catherine !

10,000$ will be used for ?

$10 000 will be used to improve the number of animations on Sainte- Catherine St. and this amount will be completely used for the participative projects. The cost of some projects is important but their social impact can even be more important. The artist’s fee as well as material costs are included. Ideally, we would want to finance fifteen participative projects which will take place for three days, from Friday to Sunday during the festival. 

These projects are going to give a great  visibility to the festival, due to the sharings on the social networks which should be very active.

Thanks to the hashtag #mtlenarts which we shall place near the installations we want to favor the diffusion of the information.


                   Ces projets ont besoin de vous !

Voici donc un bref aperçu des projets. Nous ne souhaitons pas tout dévoiler à l'avance. La surprise sera plus intense ! Nous pouvons quand même vous assurez que tous les projets sélectionnés sont formidables ! 

Notre objectif : animer la rue sainte-Catherine sur la totalité du site. Plusieurs installations 3D de grandes envergures, des performances participatives originales qui vous feront passer par toutes sortes d'émotions, un volet pour les enfants dont un nouveau projet  'Ma première expo' qui est une invitation à l’intention  des enfants de 7 à 12 ans qui ont de l’intérêt pour les arts visuels à venir créer une œuvre en compagnie d’artistes professionnels. Le but est d’offrir aux enfants une première vitrine au public en y exposant leur œuvre virtuellement.

Nous comptons aussi sur  plusieurs artistes dans le cadre d'Art Battle Canada et du Virus d'improvisation picturale etc... Voici un aperçu de ce qui pourrait se passer dans le cadre du prochain Mtl en Arts. 

These projects need you.

Our objective : liven up Sainte-Catherine St. on the entire site. Several big scales 3D installations, original participative performances which will give you all sorts of emotions. One project for children “My first exhibition“ which is an invitation to the children 7 to 12 years old who have interest for the visual arts to come and create artworks with professional artists. The purpose is to offer the children their first impression of exhibiting their art work to the public.

We also count on several artists from Art Battle Canada and of the Virus of pictorial improvisation etc... Here is an overview of what could take place within the framework of the next Mtl in Arts program. 


Comment contribuer ?

Participez financièrement via Indiegogo en choisissant la contrepartie qui vous inspire à droite de la page. Peu importe le montant, toutes les contributions sont précieuses !

La plupart des contreparties seront distribuées après le festival.

How to contribute?
Participate financially via Indiegogo by choosing the counterparty which inspires you on  the right side  of the page. No matter the amount, all contributions are precious!

The counterparties will be distributed after the festival.


Le t-shirts / The T-shirts



L'affiche (18'' x 24'') / The poster (18'' x 24'')


Choisissez votre oeuvre  / Choose your masterpiece

Contribution de 500 $ : Tableau 5' x 4'

500$  contribution : 5’ X 4’ art work

http://bit.ly/1DUaUaE


Contribution de 400 $ : Tableau 4' x 4'

400$ contribution : 

http://bit.ly/1H1MsJ9


Contribution de 250 $ : Tableau 3' x 4'

250$ contribution

http://bit.ly/1EdgyWL


Contribution de 125 $ : Tableau 2' x 2'

125$ contribution

http://bit.ly/1GRhLno


Merci de votre aide, n’hésitez pas à partager la page dans vos réseaux ! 

Thank you for your help and  do not hesitate to share the page via your networks!

story:
Playa Grass Ballet

Playa Grass Ballet is an organic, nature inspired gathering point on Inner Playa. It is place of shade in the blazing afternoon sun, a cozy crescent shaped amphitheater facing sunrise, a kinetic, moving skyscape viewpoint when looking up through it and a solid, cooling touchstone for grounding at any time.

8 tons of granite base, 39 eighteen to thirty foot tall abstract aluminum blades of grass that move with the wind, color changing LED up-lighting all night long and a soft trance soundtrack emanating from the stones.

  • Conceived and created by Owen William "FlowStar" Fritts in 2016 as a repeatable, series sculpture for public parks the Grass Ballet collection has been fabricated in multiple configurations and installed in numerous open spaces around the USA.
  • This will be year 11 on Playa for FlowStar and after many years contributing to others’ artworks and to the building and guarding of our Temple year after year it’s time for his original artwork to be shared with the community.
  • FlowStar has already fabricated this massive sculpture, fully self funded, at his Santa Fe, NM studio. It is ready to go.
  • Your help in getting Playa Grass Ballet to and from BRC will complete the project and get you a piece of the artwork in exchange.

What We Need & What You Get

We need fuel and transit expenses. It is a three day journey to Playa using "Boomer" the studio’s 1990 International 4600 boom truck with a 14' steel bed. It’s another three day journey back. Our truck runs on Biodiesel or regular diesel. Bio is a bit more difficult to find but that's our preference. With current prices we will incur about $2,000 in diesel costs. The truck also must be oiled and greased for the trip and the hydraulic boom system needs new filters and a top off, another $500. Total ask is $2,500. IndieGoGo gets 5% of whatever we raise here. Any overages will go to offsetting the fabrication costs for Playa Grass Ballet which currently stand above $75,000.

We plan on arriving on Playa Sunday, August 19, building all through Build Week, then sharing the experience during Burn Week and will complete Strike by Wednesday, September 5. Add the six days of RT transit and we are committing 22 days to bringing Playa Grass Ballet to our global tribe at BRC. 

Perks:

  • Stickers
  • T-Shirts
  • Chiffon Scarves
  • Grass Blade Earrings
  • Grass Blade Pendants
  • Actual Grass Blade(s) set in Granite

Almost there:

Our last hurdle is transportation to and from Black Rock City. 8 tons of granite is a lot to move around, and our old truck need to be fed and maintained. This is the final 2% of project costs.

Join our Grass Ballet family:

  • Stop by Playa Grass Ballet, near Temple, and say hi. We offer hydration and hugs!
  • Please share this with all your Burner and Burner-curious friends.

Thanks, see you in the dust...

story:
Short Story Short

We need NEW Patches for the Gear Websites store

  • Drop $50 now on a patch bundle
  • Everything we raise durring the campaign will go to new Patch Designs
  • As soon as they arrive we send you One of EACH
  • More we can raise  = More Designs WE can MAKE
  • You will get a Massive Patch Batch !!
  • Shipped FREE to USA

Help us buy more than we could without your perk
Your participation will help us purchase new 2018 inventory for the store

Seven (7) Confirmed Designs (so far):

  • NEW  7.62x39 Spam Can
  • Chair is Against the Wall (#1 in a Series)
  • Bacon Panckakes
  • F You Media in PVC
       (This one will NOT be sold in the store)  

You are investing in Gear Websites

Thank You, we will ship you our entire new 2018 line, as soon as they arrive
Your Patches will be the first of these designs to be sent out,
in a padded plastic envelope with tracking & insurance via USPS
Your Patch Batch perk will allow us to purchase higher quantites, at a lower prices
You are Helping us Make Money, and that keeps us on the line and on the road

 YOU ARE AWESOME 

Timeline

Campaign will Only Run 15 days - Aug 29th - Sept 13th
Patches will be Manufactured in Late Sept / Early Oct
They will Ship To us & Ship out to you Late Oct / Early Nov

  • Project Begins
    the day Skynet Becomes Self-Aware
    August 29th @ 12:00 am UTC+0
  • Project Ends
    Anniversary of the AWB Sunset
    Sept 13, 1994 - Sept 13, 2004
  • Patches will be ordered before
    the 2018     Gun Rights Policy Conference on
    Sept 22nd
  • Patches should arrive from our manufacturers
    by the Birthday of Mikhail Kalashnikov in 1919 on
    Nov 10
  • We plan to have all these
    In Your Hands by Cyber Monday 
    Or before, if we can make that happen

How Can we Pass the Time?

Oh I know, lets design the patches LIVE and do it on the road !!
Join us in LIVE chats on GunTube.org when we will design the new patches 
We will be on the road with the Gun Show Loophole Tour,
so we will be designing the patches in 6 states untill Sept 20th

More Patch Batches get Grabbed
More Designs we can Make

We have quite a few designs in mind already (12+).
And we will go LIVE as we design some of those

Some of our NEW Patch Designs

  • NEW 7.62x39 Spam Can
  • NEW Stripper Clip Colors
  • NEW Gun Channels Logo Patches !!
  • "Chair Is Against the Wall" 1st of a Series
  • Bacon Pancakes
  • Surprise Old West Guns Themed Patch 
  • New Media Press Patch - now in PVC
  • Red Dawn Stuff  ** ONLY available in this campaign, will NOT be in our store
  • F You Media in PVC !! ** ONLY available in this campaign, will NOT be in our store

As more Patch Batch'es get Grabbed,
we will Create & Send Out more NEW Patch Designs

  • AT Least 3 NEW patches per $50 Patch Batch - Even  if we don't reach the $3,333 Goal
  • 10 NEW patches per $50 Patch Batch at the $3,333 Goal
  • 15 NEW patches per $50 Patch Batch when we reach $4,000 
  • 20 NEW patches per $50 Patch Batch when we reach $5,000 

Maybe we can even get some Owl & Anchor
USA made Stickers too !!

No Risks or Challenges this time

  • We are using suppliers we have used many times in the past
  • There is NO fear of risk on this project

Hate Patches?
You Can Still Help 

If can't contribute, or don't want to, but still would like to help out our efforts.

Short Story Short
We need NEW Patches for the Gear Websites store


Drop $50 now on a patch bundle
Everything we raise durring the campaign will go to new Patch Designs
As soon as they arrive we send you One of EACH

More we can raise  = More Designs WE can MAKE
You will get a Massive Patch Batch !!
Shipped FREE to USA

Help us buy more than we could without your perkYour participation will help us purchase new 2018 inventory for the store
Seven (7) Confirmed Designs (so far):


NEW  7.62x39 Spam Can


Chair is Against the Wall (#1 in a Series)

Bacon Panckakes

F You Media in PVC   (This one will NOT be sold in the store)  




You are investing in Gear Websites
Thank You, we will ship you our entire new 2018 line, as soon as they arriveYour Patches will be the first of these designs to be sent out,in a padded plastic envelope with tracking & insurance via USPSYour Patch Batch perk will allow us to purchase higher quantites, at a lower pricesYou are Helping us Make Money, and that keeps us on the line and on the road
 YOU ARE AWESOME 


Timeline
Campaign will Only Run 15 days - Aug 29th - Sept 13thPatches will be Manufactured in Late Sept / Early OctThey will Ship To us & Ship out to you Late Oct / Early Nov


Project Beginsthe day Skynet Becomes Self-Aware August 29th @ 12:00 am UTC+0


Project EndsAnniversary of the AWB SunsetSept 13, 1994 - Sept 13, 2004


Patches will be ordered beforethe 2018 Gun Rights Policy Conference onSept 22nd


Patches should arrive from our manufacturersby the Birthday of Mikhail Kalashnikov in 1919 onNov 10

We plan to have all theseIn Your Hands by Cyber Monday Or before, if we can make that happen



How Can we Pass the Time?
Oh I know, lets design the patches LIVE and do it on the road !!Join us in LIVE chats on GunTube.org when we will design the new patches We will be on the road with the Gun Show Loophole Tour,so we will be designing the patches in 6 states untill Sept 20th

More Patch Batches get GrabbedMore Designs we can Make
We have quite a few designs in mind already (12+).And we will go LIVE as we design some of those
Some of our NEW Patch Designs

NEW 7.62x39 Spam Can

NEW Stripper Clip Colors
NEW Gun Channels Logo Patches !!
"Chair Is Against the Wall" 1st of a Series
Bacon Pancakes
Surprise Old West Guns Themed Patch 

New Media Press Patch - now in PVC


Red Dawn Stuff  ** ONLY available in this campaign, will NOT be in our store


F You Media in PVC !! ** ONLY available in this campaign, will NOT be in our store


As more Patch Batch'es get Grabbed,we will Create & Send Out more NEW Patch Designs


AT Least 3 NEW patches per $50 Patch Batch - Even  if we don't reach the $3,333 Goal


10 NEW patches per $50 Patch Batch at the $3,333 Goal


15 NEW patches per $50 Patch Batch when we reach $4,000 


20 NEW patches per $50 Patch Batch when we reach $5,000 


Maybe we can even get some Owl & AnchorUSA made Stickers too !!
No Risks or Challenges this time

We are using suppliers we have used many times in the past
There is NO fear of risk on this project

story:
One campaign is never enough when you play role playing games!

Weeeelcome to the Re-launch of the original one so that we can reach our base goal! 

Requiem for Greece is a community of Live Action Role Playing Games enthusiasts, created at February 2014. Right now, it numbers more than 70 active players in three major cities in Greece: Athens, Thessaloniki and Heraklion and a Storytelling team of 12.

Our chronicle is based on Vampire: The Requiem (Second Edition) by Onyxpath Publishing and counts over a hundred local live sessions and 8 countrywide gatherings that we like to call Grand Elysiums. It is a political horror game, taking place in an alternative and darker version of our world in the southern country of the Balkan peninsula, Greece.

These larger in scale, cross-city Events are the soul of our community. The backstory for these is created by the ongoing story of our Chronicle.

Players meet in one of the 3 cities to portray their characters and maneuver through the political scene of the dark creatures that are the focus of the story. These events are the best way for our community to get closer and also to connect the dots of the intercity plots.

The 9th Grand Elysium will take place  in Thessaloniki (Greece) during the 8th and 9th of December 2018. It will offer around 6 hours of gameplay each day.

The location that has been chosen for the event is an old Jewish inn called Bensousan Han ("han" in Turkish language means motel or inn) from the Ottoman Era. More info about the building and its history you can find in the links at the end of the description.

A big thanks for all the backers of the first campaign who helped us raise 732 euros for the Event! 

Through this campaign we plan to cover the remaining amount of the base costs of the event that include the following:

            

Even though the base goal will offer every participant a great LARP experience, we will be able to augment the event with some additions if we reach the following stretch goals.

With a stretch goal of 900 Euros the event will be filmed and a documentation video will be available online!

Further stretch goals will be announced in the future.

Players of "Requiem For Greece" will get another chance to participate in a cross-city event that will change the in-game story forever.

Guests will get the chance to leave their daily routine behind for a few hours and be invited to a special Gala. With our help and instructions, they will portray various characters and will have the opportunity to interact with the creatures of our Chronicle.  How immersive this interaction is going to be depends on them and the character they choose...

As for the Souvenirs included in the Perks... you can take a glimpse at the photos below. 

* Τhe Elixir in the picture is just a sample. The one you will get may look different as its handmade. ** The Dicebag does NOT include dice. You will have to use your own ^^

Even if you cant' participate, you have the chance to support our  community and make LARP experience more accessible in Greece.

Requiem for Greece is a team of LARP enthusiasts that focus on running a fun and immersive game. None of the members earns any income from this activity.

If money contribution is a complication for you, the event offers other opportunities for you to help.

For example, the event will be open for amateur photographers, musicians, and artists of any kind to show their work and enhance the experience for everyone else.

If you can think of any other way of helping, feel free to contacts us. Same goes in case you need more info about Requiem For Greece or Live action Role-playing generally.

Don’t forget to spread the word by using the Indiegogo sharing tools.

Requiem for Greece (Facebook)
Requiem for Greece (Website)
Bensousan Han (Facebook)

Contact info:
info@kindred.gr

story:
WE MOVED > FRAGMENTS STEP 2

We couldn’t imagine how amazing people's enthusiasm would feel. 110 backers helped reach our first goal!  These $10k helped us cover engineering fees and the fabrication of perks! We still have a lot of resources to find and cover for our step 2 fundraising >  Keep supporting the project on our new platform

Thank you ever so much!

Alix & The Fragments team

----------------

THE PROJECT

We are a non-profit and a team of creatives and builders based in Paris who have gathered together to bring Fragments to life. Fragments is a monumental mirror installation designed by Marc Ippon de Ronda for Burning Man 2019. We are very proud to have won the BLACK ROCK HONORARIA PROGRAM amongst hundreds of applications and be this year's French laureate. Fragments requires a huge budget ! To make the dream come true we need YOU!

JOIN the adventure!

WHY DO WE NEED YOUR HELP?

After planning and sketching for weeks, we want to make the project come true! We are extremely glad to have received a 27k Grant from Burning Man, but it only covers a part of  Fragments' total budget of around $150k! We need your help to raise some of the budget.

We have set out first goal at 10k to start the pre-production and will need more to keep going!

NB: This is an estimate if we can't find recycled materials, volunteers with pro skills. We'd be happy to find all that! See below if you want to help in that way.

The more we can raise here, the more amazing Fragments will be  :) Help us take Fragments to Burning Man and we will take a part of you there with us!

 

FRAGMENTS' CONCEPT 

Fragments represents a magical tale inspired by the Black Rock desert:

"It is said that before the Age of Human Kind, a powerful giant was given a magic mirror by a goddess that allowed him to see into the future. Frightened by what he could foresee he broke the mirror into a thousand fragments which fell from the sky and landed in the desert floor. The sand and winds blew and the pieces began to emerge as mankind too slowly emerged out of obscurity. When thereafter discovered, the mythical site was employed as a magical place for meditation and wisdom. And it is said that the first light of sunrise seen from the top of the highest fragment will bring infinite power and knowledge to those who visit the temple. "

With Fragments, a legend comes to life!

Marc Ippon de Ronda and Julio Araujo from  PLAC Studio designed a wonderfulanimation to illustrate the legend behind the Fragments temple. Look at the full video above to see it!

HOW WE WILL BUILD FRAGMENTS

We are working hard on the technical aspects to craft a beautiful and safe experience for all the citizens. Marc Ippon de Ronda, Rbhu and ATO Designs have taken into consideration the structural calculations to support the gravitational, wind and live loads across the triangular shards and the central staircase. Most elements will be built on site. During Burning Man, "Dusters" will remove dust from Fragments in a daily ritual and circulate it back on the Playa.

    WHAT YOUR PLEDGE WILL GO TO

    In more details, your pledge will help cover:

    • Materials, production, transportation, installation, and clean up  = approx $90,000
    • The specialty and safety services who will help us design an impeccable artwork = $35,000
    • Pre-production and team expenses: (external services, pre-production, architecture, communication, fundraising, press, travel expenses, and food ) = around $25,000

      

    HOW YOU CAN HELP!

    Now you know everything about Fragments, we hope you will want to turn it into reality as much as we do by donating or by backing us in other ways. Here is how you can help:

    • DONATE, "it takes every grain of sand to make a beach:" Every participation is welcome. The more we are to chip in, the more collaborative this work will feel! Donate early and leave a comment :)
    • VOLUNTEER: If you want to volunteer on-playa fill up our > volunteer form.
    • RECYCLE & GIVE : To follow the Burning Man principles, we would love to recycle materials and have in-kind donations. If you can donate/lend steel, RV, or supplies, tell us!
    • BECOME AN ART PATRON: We will issue tax deduction receipts for large donations. If you want to support by other means than crowdfunding write to us: contact@fragmentsart.org !
    • SHARING IS CARING: We need help to reach out! Share the project, call to action. For social media, use #fragments2019  & tag @fragmentsartproject. And for pros,  let us know if you need a press release.

    OUR CORE TEAM

     

    CONTACT & LINKS :

    To learn more about the project and about us, scroll & subscribe to our website mailing list and get exclusive news on our official website: https://fragmentsart.org/  

    FOLLOW US ON https://www.instagram.com/fragmentsartproject/

    CONTACT US AT contact@fragmentsart.org

    THEY SUPPORT US

    BURNING MAN Organization & the Black Rock City Honoraria Program

    ANOUSPARIS - An article (in French) about the artist and the project

     

    MOHO - The innovation spirit company invited Marc Ippon de Ronda to present his artistic practice and the Fragments project in a discussion about #creativedisruption and fostering change through #art .

RECYCLE & GIVE : To follow the Burning Man principles, we would love to recycle materials and have in-kind donations. If you can donate/lend steel, RV, or supplies, tell us!

OUR CORE TEAM CONTACT & LINKS :To learn more about the project and about us, scroll & subscribe to our website mailing list and get exclusive news on our official website: https://fragmentsart.org/  FOLLOW US ON https://www.instagram.com/fragmentsartproject/CONTACT US AT contact@fragmentsart.orgTHEY SUPPORT USBURNING MAN Organization & the Black Rock City Honoraria ProgramANOUSPARIS - An article (in French) about the artist and the project  MOHO - The innovation spirit company invited Marc Ippon de Ronda to present his artistic practice and the Fragments project in a discussion about #creativedisruption and fostering change through #art .

story:
a children's art studio

Love Lab Studio is about taking action, with children and community, to co-create a better + more just world for all. That sounds utopian, but we think that experimenting, with imagination, intention, and reflection, to co-create a better world is part of our work as human beings. And this starts with a children's studio.

Our studio is founded by artist Christina Bechstein (with awesome neighbors + collaborators) to support us all to make conscious creativity happen with simple materials, strategies, projects and tools that are good for us AND the environment.

Our bright new space will be thoughtfully curated for the needs of the children. We are located in a mixed residential and retail neighborhood in the West End of Portland, at the edge of a beautiful park and playground. We will support the tending of trees and plants at a nearby food forest, and plan to eventually harvest plums and make jam together!

love lab studio: what will we do?

Everything we do centers the art studio as both a place and an idea of creativity and imagination.One of our inspirations is the work of Detroit arts leader Josephine Herrald Love, who shared with us that "in art, allow the child to teach you about them - you are the learner, they are the teacher.”  Another is the child-centered and creative pedagogy developed in Reggio Emilia, Italy by Loris Malaguzzi. This places the “atelier” or art studio in the center of the learning environment as a collaborative element in the creation of projects and learning.

In summer 2018 our work is to launch the studio  & the community public art clay tile project.

For fall 2018, programming includes:

1. Children's art workshops.

Weekly + seasonal art workshops for children. Each workshop will incorporate natural materials and creative prompts, and respond to themes connected to the greater world around us, contemporary artists, nature and more.

2. Saplings Studio.

A creative, part-time learning + afterschool program. Co-created by a skilled teacher collaborative and offers hands-on learning in a joyful and playful atmosphere. Children engage in creative exploration of art, integrated reading and writing, and math skill development based in problem-solving. They learn in nature, in the community, and with each other. We value: the whole child through embodiment, diversity and inclusion within a caring community; the child as poet, communicator + participant through language development; the child as co-creator with project-based and individual learning; the child as artist through arts, creativity + imagination; and the child as community member, global & ecological citizen through community projects.

3. Community projects.

The studio will offer monthly First Friday art exhibitions that focus on work by children and the community. We'll also be collaborating with organizations, community members and neighbors on specific projects. Some of the projects we partner with and collaborate on currently include: The Portland Lantern Walk, a creative community and public art series that culminates in a large-scale community event in Deering Oaks Park, with Annie Leahy and Friends of Deering Oaks Park. Sister Makings is a group that meets regularly to co-create space for local and new neighbor sisters and their children to gather around conversation, food, service, gardening and craft. Community partners include Heartfelt School and Cultivating Community.

artists + teachers + caregivers: who we are

We are led by and collaborate with a caring group of teachers, artists, caregivers and community members. Our teachers are trained and skilled in a variety of pedagogies and skills including: studio art and craft, Waldorf, service learning, public school, Teachers College Reading and Writing Program, social sculpture,  Reggio Emilia, and more. Additionally, part of our team will include our community partners and community advisors. Love Lab Studio was founded by Christina Bechstein, a local artist, mother to Melu (age 6!) and educator. Christina has years of training and experience as a teacher of children, an art teacher, as associate professor of art and as a practicing community and public artist. She is grateful to have had wonderful mentors, and has a long record of creative, collaborative and community achievements and work.

opening the doors: what's needed

There are basic renovation costs to get the studio up and running!

We are grateful for the skilled design and construction support of the Barrett Made team in Portland, Maine. Dreaming up hanging systems and curtain walls to create a flexible creative community and exhibition space has been the vision of our friend Ronit Eisenbach. Our friend and local designer Jennifer Muller has graced us with our joyful new logo and sweet design perks. Local artists from Better Letter will paint our sweet sign, and local artists will sew cushions for our sitting + drawing window nooks. Our creative building + musician friends at Bondeko will be installing and co-creating our community art tile wall and sink area, amongst other creative work.

NATURAL AS WE CAN We work to be as natural, sustainable, recycled, mindful and healthy as we can be with all the renovations and materials.

NUTS + BOLTS We currently need to raise $20,000 to support the renovation of the space! The costs that will be covered in this amount in addition to permitting and design fees include the following:

  • Drawing + reading + visiting window nooks Cozy & inviting window seating for children and community with bright and soft cushions. Simple birch plywood seats with a plexi guard at the window will provide protection for little ones.
  • Art + tool hanging Giant sheets of homasote will be installed on walls with screws + washers and painted, to hold art and supporting sound absorption. Additional hanging systems influenced by the creative wisdom of the Shaker community will layer in pegs for hanging as needed.
  • Doors Safe, dry and warm front door and bathroom door with threshold (ADA compliant).
  • Tracks for curtains + track lighting Lighting for space and tracks for felt and voile curtains to divide and create a flexible and gorgeous working space.
  • Community clay wall + washing basin A long, narrow 6-foot farm sink will allow children to wash brushes and hands together. Above the washing sink will be a gorgeous community public art mosaic wall of small handmade clay tiles, each covered with marks made by children from Portland’s parks, food forests and urban gardens. Please note: additional patrons of public art clay wall needed.
  • Paint We will use soft yellows, cool blues and other colors from nature to support creativity and co-regulation of community and children in the space.
  • Signage Bright and joyful signage to hang outside and inside the space with names of all who contributed to the studio!

If additional funds are raised over our goal, they will support the cost of furniture, art supplies, a temporary accessibility ramp as needed, and the goal of funding a number of free spaces in every single children's class that we offer.

your gift will give

We believe in one human family and in the rights of every child. So the money raised isn't just about the art studio. Love Lab Studio campaign will also donate 10% of all funds raised to support RAICES Family Reunification Fund. This is an organization doing important on-the-ground work to support and reunify children who are being separated from their families.

our gift to you

The greatest gift we give by being a part of this project is a space where children and the community can express their creativity. We want you to know that for every gift you give, we will do our best to be present creatively to our children and community. We honor your gift, and will make the most of your contribution.

Additionally, we have perks for you!

Please look them over and let us know if you have any questions.

Are you part of a business and want to be one of our creative business partners? We'd love to chat and show off your support on our videos, printed materials + other stuff we create.

And now: the perks! The sweetest designed 'let's create...' bags, kiddo t-shirts + onesies to melt your heart. Plus workshops and consulting and all kinds of stuff. We've got the goods. If you want some combo of what isn't there, reach out!

thank you + more ways to be a part of Love Lab !

We need you to help us do this!

  • So: first, help us make some noise!!! Share, share, share away. We need many folks to see this and give what they can. This studio belongs to our children, and they need us to open the doors!
  • We are so grateful for you, thank you for being a part of our community.
  • xoxo, Sending you lots of love, creativity + the ability to take action!

Some of the projects we partner with and collaborate on currently include: The Portland Lantern Walk, a creative community and public art series that culminates in a large-scale community event in Deering Oaks Park, with Annie Leahy and Friends of Deering Oaks Park. Sister Makings is a group that meets regularly to co-create space for local and new neighbor sisters and their children to gather around conversation, food, service, gardening and craft. Community partners include Heartfelt School and Cultivating Community.
artists + teachers + caregivers: who we are
We are led by and collaborate with a caring group of teachers, artists, caregivers and community members. Our teachers are trained and skilled in a variety of pedagogies and skills including: studio art and craft, Waldorf, service learning, public school, Teachers College Reading and Writing Program, social sculpture,  Reggio Emilia, and more. Additionally, part of our team will include our community partners and community advisors. Love Lab Studio was founded by Christina Bechstein, a local artist, mother to Melu (age 6!) and educator. Christina has years of training and experience as a teacher of children, an art teacher, as associate professor of art and as a practicing community and public artist. She is grateful to have had wonderful mentors, and has a long record of creative, collaborative and community achievements and work.

opening the doors: what's needed
There are basic renovation costs to get the studio up and running!
We are grateful for the skilled design and construction support of the Barrett Made team in Portland, Maine. Dreaming up hanging systems and curtain walls to create a flexible creative community and exhibition space has been the vision of our friend Ronit Eisenbach. Our friend and local designer Jennifer Muller has graced us with our joyful new logo and sweet design perks. Local artists from Better Letter will paint our sweet sign, and local artists will sew cushions for our sitting + drawing window nooks. Our creative building + musician friends at Bondeko will be installing and co-creating our community art tile wall and sink area, amongst other creative work.NATURAL AS WE CAN We work to be as natural, sustainable, recycled, mindful and healthy as we can be with all the renovations and materials.
NUTS + BOLTS We currently need to raise $20,000 to support the renovation of the space! The costs that will be covered in this amount in addition to permitting and design fees include the following:


Drawing + reading + visiting window nooks Cozy & inviting window seating for children and community with bright and soft cushions. Simple birch plywood seats with a plexi guard at the window will provide protection for little ones.

Art + tool hanging Giant sheets of homasote will be installed on walls with screws + washers and painted, to hold art and supporting sound absorption. Additional hanging systems influenced by the creative wisdom of the Shaker community will layer in pegs for hanging as needed.

Doors Safe, dry and warm front door and bathroom door with threshold (ADA compliant).

Tracks for curtains + track lighting Lighting for space and tracks for felt and voile curtains to divide and create a flexible and gorgeous working space.

Community clay wall + washing basin A long, narrow 6-foot farm sink will allow children to wash brushes and hands together. Above the washing sink will be a gorgeous community public art mosaic wall of small handmade clay tiles, each covered with marks made by children from Portland’s parks, food forests and urban gardens. Please note: additional patrons of public art clay wall needed.

Paint We will use soft yellows, cool blues and other colors from nature to support creativity and co-regulation of community and children in the space.

Signage Bright and joyful signage to hang outside and inside the space with names of all who contributed to the studio!

If additional funds are raised over our goal, they will support the cost of furniture, art supplies, a temporary accessibility ramp as needed, and the goal of funding a number of free spaces in every single children's class that we offer.
your gift will give
We believe in one human family and in the rights of every child. So the money raised isn't just about the art studio. Love Lab Studio campaign will also donate 10% of all funds raised to support RAICES Family Reunification Fund. This is an organization doing important on-the-ground work to support and reunify children who are being separated from their families.

our gift to you
The greatest gift we give by being a part of this project is a space where children and the community can express their creativity. We want you to know that for every gift you give, we will do our best to be present creatively to our children and community. We honor your gift, and will make the most of your contribution.
Additionally, we have perks for you!
Please look them over and let us know if you have any questions.
Are you part of a business and want to be one of our creative business partners? We'd love to chat and show off your support on our videos, printed materials + other stuff we create.
And now: the perks! The sweetest designed 'let's create...' bags, kiddo t-shirts + onesies to melt your heart. Plus workshops and consulting and all kinds of stuff. We've got the goods. If you want some combo of what isn't there, reach out!
thank you + more ways to be a part of Love Lab !
We need you to help us do this!

So: first, help us make some noise!!! Share, share, share away. We need many folks to see this and give what they can. This studio belongs to our children, and they need us to open the doors!
We are so grateful for you, thank you for being a part of our community.
xoxo, Sending you lots of love, creativity + the ability to take action!

story:
Help Us Bring the Mad Sorcerer's Workshop To the Playa!

We've formed this campaign to raise funds to help bring the New York Region's Guild project to the playa.

The Regional art installations at Burning Man are positioned on the Midway -- a circle of carnival-like craft and gaming awesomeness booths around the base of the Man.  This year, keeping with the DaVinci theme, the Regional installations are called "Guild Workshops", and are made to resemble medieval artisan guilds.  The guild representing New York is called, The Mad Sorcerer's Workshop, and we're perfectly positioned at 4 o'clock on the Midway:

 

We think anyone can be a budding Vinci-esque sculptor, and we're here to help you get started.  We use modeling clay and encouragement to help visitors express their creativity, no matter their level of dexterity.  Each visitor will make a creature out of play-doh.  So, if you make a green cow, and I make a polka dot tree, together our creatures form an alien pastoral scene.  Now, put them into a custom-made multi-level infinity box, and there's a whole herd of awesome cows grazing by a forest of trees.  

  

The project's mission is to evoke images of medieval sorcerers and mages, who would mess around with the elements, create homunculi and other odd mythical creatures, and generally control their versions of the universe. That's why we're calling the booth Mad Sorcerer's Workshop!!! ​

 

Make  a little clay Man, put him inside an infinity cabinet, and start a whole new world, populated by hundreds little clay homunculi.  And if the next person who comes into the booth makes a little clay UFO, then your Man and their UFO will interact, and the world just got interesting!  The more visitors we get, the more worlds within worlds we build.

Who is this for?  Kids aged 2 to 102.

Why contribute?  To help bring a kid-friendly project to the playa!  We invite participants of all ages and abilities to explore and express their creativity, and both kids and adults can volunteer to help at the booth!  

We aim to support everyone's creative ability

....even if they think they don't have any!

 

What We Need & What You Get

  • We are seeking to raise $3000 to cover 
  • Event insurance
  • Truck Rental
  • Last-minute and unexpected supplies
  • Helping low-income crew members with travel costs 

The Impact

  • The project allows people of all ages, backgrounds, and abilities to interact collaboratively.
  • We're help break the ice, so visitors can meet and chat over the crafting table.
  • It's fun!!!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

You can help in various ways:

  • Share this campaign with your social networks.
  • Air miles are welcome!
  • Volunteer on playa, help man our booth, meet people!  To volunteer, visit our FB page at: https://www.facebook.com/Mad-Sorcerer-169858161... .


Rewards:

The Atmananda Yoga Mat

 

Halloween Pumpkin Arrangement

To be delivered in October, these unique pumpkins are planted with colorful assortments of succulents, and are a perfect way to show your design chops on Halloween.  (Due to their weight and delicate nature, these pumpkins are only available for pick up in the five boroughs and Nassau.)

 

Refrigerator Magnet Live Garden

Delicate and long-lasting.  Pop on your fridge, water once a week, amaze your friends.

Rollerblading and Dance Skating Lessons

Cecile Klaus (http://www.rioroller.com/the-missiles-interview/) is a medal-winning skate racer and professional dancer.  She is the head of the international Miss'ile (https://www.facebook.com/Missile-435395883147011/) skate team, and has performed in music videos and on TV.  We are very privileged to have her teach private lessons for us!  

 

The Networks

Gil Hova of Formal Ferret Games (https://gil.hova.net/the-networks/) has agreed to show us his newest creation!  Gil's 2015 Bad Medicine sold out, so here is your chance to snag his next game, hot off the press!  Tom Vasel  of The Dice Tower (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SNZyf-IYOQw) and No Pun Included (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=l9RDVCM82g8) loved it, and so will your party guests :).

 

IT Lessons

Wish you understood how your computer works?  Want a primer on HTML or Photoshop?  Darya Mars is a former Amazon engineer, and has tutored beginners of all ages.  

 

Dan Williams Photography

Dan is The headshot photographer we go to, and he's expanding to flow arts!  Dan's eye and dedication to getting the best shot have earned him a thriving practice and magazine covers (http://www.dlwphotographynyc.com/#!/page/255634...).  Dan is community-friendly, patient and warm.  He even helped us unclench and look good in our headshots.  We're so happy to have him with us!

story:
This campaign has ended, but we still need your support!

 

Please visit our live campaign to make a tax-deductible donation. Thank you!!

 

 

_____________________________________

 

Help us create a tree of life...

Imagine a towering, lifelike tree. It's nearly four stories tall and wide enough to hold 60 climbers in its limbs. The bark is sculpted and painted by hand to look impossibly alive.

There are tiny LED lights hidden within each leaf. At night, the leaves begin to glow. Together, the 25,000 leaves form the largest "light canvas" in the world. Lying beneath the tree and looking up, you're enveloped in colors, shapes and patterns that move to music through the canopy above you.

Instead of giving control of this canvas to a single artist, imagine we put sensors around the tree that empower YOU to control the canopy lights using your voices, movements, and biorhythms.  

Finally, imagine we open-sourced the control software so that any artist or technologist around the world could create unforgettable light art for this new medium. 

What would happen? What things would you experience under this magical tree of life?

Find out beneath the Tree of Ténéré.  

 

Our inspiration

We were inspired by a tree that once grew in the middle of the Sahara desert, in a region called Ténéré. It was the most isolated tree on Earth: not a single other tree could be seen for 250 miles. And yet, the tree became an important ceremonial gathering place for traders and travelers as they crossed the desert. It brought people together for community, ritual and rest.

It was mysteriously destroyed almost 50 years ago.

Let's bring this tree back to life. Let's create a natural space of contemplation, community, creativity, and play. Help us bring Ténéré to Burning Man 2017 and then to cities and festivals around the world.

 

Come climb...

Nearly four stories tall, Ténéré lets climbers rekindle their childhood love of adventure and awe for nature.

We designed and engineered Ténéré to support the weight of 60 climbers, with construction already underway in southern California. Made from hand-sculpted fiberglass and hand-painted resin, the bark looks and feels so real you’ll think you’re climbing a living tree.

 

...and create

At night, hidden LEDs within each leaf come to life. The leaves begin to glow. Together, these 25,000 LED leaves form a massive, dome-shaped "canvas of light."

 

Using our open-source tools, artist and technologists around the world are creating experiences for this canvas that you will never forget.

Lying beneath the tree at night, you'll look up and see stunning colors, shapes and patterns move through the treetop in synchrony with soothing music. We’ll host live events as well: imagine a DJ, choir or orchestra up in the tree, controlling the canopy with their music.

 

At other times, YOU get to control the tree. Hidden sensors and simple wearables let you activate the LED leaves through sound (chanting, humming, singing, words), biorhythms like heartbeat, and movement. Imagine harmonizing with others under the tree or shouting names of colors to create mind-bending patterns. Someone passes you a Fitbit: when you slip it onto your wrist, 25,000 leaves begin pulsing to the beat of your heart.

We're creating this canvas in partnership with the Symmetry Labs team. You have to see their past work to believe it:

 

We can't do this without you! Two ways you can help:
 

  1. Please consider making a generous donation to support this project. We have amazing perks for supporters and donations are tax-deductible
     
  2. Please share this campaign on Facebook and via email with your friends.

We can't thank you enough, and we can't wait to see you under the Tree of Ténéré.

 

Meet the team

ALEX GREEN, CO-LEAD ARTIST & SYMMETRY LABS CEO

My work as an artist and technologist bridges the digital and physical worlds. Before pursuing interactive art I was a physicist and jazz musician; both science and music remain lasting sources of inspiration in my work. I try to push the boundaries of both knowledge and expression through art -- often my projects require technological innovation as well as custom fabrication.

Over the last few years, I've been focused on building modular "light instruments": volumetric lighting blocks with sophisticated software that can be played like a musical instrument. My work has been featured in Gizmodo, Creators Project, Discovery Channel’s In The Making, an upcoming PBS documentary on the future of art called Ineffable with violinist Tim Fain, and in music videos for Eric Prydz and Cathedrals. I've done light sculptures for Google, Cisco, Dreamforce, and many others.

I've had the chance to perform at festivals around the world, including the Future of Storytelling, Treasure Island Music Festival, and Cannes Lions Innovation Festival, where I gave the keynote on “Beyond Sound: The Music Experience of the Future”. I'm thrilled to be bringing Ténéré to the world in 2017.

 

MARK SLEE, CO-LEAD ARTIST

My visual art draws heavily on a background in computer programming. I develop algorithmic patterns inspired both by organic and mathematical process, employing procedural motion, subtle variation, and evolving shifts in form and hue. I find it fascinating to explore the way our visual perception works, and my goal is to create vivid, colorful experiences that are pleasing both aesthetically and intellectually - pretty lights can tickle both mind and soul.

I've been developing an open-source stack for LED animation called LX since my first playa light-art installation at my second Burn in 2010. That system has gone on to see use in a variety of major installations, by myself and others. But Ténéré has to be one of the most audacious canvases I've ever seen envisioned, and I'm super excited to be creating for it.

 

ZACHARY SMITH, CO-CREATOR 

I couldn't be prouder of the incredible team working to make Ténéré a reality, and I've been blown away by the support we've received from people all over the world. I spend most of my time on project management, fundraising (we need your support!), and creative direction.

By day I'm an entrepreneur and product manager. I live in San Francisco with my wife Sophie.

 

PATRICK DEEGAN, PHD, CO-CREATOR

I build intelligent and self-sovereign robots and am fascinated by the potential of technology, applied to the advancement of society for the benefit of all. I have been attending Burning Man since 1996. This year, I'm excited to bring a wealth of technical experience to the task of creating an open-platform that is at the intersection of art, interaction, and digital identity.  I'm inspired by an amazing team and the really beautiful vision we share, to illuminate and support transformational synergies with technology and offer an experience of transcendent oneness with nature and each other.

 

TANNER BEREE, DIGITAL MEDIA LEAD

After my first burn I knew that becoming involved with an art project was in my future. As always the Playa provided; this time with The Tree of Ténéré. I work as a visual storyteller and couldn’t be more excited to document the journey of bringing this amazing piece of artwork to the world.

Come find me under the LED canopy of Ténéré!

 

RIWA HARFOUSH, COMMUNITY BUILDER

If the playa has taught me anything, it's the exponential nature of generosity. My fiancee Alex and I have felt how worthwhile our time, effort and love has been in building our camp (The Pineapple Motel) when we see our family of Pineapples come together each year to build our home in the dust. This year, we're looking beyond our little community and are so excited to rally an even larger family around this beautiful piece of art that can be experienced by all.

 

NATHANIEL HEDGES, BUILD TEAM

I moved to San Francisco from Honolulu. For eleven years I was a trauma medic/deep-sea-diver in the United States Navy, and recently I made the transition to studying furniture/product design at California College of the Arts (CCA). I love to bike and sail, and I'm passionate about Muay Thai and avidly committed to physical fitness/personal wellness.

With encouragement from friends and family, I ventured into developing large-scale art installations for the Burning Man community. I'm grateful for an amazing community of Bay Area Burner friends and can't wait to see you all under Ténéré!

 

MATT HERRICK, FUNDRAISING LEAD

After running fundraising for 2016's "Catacomb of Veils," I swore that I would take this year off. However, Ténére's beauty and audaciousness inspired me to join the team. I am also a lead for Epic, Burning Man's "World Series of Poker" theme camp. 

In the default world, I live in San Francisco and work in enterprise sales.

 

CLAY SADER, PROGRAMMING LEAD

I'm so incredibly excited to be a part of bringing Ténéré to the Burning Man community. Last year while being a small part of building Catacomb of Veils, I learned about the power of building spaces for healing and exploration. This year I'm proud be be bringing some of what I learned to help create this space of beauty, magic, and community. I cannot wait to lounge in the shade (and light) of Ténéré and see the community experience it for themselves.

I live in SF, but I spend most of my time in the default world in Africa and elsewhere, working to build software in the developing world to strengthen healthcare, crisis response, and development systems.

 

STEVE TAM, COMMUNITY & CROWDFUNDING

I help organize the Pineapple Motel camp and am excited about building the narrative and community around Ténéré. 2017 will be my fourth burn and I am looking forward to finally contributing to an artistically and experientially driven piece of magic on the playa.

During the day I work in brand and marketing for an AI company. I helped launch Daybreaker in Toronto and now live with my wife in NYC.

 

ALEXANDRE TERRIEN, FUNDRAISING

I'm the co-founder of the Pineapple Motel camp and better known as "Monkey" on the playa. I'm a dedicated Burner and community builder and so excited to bring Ténéré to the playa.

 

SHLOMO ZIPPEL, HARDWARE ENGINEER & ARTIST

I really enjoy combining art and engineering, and Burning Man provides ample opportunities to do so. I brought various projects to the playa over the years: climbable installations, art cars, and shiny wearables. It is great being part of a team and a project that is combing all of the above.

You can find me at various hackerspaces in San Francisco working on Light Layer, helping makers add interactive LEDs to their costumes and art installations.

 

JEFFREY ORD, BUILD TEAM

Coming soon

 

JOSH ELBAZ, PROJECT MANAGER

I manage hospital construction projects in Montreal. Throughout my career, I've learned to appreciate how beautiful art and light can affect the lives of patients and staff, and how these can help to heal the mind, body, and spirit. My hope is that the Tree of Ténéré will too have this effect on many Burners this summer, and so it is my great pleasure to collaborate with this amazing team to help bring this vision to fruition.

 

TYLER GOIN, FUNDRAISING

Over five trips to Burning Man, I've developed a special bond to Black Rock City, especially around the unique collection of art, nature and people. For me, Burning Man is an expression of what humanity is capable of, and a reminder for how much stronger we are when we work together then we are divided. I believe deeply that facilitating the construction of a lonely tree in the desert for people to gather and come together is a beacon of hope and beauty in these tumultuous times.

 

 

Donations are tax deductible thanks to our fiscal sponsor, Gray Area Foundation for the Arts.

But Ténéré has to be one of the most audacious canvases I've ever seen envisioned, and I'm super excited to be creating for it. ZACHARY SMITH, CO-CREATOR I couldn't be prouder of the incredible team working to make Ténéré a reality, and I've been blown away by the support we've received from people all over the world. I spend most of my time on project management, fundraising (we need your support!), and creative direction.By day I'm an entrepreneur and product manager. I live in San Francisco with my wife Sophie. PATRICK DEEGAN, PHD, CO-CREATORI build intelligent and self-sovereign robots and am fascinated by the potential of technology, applied to the advancement of society for the benefit of all. I have been attending Burning Man since 1996. This year, I'm excited to bring a wealth of technical experience to the task of creating an open-platform that is at the intersection of art, interaction, and digital identity.  I'm inspired by an amazing team and the really beautiful vision we share, to illuminate and support transformational synergies with technology and offer an experience of transcendent oneness with nature and each other. TANNER BEREE, DIGITAL MEDIA LEADAfter my first burn I knew that becoming involved with an art project was in my future. As always the Playa provided; this time with The Tree of Ténéré. I work as a visual storyteller and couldn’t be more excited to document the journey of bringing this amazing piece of artwork to the world.Come find me under the LED canopy of Ténéré! RIWA HARFOUSH, COMMUNITY BUILDERIf the playa has taught me anything, it's the exponential nature of generosity. My fiancee Alex and I have felt how worthwhile our time, effort and love has been in building our camp (The Pineapple Motel) when we see our family of Pineapples come together each year to build our home in the dust. This year, we're looking beyond our little community and are so excited to rally an even larger family around this beautiful piece of art that can be experienced by all. NATHANIEL HEDGES, BUILD TEAMI moved to San Francisco from Honolulu. For eleven years I was a trauma medic/deep-sea-diver in the United States Navy, and recently I made the transition to studying furniture/product design at California College of the Arts (CCA). I love to bike and sail, and I'm passionate about Muay Thai and avidly committed to physical fitness/personal wellness.With encouragement from friends and family, I ventured into developing large-scale art installations for the Burning Man community. I'm grateful for an amazing community of Bay Area Burner friends and can't wait to see you all under Ténéré! MATT HERRICK, FUNDRAISING LEADAfter running fundraising for 2016's "Catacomb of Veils," I swore that I would take this year off. However, Ténére's beauty and audaciousness inspired me to join the team. I am also a lead for Epic, Burning Man's "World Series of Poker" theme camp. In the default world, I live in San Francisco and work in enterprise sales. CLAY SADER, PROGRAMMING LEADI'm so incredibly excited to be a part of bringing Ténéré to the Burning Man community. Last year while being a small part of building Catacomb of Veils, I learned about the power of building spaces for healing and exploration. This year I'm proud be be bringing some of what I learned to help create this space of beauty, magic, and community. I cannot wait to lounge in the shade (and light) of Ténéré and see the community experience it for themselves.I live in SF, but I spend most of my time in the default world in Africa and elsewhere, working to build software in the developing world to strengthen healthcare, crisis response, and development systems. STEVE TAM, COMMUNITY & CROWDFUNDINGI help organize the Pineapple Motel camp and am excited about building the narrative and community around Ténéré. 2017 will be my fourth burn and I am looking forward to finally contributing to an artistically and experientially driven piece of magic on the playa.During the day I work in brand and marketing for an AI company. I helped launch Daybreaker in Toronto and now live with my wife in NYC. ALEXANDRE TERRIEN, FUNDRAISINGI'm the co-founder of the Pineapple Motel camp and better known as "Monkey" on the playa. I'm a dedicated Burner and community builder and so excited to bring Ténéré to the playa. SHLOMO ZIPPEL, HARDWARE ENGINEER & ARTISTI really enjoy combining art and engineering, and Burning Man provides ample opportunities to do so. I brought various projects to the playa over the years: climbable installations, art cars, and shiny wearables. It is great being part of a team and a project that is combing all of the above.You can find me at various hackerspaces in San Francisco working on Light Layer, helping makers add interactive LEDs to their costumes and art installations. JEFFREY ORD, BUILD TEAMComing soon JOSH ELBAZ, PROJECT MANAGERI manage hospital construction projects in Montreal. Throughout my career, I've learned to appreciate how beautiful art and light can affect the lives of patients and staff, and how these can help to heal the mind, body, and spirit. My hope is that the Tree of Ténéré will too have this effect on many Burners this summer, and so it is my great pleasure to collaborate with this amazing team to help bring this vision to fruition. TYLER GOIN, FUNDRAISINGOver five trips to Burning Man, I've developed a special bond to Black Rock City, especially around the unique collection of art, nature and people. For me, Burning Man is an expression of what humanity is capable of, and a reminder for how much stronger we are when we work together then we are divided. I believe deeply that facilitating the construction of a lonely tree in the desert for people to gather and come together is a beacon of hope and beauty in these tumultuous times.  Donations are tax deductible thanks to our fiscal sponsor, Gray Area Foundation for the Arts.

story:
Clicca qui per ITALIANO

Infinity Vetro Project aims to preserve the 800-year-old glassblowing tradition in Tuscany, Italy by establishing a school, gallery and cultural center in the center of Florence. 

Our goal is to raise $150,000 in 50 days to launch the first phase of the project, which includes securing and building out a studio space, obtaining necessary permits, purchasing certified specialized equipment, and covering operating costs during the first three months of programming.

Tuscany and Glassblowing  - A long history; a new opportunity

Italy is known throughout the world for its rich glassblowing tradition, and the Tuscan region has been a part of this tradition for nearly 800 years. Since medieval times, Florentine glass workers have passed their knowledge and skills from generation to generation at the furnaces of the many glass factories that thrived there until recent years.  Today, just one out of the forty factories specializing in hand blown glass that existed in the region 60 years ago still remains. 

As competition with foreign glass factories increases, more and more historically important furnaces throughout Italy, and the rest of the world, are closing. The industry of handmade glass is no longer sustainable as a business model, yet the art of glassblowing is an important part of our cultural heritage and it should be preserved for future generations. 

An artistic glassblowing school would change the course of the future of glassblowing in region of Tuscany by providing a new avenue for maestros to share their skills and experience, while also making the activity relevant and accessible to the next generation and allowing them to experience it in a fun, exciting and contemporary way.

What is Infinity Vetro Project?

Infinity Vetro Project’s goal is to preserve the rich history of glass working in Tuscany by offering courses and workshops in glassblowing taught by maestros from the region, and creating an opportunity for both locals and visitors to our region to connect with the glassmaking tradition in an exciting and meaningful way. By removing the art of glassblowing from the factory setting and placing it the realm of an art studio, we hope to inspire a glass renaissance similar to the American Studio Glass Movement of 50 years ago.

Our dream is to provide a comprehensive glass experience for people from a wide range of backgrounds and experience levels. We’ll start with “experience” classes for travelers and curious locals, then, we’ll build programming for more dedicated students, providing a place for them to learn, and then practice their skills by renting studio time. A small gallery space will be dedicated to showing instructor and advanced student work, and later, we’ll add a bar/café offering regional food and drinks (with proceeds supporting school operations). Plans for children’s programming are already in development, modeled on the wildly successful Kids Design Glass program at the Museum of Glass in Tacoma, WA. As we progress, we’ll add courses and programs for more advanced artists as well, including week-long advanced classes by internationally known artists and an artist-in-residence program.

Phase 1: Making it happen

The first phase of the Infinity Vetro Project includes securing and building out a small studio with a gallery space, obtaining necessary permits, purchasing certified specialized, environmentally sound equipment, and covering marketing and operating costs during the first three months of offering classes and workshops. Our goal is to have the school up and running by July of 2013, and that it will be self-sustaining within one year. 

Phase 1 Budget:

Equipment Purchase:

€18,000  50kg glass furnace (where glass is prepared, melted and stored)

€8,000    gloryhole (for reheating glass while working)

€7,000    annealer (large kiln where glass is gradually cooled after working)

€2000     glassworking tools, blowpipes etc.

€500      color box (small kiln where glass color is heated for use)

Space rental for 8 months during set up and first month of operations:

€16,000

Retrofit and build out space, insurance, permits:

€20,000 

Staff salaries:

€20,000

Fire safety and first aid courses:

€1000 

Marketing and operating expenses for first months of operation:

€14,200 

Contingency:

€10,000 

Total:

€116,700 ($150,000)

 

How your gift helps:

We are asking for your financial support to help get Infinity Vetro Project started. With your help, we can create an amazing school where people from all over the world come together to celebrate the rich tradition of Italian glass working, immersed in the beautiful cultural heart of Tuscany.

Your support will be recognized with one of the fabulous perks outlined to the right, ranging from beautiful blown glass pieces designed to commemorate the launch of the Infinity Vetro Project, to a stay in a gorgeous Tuscan villa with food provided by trained chef and Infinity Vetro Project Director Isak Lystad. 

Gifts at every level are very much appreciated, and make a real difference in making the Infinity Vetro Project a reality. Just a few tangible examples of how your contribution can help: a $25 gift covers the cost of glass color for a beginning student; a $75 gift buys a pair of glass working tweezers for the studio; $1,000 would pay for first aid and safety courses for our instructors. 

Please help us keep the 800-year–old tradition of glassmaking alive and well in Florence by making a generous contribution today.

You can also help this project succeed by spreading the word:

  • Use the Indiegogo Share Tools to post information about the project on your Facebook, Twitter or LinkedIn profiles
  • Post the campaign link where people will see it.
  • Track your progress: if you sign up to Indiegogo your sharing activity will be recorded in your profile dashboard, there you can see if any funds have been raised as a result of your sharing efforts. (If you help raise funds as a result of you sharing this project, send Isak a screen shot of your Indiegogo share referrals and he’ll award you the $10 level perk!

The Infinity Vetro Team:

Isak Lystad, Infinity Vetro Project Founder and Director

American glass artist Isak Lystad is the founder and director of Infinity Vetro Project. Originally a trained chef, Isak began his study of glass in 2003, surrounded by a large community of talented glass artists in Seattle, Washington.

After 6 months of dedicated study, he left his job as a chef and began working as a glassblower full-time. For the next four years, he spent all of his free time blowing glass and attending demonstrations, glass studios, galleries, and museums in an effort to learn as much as he could about the material. Isak’s time in Seattle provided a solid foundation of knowledge and skills for using glass as an artistic medium, as well as endless inspiration and a sense that anything is possible.

At the end of 2007, Isak and his wife had the opportunity to invest in a property in Tuscany. Only after discovering that there was glassblowing in the region, did they decide to make the move. Initially Isak worked in a factory with some Tuscan maestros, but with economic crisis at the end of 2008, many of the glassblowing factories began to struggle and he was eventually let go. With no glassblowing prospects, Isak returned to cooking, and began building his private glass studio in his free time, which he finished in November of 2011.

Although he will always love cooking, his true passion is for glass, and sharing that passion with others. In the Infinity Vetro Project, he has found a cause worth fighting for, a place where he knows he can make a lasting difference. Getting this project started is the biggest challenge he has ever undertaken, yet, he is determined to see it through. To learn more about Isak and his background, please visit the links at the bottom of this page.

The Maestro Instructors

Simone Quaglia is a Maestro from Empoli, the 3rd generation in his family to work in the hand blown glass industry. He learned from his father beginning factory work at age 15. Quaglia has 18 years of experience.

Sergio Serra is a Maestro from Empoli with 28 years experience. Although he is the first of his family to work in the industry, he is extremely talented and creative.

Francesco Aiazzi is a Maestro from Colle d'Val d'Elsa. He learned to blow glass from his father and has 20+ years of experience.

Sergio Spanu is a Maestro Sculptor from Sardegna Italy. He learned the trade in Sardegna, and has worked in Naples, and in Colle di Val d'Elsa for the last 5 years and has 22 years experience.

Umberto Clanetti is a Maestro Sculptor from Venice. He actually learned to blow glass in Sweden, but has worked in Colle di Val d'Elsa for 30 odd years. Clanetti has 40+ years of experience. He is retired, but is willing to teach some special classes at the school.

 

Need to know more?

Call Isak! (39) 0587 646386 or Skype him @: InfinityVetro

Don't like the phone? 

You can reach us by e-mail at InfinityVetro@gmail.com

 

Please Help This School Become a Reality!

Tuscany Needs You! 

THANK YOU!

story:
$8,000 FOR 8 YEARS OF FIGHTING FOR DIGNITY & AGAINST DISPLACEMENT IN EL BARRIO!

“BEST POWER TO THE PEOPLE MOVEMENT IN NYC” - VILLAGE VOICE

“IT IS REAL GRASS-ROOTS DEMOCRACY, AND IT IS BEING PRACTICED BY THE IMMIGRANTS WHO LIVE IN EAST HARLEM” - NEW YORK DAILY NEWS

“For Movement for Justice in El Barrio, the struggle for justice means fighting for the liberation of women, immigrants, lesbians, people of color, gays and the transgender community. We all share a common enemy and its called neoliberalism. Neoliberalism wishes to divide us and keep us from combining our forces. We will defeat this by continuing to unite our entire community until we achieve true liberation for all.” - Movement for Justice in El Barrio

In December of 2004, after enduring years of inhumane living conditions and abuse from their negligent landlord, a fearless group of Latina immigrants residing in several buildings in New York City’s historic East Harlem came together and formed Movement for Justice in El Barrio, as a way to fight back against landlords who rake in profits by tormenting and illegally evicting tenants.

Since coming together in these initial buildings, we have blanketed El Barrio, going door-to-door to build a grassroots, community-wide movement for dignity and against displacement that is led by hundreds of low-income people of color, women, and immigrants residing in over 70 buildings across the neighborhood. Today, we remain a predominantly women-of-color and immigrant organization that operates on the principles of self-determination, autonomy, and participatory democracy. We believe those who suffer injustice firsthand must design and lead their own struggles for justice.

Throughout our 8 year history, we have taken on and defeated some of the worst and most powerful landlords in New York City, including consecutive victories against one of the Village Voice’s “10 Worst Landlords of NYC” and a now-defunct multi-national corporation from the U.K. We have held complicit politicians and city institutions accountable to the low-income residents of El Barrio. We have built a culture of resistance and a community of solidarity.

Help us celebrate our 8th Anniversary by donating to sustain our struggle in the coming year! Our humble goal is to raise $8,000 by the end of December—with your support we can make it happen. All proceeds from this Indiegogo project will go towards our day-to-day fight for dignified living conditions and against displacement in El Barrio and beyond, and will ensure that we can continue building on...

  • 8 years of grassroots, community-led resistance to gentrification/displacement and neoliberalism in El Barrio!

  • 8 years of building a social justice organization based on self-determination, paticipatory democracy, and autonomy!

  • 8 years of landmark victories against millionaire slumlords, corrupt politicians, and failing city insitutions!

  • 8 years of breaking down borders and supporting movements from NYC to South Africa and beyond!

  • 8 years of fighting sexism, racism, xenophobia, homophobia, transphobia, classism, and other forms of oppression!

  • 8 AÑOS EN LA LUCHA POR OTRO MUNDO POSIBLE! / 8 YEARS OF STRUGGLE FOR AN "OTHER" POSSIBLE WORLD!

"We fight so that:
The oceans and mountains will belong to those that live in and take care of them.
The rivers and deserts will belong to those that live in and take care of them.
The valleys and ravines will belong to those that live in and take care of them.
Homes and cities will belong to those who live in and take care of them.
No one will own more land than they can cultivate.
No one will own more homes than they can live in."
- Movement for Justice in El Barrio
