story:
Who I AM

I am Carla and I'm a local Atlanta-based visual artist and writer. For people like me, it is difficult to fund my own art exhibition. Most can work many jobs, others have gracious family members that will help. I have neither at the current moment. For years now I've been working on this new series and I'm seizing this opportunity to exhibit my collages to the public.

What I Need & What You Get

What I need from everyone is enough funds to purchase frames and libations for the exhibtion. Small donations will receive 5x7 in. signed digital glossy prints while large donations will receive single edition 10x15 in. specialty prints. All together, each donator will be able to own a piece of work as a collector and my lifelong appreciation of your warm gesture. Names of all donators will be showcased throughout the exhibition at City of Ink.

The Impact

The impact of this campaign is crucial to the body of work and the concept behind it. In the American South, through the mix of racism and country politics, I find that no matter where you go, Southern people of all colors have the hospitality that is known to the region. We help one another when in need. We listen to one another when one needs to be heard. Please be the one to help me today. It's rare that I ask for help and now is the time to ask.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot donate money to my campaign then please send this information to a family member, coworker and/or friend. If you are in the Atlanta area, then please come out to the exhibition on 3 May 2013. I want you to have a grand time with me as I unveil my latest body of work and recreate an atmosphere that I loved in my youth. This night is for those that live and love the Dirty South. Long Live the Dirty South, y'all. Peace.

I am Carla and I'm a local Atlanta-based visual artist and writer. For people like me, it is difficult to fund my own art exhibition. Most can work many jobs, others have gracious family members that will help. I have neither at the current moment. For years now I've been working on this new series and I'm seizing this opportunity to exhibit my collages to the public.


What I Need & What You Get
What I need from everyone is enough funds to purchase frames and libations for the exhibtion. Small donations will receive 5x7 in. signed digital glossy prints while large donations will receive single edition 10x15 in. specialty prints. All together, each donator will be able to own a piece of work as a collector and my lifelong appreciation of your warm gesture. Names of all donators will be showcased throughout the exhibition at City of Ink.


The Impact
The impact of this campaign is crucial to the body of work and the concept behind it. In the American South, through the mix of racism and country politics, I find that no matter where you go, Southern people of all colors have the hospitality that is known to the region. We help one another when in need. We listen to one another when one needs to be heard. Please be the one to help me today. It's rare that I ask for help and now is the time to ask.


Other Ways You Can Help
If you cannot donate money to my campaign then please send this information to a family member, coworker and/or friend. If you are in the Atlanta area, then please come out to the exhibition on 3 May 2013. I want you to have a grand time with me as I unveil my latest body of work and recreate an atmosphere that I loved in my youth. This night is for those that live and love the Dirty South. Long Live the Dirty South, y'all. Peace.

story:
August 24th from 7pm-12am at Converge Denver!

This art show is designed to create awareness and aid to freedom. It will consist of 26 pieces representing a sense of freedom for humankind and our world, physically and spiritually. 20 paintings by Kael Kramer and 6 pottery collections by Tracy Shulsinger will be displayed, along with 1-2 pieces by guest artists. Also each painting by Kael will have a counterpart. This will be a print of itself combined with a model that has been painted or decorated to become part of the piece him/herself - as if they are displaying each other in a way. These prints will be done in artistic fashion with creative photographers. They will reflect nature, freedom and world related blessings and issues.
This theme of 'Freedom' is a purposeful diverse theme allowing much room for variance in content. And one that creates the opportunity to contribute to charity. A percentage of 40-52% from the sale of these pieces will be split among two different charities supporting human freedom and environmental freedom. A complete sale of one painting will be given to each charity also, along with a donation box for direct contributions.

Charities:

iEmpathize http://www.iempathize.org/

WildEarth Guardians http://www.wildearthguardians.org/

Event Schedule:
7pm - 7:45pm Opening ceremony sound healing concert with Gary Fishman.
8pm - 10pm Silent auction, Educational and entertainment valued charity presentation accompanied with music from songwriter Lara Ruggles.
10pm -12am 'After Party' dance celebration with DJ Buddha Bomb. (weather permitting, will be outside on back patio).

story:
Imagine the Merry Pranksters taking to the road in 2013. Well, we are not the Merry Pranksters, but we are merry, and we are pranksters, and we hope someday to see Wavy Gravy walking his fish down main street. Picture, if you would, for real, the Burning Man mutant vehicle, and David Best sculpture, Temple Bus, on the highway as centerpiece for a west coast music Road Show! Might even have jugglers and clowns….

The goal is set to support a roadshow tour. Partial funding will ensure the curation of Temple Bus.

We are the Douglas Arts and Humanities Association (AKA: The Grand Theatre), a 501(c)3 non-profit community arts organization. Contributions to this campaign are tax deductible. Our goal is to preserve the Temple Bus as a work of art. Some larger mutant vehicle creations have been lost, for example: La Contessa, the wonderful pirate ship who once sailed the Playa. Patrick Dailey, caretaker (pink-slip holder) for Temple Bus has a home for her here in Arizona.

Here is the deal. After several years at Burning Man, serving as support vehicle for the temple build and public enjoyment during the event, the Temple Bus is heading for a new home in the Douglas/Bisbee, Arizona locale. She has been stored in the Petaluma, CA since she was built. The local authorities are in the process of condemning the storage yard where Temple Bus lives, and a new home is in order.

This campaign addresses the relocation of Temple Bus. Safe haven for her is in place here in Arizona. We wish to create an event around the move in the form of a music road show with five free concerts along the way. The concert locations are SF Bay area, Los Angeles, Phoenix, Tucson and Bisbee/Douglas.

The Road Show is a self-contained caravan of musicians and other performance artists, roadies, drivers, mechanics, groupies, hangers-on, and some folks who think the Grateful Dead are still on tour. The original music of Dan Simonis (The West Texas Millionares) and Bruce Northey (Wall of Dreamers) will rock center stage … and yes, you can dance all you want. Bring a picnic basket.

This Indiegogo campaign is to fund this tour. If we reach our goal, the Road Show will hit the road in autumn, 2013. The tour is one week. The funding goal is $40,000. This will provide for the basic costs of the caravan support vehicles (gas and oil, etc.), modest compensation for the performance artists, stage crew and film crew, food and lodging costs (we’re talking shopping at Safeway and staying in campgrounds), theater equipment rental (stage, lighting, sound), insurance (a special rider for our existing liability policy), audio and video documentation, and preparing the Temple Bus for safe highway travel. The concerts are free to the public.

What’s in this for you the contributor. First, your contribution is tax deductible. Second, you can feel good about securing the long-term preservation of this work of art. Third, this project will be documented as part of Wall of Dreamers film project (an Indiegogo project). The Perk delivery date is based on the audio post production schedule.

If we don’t reach the goal, we will trim the concert program as needed. The basic priority is keeping the Temple Bus in safe mechanical condition and funding travel costs associated with the relocation. If we exceed our goal, funds will go toward higher quality audio and film documentation, guest artists, maintenance fund for Temple Bus, and maybe a new set of tires.

The bottom line is this. Any funding received goes first to the preservation of the Temple Bus. Even a few thousand dollars will secure the future for Temple Bus. If the goal is far exceeded, excess funds will go to historic preservation of the Grand Theatre. Our tax records are public information. Tax ID 86-0339959. Thanks for considering our campaign and sharing our dream.

story:
Introduction

My name is Dóra Votin. I am an Hungarian artist. I started to work as a freelance painter and a graphic designer in 2000. I am a mother of three and have tried to earn my living through my art. Since Hungary is a small country and there are many talented artists, I thought I would try to look around the world and show my art abroad.

Last year, Agora Gallery, NY discovered my website and offered representation, promotion and exhibition of my artworks there in New York City. Because of the expenses (shipping, promotinal costs, etc.) it took me until now to decide what to do. Finally, I decided to give it a try... This is a great challenge for me!

My paintings have been accepted and soon I will sign the agreement.

All I need now is your support to get my art to NYC! Without that I have no chance to obtain all I need for this big opportunity.


What Will Cover the Cost of This Campaign?

The  goal of this project is 7.050 USD

  • For promotion, exhibition for 18 months included in the representation agreement: 3.850 USD
  • For shipping the art pieces from Hungary to the States: 2.300 USD
  • For the flight (2 times in that period): 900 USD
  • If I exceed the goal of my campaign it may cover the costs of international customs fees and accomodation in NY.

Any amount of contribution is welcome!


About My Paintings

The theme of the series of paintings I am planning to exhibit in NYC is based on one of Béla Bartók’s ideas about going back to the clean and clear source. I started to search for this clear source in the field of visual art in the Hungarian context when I arrived at the motifs of Hungarian folk art. These motifs vary in forms and colors from region to region. I have chosen some of them and started to open up their symbolic meaning, and redefined them in the context of our postmodern time. This series is about women and being feminine. My plan is to continue this theme and integrate it with other motifs.

I painted them in oil on canvas, however as you can see on my website I can use different mediums and technics depending on what I want to express.

For me it would be a fantastic encouragement to reach my goal and get to NYC. It is not only about going there and selling paintings. It is more about experiencing a setting where people love art and are interested in it. That would be a sign for me that it is worth painting and being creative and would give me further encouragement to continue my painting.

Of couse, it would be a great privilege to show these art pieces in New York City or anywhere in the States! 

If you would like to know more about my art you can check my website: http://www.votin.hu/en/paintings/oil/exhibition...

You can even get in touch with me and buy artworks directly from me.

If you would like to know more about Agora Gallery, its website is: www.agora-gallery.com


Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you love art but can’t contribute now, please share the link of this campaign with your friends and with those who you think are interested in art and who are ready to support artists.
  • It is helpful if you make some noise about my campaign.
  • If you have any good ideas related to my project, please, contact me.
  • You can use the Indiegogo share tools.

story:
Shipping Mayako Nakamura's artwork; Emaki scroll on 1350mmx30m Kent paper roll from Tokyo, Japan to a Group Show "The Act of Painting" TETEM / Enschede, The Netherlands.

I am a painter living in Tokyo, Japan. I'll be participating in a Group Show "The Act of Painting" in TETEM / Enschede, The Netherlands　2013.11.07-12.01 

The Act of Painting is an initiative by a group of artists who want to show what the essence of abstract painting can be about. I will be displaying my Emaki scroll. which I had been creating in the last few years. 


The Act of Painting   http://www.theactofpainting.com/

The Act of Painting FB page   https://www.facebook.com/TheActOfPainting

My interview  http://www.theactofpainting.com/interviews/interview-mayako-nakamura/

Emaki Study  http://www.flickr.com/photos/ma85/sets/72157622649347022/

Mayako Nakamura  http://mayakonakamura.jp/en/index.html

TETEM http://tetem.nl/nl/activiteit/details/275/the-act-of-painting


The funding will be used for shipping an emaki scroll from Tokyo to Enschede. You'll receive postcards, 2014 calendar, drawings by Mayako Nakamura, drawings/paintings by Raymond Cuijpers and Jeroen Hofhuizen in return! 

Raymond Cuijpers http://kick.home.xs4all.nl/rrjc.html

Jeroen Hofhuizen http://www.wimreiff.com/Artists-A-Z/hofhuizen-jeroen


In "The Act of Painting"  web page, you will find interesting interviews with the participating artists in depth. A list of exhibitions already planned. Next to these exhibitions The Act of Painting will travel to Amsterdam, New York, London, Berlin and Tokyo. So any funding above our goal will be used for the next exhibition coming up!

If you are unable to support us financially please feel free to share this project in any social network.

Thank you for your understanding and support! 

Mayako Nakamura

story:
About the DIY


The DIY Arts Collective provides a communal platform for artistic development to people of all ages. Our HQ at 67 Toronto Street, Barrie Ontario Canada, serves as an alternative art gallery, community centre and cross-platform hub for multi-disciplinary collaboration. Through encouraging our members to LEARN BY DOING, the Collective has made great progress in enhancing the quality of life for some of the regions least understood residents.


Since its beginnings the Collective has provided studio time to local artists; and arts programming to young kids. We have aspirations to expand our programming to include workshops for folks of all ages, including artistic, musical, athletic and wellness activities. The Space is also one of Barrie's premier galleries; and venues for music and performance art.. something we are very proud of given the grassroots nature of our not-for-profit, which is funded almost exclusively by individual members, and small grassroots organizations. Our stage has seen outstanding musical showcases, poetry readings, belly dancing, burlesque, fashion shows, magic, theatre and presentations from activists and community leaders. 


We support (and are supported by) various initiatives, which improve the quality of life of our neighbours, through its initiatives and collaborations with our community partners. Among these have been our friends in Back to Basics Social Developments; the Aids Coalition of Simcoe County; Simcoe Pride; and the Canadian Mental Health Association to name a few. We collect food for the Elizabeth Fry Society Grocery Assistance Program as well as activist group Food Not Bombs. 


What we need and why


The Collective is asking for the support of the community in meeting our obligations; and expanding what we offer to our members and to the community. We are asking $1200 over the next two months. With your contribution, we will keep you informed on how we are spending your cash; and encourage you to be a part of putting it to great use!


The first priority in this campaign is to cover our growing expenses. Our overhead alone dances around $1600/mo. This is a good price for the area, however we still need help. 


Any surplus funds generated will be invested in art supplies, improving the venue, starting work-shops, marketing, and other approved expenses. Spending is frequently discussed by the membership in our online forums, and membership meetings held at 67 Toronto Street. If you purchase a membership you will also be welcome and encouraged to help decide how money is invested to further our not-for-profit objectives.

story:
Blank Expressions is a series of portraits that I set out to work on in January of 2014. At first, I only wanted to do 100, but as the year went on, and more and more people began to volunteer to be a part, I decided to do one a day for a solid year. There are 365 portraits, in total, in this series, and in total, I put in over 1,100 hours working on this series.

The goal of Blank Expressions is to remove the facial features of an individual - those external things that we tend to see first and evaluate, and replace them with the words and thoughts that lurk in their minds, the things that make them what they truly are. In this series, the gamut has run from prose, lyrics, and poetry written by the subjects, themselves, onto content written by others, and even some weirder stuff like Google Maps directions or lists of times and dates.

The subjects who comprise Blank Expressions are musicians, artists, and residents, all from the Chicago area.

I want to put together a book, showcasing all of these portraits, but because the backgrounds I collaged the art onto are in color, well, that makes things a bit pricier.

The costs break down as follows:

$3,200 for the printing (this includes full color cover perfect bound and is 100 pages, with 4 portraits per page - there are some extras that will be taking up the remaining pages after the 365 portraits)

$300 to cover the fees that Indie GoGo take (4% if all funds are raised) and PayPal take (3.4%)

This project has taught me a lot about establishing a creative routine that's consistent and unflinching and I've learned a lot about the process of artistic discipline through it. I've also made some great friends and can now, sorta, draw a decent looking beard, too!

Thanks for checking this campaign out and I hope you can help me see this book come to fruition.

story:
As most of you who know me are aware, I am really into lichens. Like, REALLY, into lichens. This might seem a bit odd because I don't have a science background and I am currently in law school. 

So let me tell you a little bit about how I came to fall in love with these amazing symbiotic organisms. 



Six years ago I spent a summer on Clare Island, off the west coast of Ireland apprenticing with a weaver. When I wasn't working in the studio, I spent hours hiking around the surrounding countryside. Wandering the island documenting the various flora and fauna with my camera was my favorite pastime. This is where I stumbled upon my first lichens. I had never seen lichen before in person, but now that I had, I was OBSESSED. Even though I spent countless hours chronicling the lichens of Clare Island in all their various forms I couldn't quite figure out how to transform the wonder I felt at their existence into something more creative.



Over the past six years I have been able to travel extensively in Ireland and have continued to document the lichens that I have found there. At this point I have taken hundreds of photos of them and read everything about them I can get my hands on. Most importantly, I have started working them into my art practice by rendering them through various techniques. After all of this, I have finally reached a point where I am interested in gaining some proper hands on scientific experience with them. 

This is where you come in! 



The Radical Mycology Convergence is happening in Orangeville, Illinois in mid-October, and I would love to attend. While their main focus is mushrooms, they will have several workshops that focus on lichens. These workshops will cover various topics such as how to do chemical spot tests for lichen identification, how to properly collect and preserve specimens, how to read growth patterns in order to use lichens as environmental bioindicators, and how to use lichens in natural dyes. By attending this event, not only will I gain these valuable skills, I will also be able to study lichens in the U.S. for the first time. Which is kinda crazy right? I've only ever studied lichens in Ireland! It's high time I got familiar with the lichens here on my home soil. 



Ok, so you need money to make this happen. What exactly are you going to be spending it on though? 

- Registration fees for the Radical Mycology Convergence. There is no set fee for the event. Their suggested donation is between $50 and $300 depending on how much of the weekend you plan on attending. They encourage people to help volunteer for various tasks during the weekend if they cannot afford the full registration fee. So of course I plan on volunteering as much as I can without it hindering my ability to take advantage of the workshops that I really want to attend. This obviously cannot offset the full registration fee however, so the more I raise, the more I can contribute. 

- Transportation costs. The event is in Orangeville, IL, so about two hours outside of Chicago. I will be carpooling with other members of the mycological society who are attending from Chicago, so I will need money to contribute towards gas. 

- Camping equipment. Again, this event is two hours outside of Chicago. It is held on farmland and the majority of attendees camp on the event grounds for the weekend since there isn't a lot of convenient accommodation around.  I need basic camping equipment to cover my accommodation for the weekend. I've done some shopping around online and it appears I can get everything I need, in decent quality, for a little over $150. This may seem like a large expense to incur for a one-time event, but the majority of lichenological events that I would like to attend in the future require the ability to camp out where the lichens are. So in reality this is an investment that will enable me to keep hunting down lichens, not simply a once and done expense. 

- The last bit that I need help covering is all of the seemingly small costs that add up quickly. I need to cover food for the weekend, new batteries and memory card for my camera, materials to transport any specimens collected. Etc. 



But Timmi, what do I get in return for my generous donation?

THIS IS THE BEST PART! I have a selection of lichen goodies for you all! You have probably seen the various lichen photos I’ve posted on social media, and this is a perfect way for you to take home a lichen of your own. You can choose from stickers, prints of the photos, or even hand embroidered lichens of your very own. The stickers and photos will be delivered to you as soon as the campaign is over. Since the embroidered lichens take a bit more time to create (but not nearly as much time as growing your own lichen!) you should expect to receive your completed lichen sometime in November depending on how I can fit them in around my law school workload. 



This all sounds great! I don't have much money to spare right now though, how else can I help you?

Even the smallest donation is a huge help, but if you cannot donate then please consider sharing this with anyone else who you think might be interested in supporting my lichen habit. As I stated previously, my main goal in attending this event is to gain hands-on field experience with lichens. I will be making it a priority however to photo document them so that I can continue to use the photos to inform my art practice. I have a long term design project planned out based on these little guys and being able to continue to study and document them as thoroughly as possible is essential to being able to execute this project to the best of my ability. I know that with your help I will be well on my way to not only gaining valuable scientific experience, but I will also be better able to merge my scientific and artistic interests in the future.
story_txt:
As most of you who know me
are aware, I am really into lichens. Like, REALLY, into lichens. This might
seem a bit odd because I don't have a science background and I am currently in
law school. So let me tell you a little bit about how I came to fall in love
with these amazing symbiotic organisms. 
Six years ago I spent a
summer on Clare Island, off the west coast of Ireland apprenticing with a weaver. When I wasn't working in the
studio, I spent hours hiking around the surrounding countryside. Wandering the island documenting the various flora and fauna with my camera was my favorite pastime. This is where I stumbled upon my first
lichens. I had never seen lichen before in person, but now that I had, I was OBSESSED. Even though I spent countless hours chronicling the lichens of Clare Island in all their various forms I couldn't quite figure out how to transform the wonder I felt at their existence into something more creative.
Over the past six years I
have been able to travel extensively in Ireland and have continued to document
the lichens that I have found there. At this point I have taken hundreds of
photos of them and read everything about them I can get my hands on. Most
importantly, I have started working them into my art practice by rendering them
through various techniques. After all of this, I have finally reached a point
where I am interested in gaining some proper hands on scientific experience with
them. This is where you come in!

story:
#FuelYourPassion

Losing a child to cancer. Divorce right after. Two of the worse things a person could go through yet I continue to press through. This is my request.

My name is Marcus Robinson and I'm on a mission. My mission is to of course solicit your help for this project, but to also inspire you to pursue the things in life that you are most passionate about. I'm an artist who also loves technology, entrepreneurship, and community. After years of hurt, challenges, natural and spiritual struggles with life, losing a son to cancer, and divorce shortly afterwards, I should be running away from this path, hiding under a rock, and saying to heck with it all...

...But I'm not. This year I want to step out on faith, a very detailed business plan, a clear understanding of my goals, and a ton of passion, to open up a retail arts store called Airbrush4Life.

Entrepreneurial Arts Program

One of the goals of Airbrush4life is to provide an afterschool program that would be free for the kids in the community that will teach them about entrepreneurship by exposing them to my story, my entrepreneurial training received by the National Foundation for Teaching Entrepreneurship, and of course my airbrushing skills. 


Our Plea for Support

The money I am hoping to raise will give me the initial personal start-up investment that funders are requiring me to have in order to get a business loan which is $5000. Now, of course the typical airbrush artist doesn't need an investment so huge that a loan is needed to get it started. However, I am not just trying to open a store...I am trying to provide something that will make a HUGE impact in the community that it will reside in.

The main goal is $30,000. This will provide the type of atmosphere that will attract all types of customers. It will provide the tools that our artist will need to be the most creative. It will provide the marketing materials needed to sell ourselves and promote our brand. 

The video was such a blessing to make because it even shows me how serious and focused I am on this project. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Thank you in advance for your financial contribution. This will be the first of many fundraising attempts to help me bring light to the vision that is Airbrush4Life. Please help be making a contribution and sharing this link on your Twitter page, Facebook, Google+, LinkedIn, and every other social outlet that you have including email. 

"I'm not sure what everyone else is doing with their passion...but as for me, I'm going to Airbrush4life!"

Our Fundraising Efforts

I am fully aware that I cannot expect this campaign to be fully funded by the generosity of others, although that would be nice. Therefor I am organizing a launch party fundraiser to raise a portion of this money and market my business at the same time. Below are some of those videos.

story:
WE GOT PICKED TO GO TO MIAMI!!

We are two senior printmaking majors at the Hartford Art School who were selected among other students to participate in an internship at the Bass Museum as part of Art Basel Miami. We are trying to raise money to help pay for the travel expenses. Any donations would be super helpful and greatly appreciated!

WHO ARE WE?

We are Krista and Lauren! Krista is from Watertown, Connecticut and Lauren is from Naugatuck, Connecticut. We share of a love of all things art and print!

Krista is inspired by botanicals and their meanings. She works with intaglio printmaking. Follow her Instagram @kristanar for updates while she's at Art Basel.

Lauren's work is inspired by mythology and punk subculture. She works mainly in color reduction woodcuts. You can follow her on Instagram @lauren.zalewski for Art Basel updates as well.

We'll be writing a blog together while we're in Miami! Look out for updates!

story:
WHAT THE PROJECT IS

RELAMPAGO (spanish: lightning) is a project investigating people's concept of boundaries, comfort & play by collaborating in a fictional foto-narrative, creating wet-plate family portraits where I, the stranger, pose as a member of other people's families.

For RELAMPAGO I’ve outfitted my motorcycle as a mobile darkroom, giving the project mobility and a greater area for exploration. 

PROJECT IN DEPTH

“While camera records superbly, it transforms better!
Camera transforms so successfully that, among other things, what Else 
things are is a photograph!... The documentary photograph, the literal image, 
is the ultimate illusion… because the documentary perpetuates the illusion that 
life itself is the only reality.”

(Work cited: White, Minor. Mirrors Messages Manifestations. 
New York: Aperture Books, 1969. p. 106).

The nature of wet-plate collodion fotography is that it leaves out some things while enhancing others, producing the dramatic effect it is known for. RELAMPAGO draws on wet-plate fotography's historical tradition of exploration and documentation, but adds an element of pretend...

Through pretending, RELAMPAGO plays with people's levels of openness, comfort, boundaries, tastes, insecurities, playfulness... and their direct impression of me.

Some people will enjoy pretending... for others it will be asking to let me into their lives in an uncomfortable way. Collaborating with people to decide which member of the family I will be... I could be your son, brother, cousin, uncle…  but what about posing in place of your husband, or posing with your children as their father?

Who would you accept me to pretend to be?
Who wouldn't you let me pretend to be?

have already begun have 9 plates made

WHY FOTOS / WHAT IS PROCESS?

For RELAMPAGO I’ve specifically chosen to use the wet-plate collodion technique because the magic, the vulnerability, the luck and chance it involves, is central to my art practice.

To produce the portaits for the project, I mix precious chemicals by hand using 19th century formulas and technology to create strong, gorgeous images directly on solid metal plates.

Every plate is sensitized, exposed and developed right on the spot...each image is a one shot deal... each plate one-of-a-kind. There’s no negative. That light reflecting from you through the camera to the wet plate is making direct contact, this is your physical photograph, this is a treasure. But really the process the experience is the gold, this rig of alchemy I haul around on my bike, the interaction between you and me trying to coax this miracle out of chemicals and contraptions and light.

Wet-plate fotography carries a tradition of mobility, adventure, exploration, engagement. In horsedrawn caravans or with giant backpacks, wet plate fotographers set off to document the Civil War, the Crimean War, and the unknown Great American West. In lieu of a horse, my motorcycle hauls my equipment and materials, and instead of wars I am documenting people.

RELAMPAGO is mobile because of the importance of moving ahead, of seeking beyond—it involves give and take, being in a vulnerable state—but offers the opportunity to find MORE.

END PRODUCT

After producing 30 finished plates for RELAMPAGO, I will publish the project work in a book. RELAMPAGO will exhibit at the Mariposa Gallery in Tijuana, Mexico in August 2013.

HERE ARE THE PROJECT EXPENSES

Publishing costs of books to give to all RELAMPAGO participants

Chemicals and materials---(collodion, ether, moonshine, silver nitrate, iron sulfate, potassium cyanide, aluminum plates and varnish)

Publishing costs of the project catalogue and photo reprints

Gasoline

ALSO!

Please encourage your friends, family, and colleagues to donate. You can spread the word by using the Indiegogo share tools and linking to the RELAMPAGO campaign on your Facebook profile and Twitter feed. This is a word-of-mouth campaign, and its success relies on people being aware of it.

BIO / STATEMENT 
I have exhibited work at the San Diego Museum of Art's Summer Salon and Art Produce Gallery. I curated Twins in Twain for the 2011 San Diego Contemporary Art Fair, and was in charge of the design/build aspect of The (In)Visible Project.

My art focuses on engagement, the dynamic between risk-reward-loss, the real and the pretend.

story:
Hello!

 

I'm Katy Barker. I'm on a quest to build a Tiny House. 

 

Don't know what a Tiny House is?  Watch this short youtube video: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LJLSoUkh1Vs

(Please note that I am not buying a Tumbleweed House, nor am I purchasing their plans, nor am I affiliated with them in any way)

The video shows you an idea of what I will be building next summer, but mine will be different. More decorated, more home-like.  It will be a work of art in itself.

My house will be about 8'x16' and around 13' high. I do not have any architectural plans yet, but they’re in the works. I’ll be posting updates and info as I go.  

My Budget for this project is between $9,000 and $10,000. I’m currently saving money by living simply and ridding myself of monthly rent. If I’m frugal enough, I can save thousands of dollars by next summer. But will it be enough?

 

This is where you come in!

I’m offering original, one of a kind, completely unique pieces of art for your hard-earned money!

Just think of the possibilities! Art that you can give to a loved-one or art that you can pin in your office to cheer you up! The more you give, the more you get!

 

Here are the categories:

Illustration: An impression, maybe colorful, maybe not, yet fully finished.

Likeness: A graphite detailed work that is nearly close to photo-realistic. 

The above realte toportraits, abstract, landscape, etc. in sizes: 2"x3", 5"x8", and 8"x10"

Greeting Cards: Holidays, Birthdays, “hellos” – You pick which ones you get!

 

My goal is to raise $1,000, but truly, any little bit counts. If I make $100, that's a large amount of the 2x4's I'll need! 

 

Living Tiny

You might be asking, “Why?” Let me take a moment to explain.

Since graduating high school, I’ve spent years traveling around the country and living life. I enjoy the nomadic lifestyle and very much wish to continue on this path. But consistency is necessary. This is how the Tiny House fits into my lifestyle. It’s a house that I can take with me no matter where I end up.

It’s also about living simply. How many t-shirts do I have? Do I truly need to keep all of those paperbacks? What about these dish sets? It’s the difference between want and need.  The Tiny house Movement is about Mobility and Simplicity.

 

Don’t have Extra Money to Spend?

Neither do I! But if you’re super pumped about this project, there’s other ways you can help.

Donate lumber and materials, lend me your power tools or ladder. Any type of construction gear helps.

Also, next summer, I’ll be looking for dedicated people to help me build. If this interests you, shoot me an email and let’s set up some dates!

 

Keep in Touch

Check out the blog! http://littlesimplebeautiful.blogspot.com/ 

 

 

Thank you for any coffee money you choose to exchange for some art.

Cheers, 

Katy

story:
Love Your Self

A series of three large scale paintings for ArtPrize Seven in 25 Ottawa downtown Grand Rapids, MI painted by yours truely, Megan LaCroix. I call myself the All Around Artist because I believe in, support and can accomplish anything creative. When I'm creating art I am the best version of myself and pour my positivity into my creations. I believe when we as people accept ourselves and do what we know how to do at the best of our abilities we can shed negativity.

  • I am an alumni from Penny W. Stamps School of Art & Design at the University of Michigan, founder of Arson Capital Alternative Magazine and a creative specialist.
  • I am a freelance artist looking to build my reputation through love and passion for all things creative and self expressive while spreading positivity and self love. 
  • Your contributions fund my ArtPrize Seven paintings, help spread a positive message and help build a better artistic world.

Love Your Self is just one series of work aimed at a more self loving and accepting world. If we love and accept ourselves more, we will be able to do the same for others. 

The Necessities

These are the approximate costs of the supplies needed for my ArtPrize Seven entry, Love Your Self. The paintings are large for a big impact. The spectrum of colors with pops of metallic are to bring your spirits up and encourage an open expression of poisitivity.

  • The canvas sizes are as follow: I need two 6' X 12' canvases and one 5' X 8' canvas. The cost of these canvases will be about $300 for bulk canvas and wood frames.
  • The large size and colorfulness of these paintings will require an extremely large amount of paint. The expected cost for the paint I need is about $700. 
  • All of my funders will recieve a hand crafted, one of a kind piece of jewelry from me. 
  • If I don't make the expected goal, not to worry! My entry will still shine bright but the funds go to constructing the canvas.

The Love Your Self Motto

The reasons Love Your Self is so important to a bigger picture and a brighter world:

  • My artistic back ground has shown me every one is creative but it is your expression of your creativity that is most disregaurded. Through the study of Art & Design, photogaphy, creative writing and working with all kinds people in different back grounds, I found understanding and appreciation of one self is the only way to self expression and a deeper love for yourself. 
  • We experience it all the time, coworkers or bosses who don't share your vision, one thing about yourself you can't seem to like, a great idea you just don't know if you can share, a burning desire to make something, the need to try something new, etc. Leave your doubts from other voices and about yourself behind. Step into acceptance of who you are, the one that grows every day to do better and find happiness. 
  • Self love is the only way to open your mind, heart, body and soul to things outside of yourself. A greater appreciation of yourself will reflect a greater appeciation of your look outward. 
  • We are given this life with so many beautiful ways to experience it. Our heightened senses and consciousness allows us to learn and understand more and more each day while advancing as a global community. Sharing life is one of its meanings. Think about how many tiny things we are made up of. When we stand strongly as our selves, we stand stronger when we are together. Think of every time you proved not only others wrong but yourself by accomplishing something you even for a moment doubted in your mind. Think about if we talked to each other instead of trying to bring outide force into our lives. 

Risks & Challenges

In life comes the risk of setting a goal and not finishing it. The expectation of a calculated out come is more times than not optimism meeting narsisism or just plain selfish. I'd also call it math. The feeling of defeat is a big deterrant from  creativity and as artists of life we feel it all the time. I also feel that the same things can be said about math. We plug in the numbers and variables to get an answer. Some times we get two answers, some times we get it wrong, some times there is a specific order to it, some times there is more than one equation, the problem can always be solved though. With time and steady calculating we accomplish anything we really want to. It is a matter of doing it or not. Trying and trying again or not at all. Doing anything is a risk and puts us through challenge. We can do anything we put our minds to though. Just give it an honest try and remember that it takes practice and experience to become an expert. I won't ever give up. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Please help me share the word. All I want to do is make art that brings at least some one a little more happiness. (even if it's only me, haha)
  • Share this page on your social media. Like I always say, being nice comes at no cost to you. 

I can't wait to meet you at ArtPrize Seven in Grand Rapids, MI at 25 Ottawa from September 23 - October 11, 2015. 

Megan LaCroix

www.Arsoncapital.com

All Around Artist
story_txt:
Love Your Self A series of three large scale paintings for ArtPrize Seven in 25 Ottawa downtown Grand Rapids, MI painted by yours truely, Megan LaCroix. I call myself the All Around Artist because I believe in, support and can accomplish anything creative. When I'm creating art I am the best version of myself and pour my positivity into my creations. I believe when we as people accept ourselves and do what we know how to do at the best of our abilities we can shed negativity.  I am an alumni from Penny W. Stamps School of Art & Design at the University of Michigan, founder of Arson Capital Alternative Magazine and a creative specialist. I am a freelance artist looking to build my reputation through love and passion for all things creative and self expressive while spreading positivity and self love.  Your contributions fund my ArtPrize Seven paintings, help spread a positive message and help build a better artistic world.  Love Your Self is just one series of work aimed at a more self loving and accepting world. If we love and accept ourselves more, we will be able to do the same for others.    The Necessities These are the approximate costs of the supplies needed for my ArtPrize Seven entry, Love Your Self. story:
Please Scroll Down For English...

Proje Hakkında

Merhabalar,

İsmim Barış İzgördü ve New York’ta yaşayan, futbola karsı büyük bir sevgi besleyen bir Grafik Tasarımcıyım. Futbola olan bu büyük sevgimin çoğunluğu aynı zamanda taraftarı da olduğum klüp olan Beşiktaş’a karşı içimde olan karşılıksız sevgiden gelmektedir. Beşiktaş 1903’de kurulmuş bir Türk spor Klübüdür ve halen ülkenin en büyük spor klüplerinden birisi olmaya devam etmektedir. Klüp aynı zamanda benim de doğup büyüdüğüm şehir olan ülkenin en büyük vilayeti İstanbul menşeilidir. 15 yıldan fazla bir süredir gurbette olduğumdan, aile fertlerim dışında hayattaki en büyük özlemim de Beşiktaş’tır.

Bu sıla hasretini biraz olsun dindirebilmek için son 10 yıllık süre zarfında bu formaları biriktirmeye başlamıştım. En sonunda, bu formaları güzel bir proje ve güzel bir yardım işi için kullanmaya karar verdim. Tüm kolleksiyonumu içine alan ve bende olmayan formaların resimlerini de diğer kolleksiyoncu arkadaş, kardeş ve abilerimden aldığım bir kitap tasarladım. Tarihi formalarımızın resimlerinide kendi imkanlarımla dijital ortamda yeniden ürettim.

Bu kitabin tüm geliri Amerika ve Türkiye’deki ihtiyaç sahibi olan Lösemili çocuklar yararına olacaktır. Kesinlikle kar amacı gütmeyen, kişisel bir projedir ve şimdiden yardımlarınız için çok teşekkür ederim.

Neye ihtiyacımız var ve siz ne alacaksiniz?

Öncelikle bu kitabın baskısı için bir finansman gerekmektedir. Paylaşılan video ve resimlerden de görebileceğiniz gibi ciltli bir baskısı ve kaliteli bir kağıdı olacaktır. Sadece 2000 adet limitli sayıda baskısı yapılacak ve 1903 adedi numaralandırılacaktır. Matbaa olarak global anlamda pek çok araştırmadan sonra en nihayetinde en uygun olan işletmeyi buldum ve kampanyaya en uygun olduğunu düşündüğüm bir matbaa ile anlaştım. Bu kampanyanın ilk amacı matbaa masrafını karşılamak olacaktır. Bu kampanya sayesinde kitabın belli sayıdakı adedi zaten satılmış olacak ve geri kalanının satışı ile de daha çok gelir elde edilmesi için satış yoluyla bağış toplanacaktır.

Bu kampanyadaki rakamları minimum bağış miktarlari olarak görmeyiniz. 1 dolardan başlayıp dilediğiniz miktarda bağışta bulunabilirsiniz.

Etki

Bu kampanya ile eminimki milyar dolarlık şirketlerin bağış kampanyalarıyla boy ölçüşemeyeceğim, ama yinede -ufacık da olsa- bu kampanya benim gibi futbol fanatiklerinin de etrafindakiler için yararlı olabileceklerinin bir delili olacaktır. Dahada önemlisi, her bir dolarlik yardım, Lösemili çocuklar için yemek, barınma ve sağlık hizmetleri olarak kullanılacak ve bir fark yaratacaktır.

Daha başka nasıl yardım edebilirsiniz?

Eğer parasal anlamda yardım edemiyorsaniz, sakın üzülmeyin. Sadece tüm arkadaş ve tanıdıklarınızla bu kampanyayı paylaşırsanız, bu bile yeterli olacaktır. Ne kadar çok paylaşım olursa, o kadar çok projenin gerçekleşmesine yaklaşılacağını umuyorum.

Teşekkürler. 


*Yan taraftaki promosyon rakamları ve açıklamaların Türkçesi için yukarıdaki "updates" kısmına bakabilirsiniz.


Short Summary

Hi There,
My name is Baris Izgordu. I am a Graphic Designer who resides in New York and have a passion about soccer (a.k.a. football). Most of my passion for this beautiful game comes from my unconditional love for my favorite team Beşiktaş. Beşiktaş is a Turkish Sports club founded in 1903 and continues to be one of the biggest clubs in Turkey. The club is based in Istanbul, the biggest city in Turkey and also where I came from. I've been living abroad for more than 15 years. Besides my close family, Beşiktaş is the greatest thing in my life that I miss the most. To ease this feeling of homesickness a little bit, I've been collecting these shirts for the last decade or so.

Finally, I've decided to put them in a good use and for a real good cause. I've designed a book that portrays all of my collection as well as a few other fellow collectors' pieces. All of the benefits will be contributed to the charitable funds that benefits children in the United States and abroad. It will be a totally personal, not-for-profit project and hopefully will succeed with your generous help.

What I Need & What You Get

At first, I need funds to have this project printed. As you can see it in the video and images, it will be a hardcover book and will be printed on a special heavy-stock paper. Only 2000 of these limited edition books will be produced and 1903 of them will be uniquely numbered. After an immense search for various printers across the globe, I have finally found one that will be the most beneficial for the campaign. The goal in this campaign will be the printing cost only. Hopefully this campaign will reach its goal and some of the books will already be sold through the perks that you see on the side of this page. If you want to secure your copy, you can act now and use the perks. Remaining books will be sold separately upon the completion of the printing process in order to generate more funds for the total donation.

Please do not think these perks as minimum requests. You can donate as little as 1 dollar to as much as you want.

The Impact

I know that my contribution will not compare to those amounts that are donated through multi-billion corporations, but it will still be an impact and prove the fact that soccer(football) fanatics like me can make a difference in their communities as well. Moreover, as every dollar counts for such charities that provides food, shelter and healthcare for those children that are in need, your help will surely make a difference.

Other Ways You Can Help

Do not worry if you can't help financially. I ask you to simply share this campaign with your friends and loved ones, who may be interested in this project. The more you share, the more it will have a chance to turn into reality.

Thank you very much.

story:
Meet Philip M Soucy

Hello! I am Philip M Soucy, visual artist extraordinaire. Right now, I live and work in San Diego, California. Trained at the Cleveland Institute of Art in Ceramics, my current work is paper based. During my recent sabbatical from making art, I spent my time bicycling the East Coast, baking cookies, learning to frame art professionally, pouring drinks, becoming vegan and meeting the love of my life. Currently, I am working hard making art in all my spare time, so that some day soon I can stop working and make art full time. 

That's where you come in! While most of what it takes to transform my art from passion to vocation is blood, sweat, and tears on my part (which I contribute daily), there are also fairly significant financial hurdles. Spend money to make money, right? Except, of course that I don't have the money to spend. My current budget allows for materials, networking and entry fees, but stops well short of the larger investments that need to be made.

My two biggest hurdles right now are the costs associated with professionally framing my work so its gallery ready, and having fine art prints made. My work has (so far) been exhibited largely in group shows and so framing costs generally come up one piece at a time. This means I've got a large body of work that is not yet framed, and therefore isn't ready for the moment that perfect opportunity strikes. I can't take advantage of a big break if my work isn't ready to be shown. In the mean time, I want to have prints of my best pieces made to make my art more accessible to the masses. These will be fine art prints in limited edition runs, so buyers will still take home a valuable piece of art, not some mass produced poster. The best way to make a name as an artist is to literally get my art out there, and prints are the most effective way to do that. Instead of a very large, single, expensive, original piece of art, I will have multiple, affordable, and variably sized prints of that original. The piece will be in more homes, starting more conversations, sparking more interests, and making my name.

Where the Money Goes

Framing and fine art printing are expensive, and are out of my immediate budget. The catch is that these are two essential steps to transforming my art out of the realm of personal passion into an income generating vocation I can devote myself to full-time. Having a budget that can accommodate these services will be HUGE step towards full time artistry. 

Whenever my work is accepted into exhibitions it needs to be professionally framed and ready to hang in a museum or gallery setting. This costs around $300-$350 for a piece 30x22" without glass, and can cost hundreds more for larger pieces and if protective glass is incorporated.

Giclee prints are a way for me to make my art accessible to a larger audience as I build my name and resume. The affordable price point and easy, smaller size of prints means more people can take home my art from exhibitions, and they also mean I have more opportunities to earn a living from my art. For one original piece of art, it will cost almost $500 to have prints made, 10 at 11x14 and 5 at 18x24. This includes digitizing the original and finishing costs, such as protective sleeves for each print. 

My goal of $2850 would get three originals framed and gallery-ready, as well as giclees of four originals in the limited edition runs described above. If I raise funds beyond the goal (which would be amazing!!), I would use that money first to have another original framed and then to create additional print runs of other pieces. 

What I'm Offering

With your contribution, you are offering me a step along the road to making a lifelong dream become a reality. I want to give you something in return to express my gratitude, and leave you with a souvenir of the journey you're helping along.

For a $10 contribution, you'll receive a hand written postcard printed from one of my pieces. 

At $25 and $100, in addition to the thank you postcard, you'll receive a signed, limited edition art print at either 11x14 or 18x24, depending on the contribution. You can choose one of the four pieces below. Please check out my website: philipmsoucy.com, for larger, more detailed images of each piece.

For contributions of $75, $150, $500, and $1000, you'll receive a custom original work of art. The size of the finished work varies with the size of the contribution. Please look through my website to get a better idea of my current body of work and the kinds of directions your custom piece might take. Contact me with color scheme ideas and any other thoughts you have, and I'll get to work on your personalized work of art!

Everyone Can Be Involved!

I understand not everyone can contribute financially, but you can still be involved! Help me promote my campaign on social media (Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Blogs, Websites….), or even in real life, face to face conversations! Getting the word out is an immensely valuable contribution!

THANK YOU FOR YOUR TIME & SUPPORT!!!!

If I raise funds beyond the goal (which would be amazing!!), I would use that money first to have another original framed and then to create additional print runs of other pieces. What I'm OfferingWith your contribution, you are offering me a step along the road to making a lifelong dream become a reality. I want to give you something in return to express my gratitude, and leave you with a souvenir of the journey you're helping along.For a $10 contribution, you'll receive a hand written postcard printed from one of my pieces. At $25 and $100, in addition to the thank you postcard, you'll receive a signed, limited edition art print at either 11x14 or 18x24, depending on the contribution. You can choose one of the four pieces below. Please check out my website: philipmsoucy.com, for larger, more detailed images of each piece.For contributions of $75, $150, $500, and $1000, you'll receive a custom original work of art. The size of the finished work varies with the size of the contribution. Please look through my website to get a better idea of my current body of work and the kinds of directions your custom piece might take. Contact me with color scheme ideas and any other thoughts you have, and I'll get to work on your personalized work of art!Everyone Can Be Involved!I understand not everyone can contribute financially, but you can still be involved! Help me promote my campaign on social media (Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Blogs, Websites….), or even in real life, face to face conversations! Getting the word out is an immensely valuable contribution!THANK YOU FOR YOUR TIME & SUPPORT!!!!

story:
Cafe Camp

We are a new theme camp for Firefly this year.  After trying to share our food from the kids camp last year we have decided that we need to strike out on our own and be closer to the action.  Food is our art, and we wish to share it with the entire community!

What We Need & What You Get

Our base goal is to raise $600 to pay for ingredients and other supplies to help us bring our art to you.  No matter what we raise we will bring what we can to the community, but the more we get the more we can do!

At our base goal we plan to bring at least four meals and four snacks to the community.  The events we are planning include (but are not limited to):

  • Cakexplosion (July 4th): There will be an explosion of cakes of all kinds to the fireflies to enjoy.
  • Munchkin Tea: A tea-party special for the younger fireflies
  • Whisky Tasting: Taste a selection of whiskies paired with different treats.
If we go above our base goal we plan to add more meals and more events depending on what we get.

story:
Catálogo para quê?

O meu nome é Nuno Quaresma e sou um dos autores envolvidos no Projeto Aka Arte.

O meu papel, dentro deste coletivo de Artistas e Autores que usam a Arte para, humildemente, melhorar o mundo, é o de reunir e publicar os conteúdos e obras num conjunto coerente e inteligível para o público antes de cada exposição, manifestação ou iniciativa cívica e cultural.

Até ao final de 2014 e durante o ano de 2015 estamos empenhados em comunicar e defender iniciativas emblemáticas em torno dos temas Crise | Criatividade | Mudança | Movimento, com enfoque em temáticas específicas como a igualdade, paridade, justiça social, inclusão, liberdade de expressão, sustentabilidade, design e permacultura, empreendedorismo, participação cívica, solidariedade e ética ecológica e ambiental.

Este ano o calendário de eventos já arrancou com a exposição LIND’ MUNDO no MUSA em Sintra e com os vosso apoio será possível publicar em formato impresso a resenha para o catálogo agora disponível gratuitamente em:

Parte1:

http://www.slideshare.net/Quaresma01/000-capa-a-022-final-aka-om-lind-mundo

Parte 2:

http://www.slideshare.net/Quaresma01/023-a-contra-capa-a-044-aka-om-lind-mundo

O que precisamos o de que maneira é que podes ajudar.

Para esta edição pedimos os melhores preços para uma publicação em formato A3, a 4 cores, com 42 páginas de miolo mais capas e contracapas com a tiragem de 500 exemplares e os orçamentos que recebemos oscilam entre os 2600 e os 2000 euros. 

Os 1800 euros que aqui colocamos como objetivo para financiamento coletivo contemplam já os 1ºs patrocínios recebidos até dia 5 de Outubro deste ano e são receita suficiente para materializar esta publicação.

Para o efeito precisamos do teu apoio que será, em todos os donativos entregues, reconhecido e acarinhado com o envio de um exemplar do catálogo e com a oferta de um desenho em formato A4, cortesia dos Autores Aka Arte.

Impacto esperado

Esperamos com esta edição lançar para a completa operacionalidade a nossa estrutura de comunicação coletiva que conta também com uma plataforma on line (www.numdiaperfeito.com ) que explica todas as nossas ações e valências e que serve também de instrumento de trabalho para alguns dos membros da nossa Comunidade.

A comunicar melhor podemos também ser mais eficazes na reunião destas sinergias criativas em torno das Causas que partilhamos e também das Casas de Cultura que visitaremos no nosso calendário de eventos.

Outras maneiras de ajudar

Se porventura não podes ajudar neste formato pecuniário mas sentes um apelo à participação e ao contributo, gostava que soubesses que os nossos motores anímicos são o otimismo, as ideias, os valores e as obras das pessoas com quem nos cruzamos.

Ajuda-nos com a tua criatividade e se tiveres projetos que sintas que nos unem ética e vocacionalmente, contata-nos através do endereço:

aka.arte@gmail.com

“ Num dia perfeito, para além de qualquer austeridade ou conjuntura, não se faz contas à qualidade e quantidade das boas ideias, não se mitiga a força do espírito e da sua criatividade com as amarras do impossível.” 

Fonte: www.numdiaperfeito.com

Ajudas-nos a ir mais longe?

Atenciosamente, com infinita gratidão!

Nuno Quaresma

Aka Arte

story:
WHAT AM I TALKING ABOUT ?!


I am an Artist and these are my projects:


LOVE CAN BE COLORED 

What's your color? Are you red? Are you yellow? Are you blue?

How do you feel? I mean... who are you? Who do you love?

Love is about colors. Love is about how I feel when I meet someone I love. What color am I? And what color do I feel?

Am I straight? Am I gay? Does it really matter? Does it really change the emotions that Love brings to me? I think we are identical. We have just been painted in different colors, that's why people are diverse. Diverse colors, same Love.

6 people: gay man, gay woman, straight man, straight woman, bisexual man, bisexual woman. Do you see any difference between those people? I don't.

--------------------

DIFFERENT COLORS, SAME LOVE

3 Couples. One plus one equals something else. Something new is coming out from a kiss. Its name is Love. Of course, the color is different, but the object and the material is the same. A fusion between two people is creating something extraordinary.

----------------------


WHO AM I ?

My name is Paola Baccigalupo, I'm Italian and I'm an artist. I am getting MA in Visual Arts in the Academy of Fine Arts in Bologna, Italy. I draw and paint on every surface! Paper, canvas and people! Bodypainting is fun!


WHY SUPPORTING ME ?

If you support me I would be able to print my artworks in giant dimension and high quality in order to show them in exhibitions! 

My idea is to print LOVE CAN BE COLORED 2 x 5 metres, and DIFFERENT COLORS, SAME LOVE 1 x 5 metres.  

I would love to exhibit those works, because I think images have a big power on people, and the message they bring is important.


WHAT ELSE CAN YOU DO ?

Talk about the project to your friends, share the video and LOVE each other! You can tell everyone that if this project exists is also because of you!

story:
Send Angela to the Visionary Art Intensive.

I am Angela Raincatcher Roberts and I am a spiritual artist. I work with the deities, natural spirits, and ancestors to create sacred images that are conduits of spiritual energy that connect the physical and spiritual realms.  You can see a sampling of my work at http://tinyurl.com/kmvlg6w. 

I am mostly self-taught, but I find that working with other skilled spiritual artists has kickstarted my creativity, given me insight into my craft, and provided me the courage to open myself up and try new things.

This summer I have the opportunity to study at The Omega Institute with world renowned visionary artists Alex and Allison Grey, founders of the Chapel of Sacred Mirrors. Their artwork and writings have inspired me greatly over the years. 

But I need your help to get there.

The cost of tuition, accommodations for five nights, and transportation will cost approximately $1200. 

Perks for contributors come at a variety of levels, each featuring my artwork. I'm very excited to discover what new works will come out of this intensive learning experience. If you contribute at the $81 level, you can share in this discovery with a 11" x 14" matted print of an artwork created during the intensive. Contributors at the $120 level, receive an original 12" x 12" painting on canvas set with an intention set by you.

Spread the word.

Even if you cannot financially contribute, you can still help by spreading the word about this campaign on Facebook, Twitter, or by emailing your friends.

story:
Help us publishing the book of a unique public art project!

Between the years 2005 - 2008 the arts collective Laboratorio 060 (www.lab060.org) based in Mexico City, invited over 20 artist from different countries (Belgium, Mexico, Portugal, Puerto Rico, El Salvador, Spain and the USA) to produce site specific art works and public art interventions in the Mexican-Guatemalan border town of Frontera Corozal, Chiapas.


The result was Frontera. A Sketch for the Creation of a Future Society and for it, we received the Best Art Practices Award in 2007 (Announcing the winners)

Frontera Corozal, Chiapas, is an 8,000-inhabitant Mexican town located on the shore of the Usumacinta River. The place is situated far away from any “center” or “periphery”, i.e. from the art context as displayed in global urban centers. It worked as a laboratory to explore the possibilities on the public ephemeral life through art. We looked to produce a clash of incompatible, and so far mutually ignored, worlds.

A special symbolic trait of the town is that, when being there, looking to the north means actually looking towards Guatemala. This circumstance traverses a geopolitical imagination, shifting locational paradigms of North and South, triggering a wave of thoughts and symbolic actions.

Frontera was designed with the intention of producing theory from experience. Three units comprehended a methodology that was built as an aesthetic statement regarding contemporary art practices within its relation to social sphere. The first one aimed to deal with the unavoidable dissolution of the present when dealing with public art interventions: the exchanges, the frictions, the encounters, the unexpected, the miscalculations, the awkwardness; all of them as non-transmitable moments ready to be reinvented trough mnemonic-ludic exercises. From there, we developed the other two units: the book and the documentary film. The book goes beyond a summarizing exercise regarding the experience in the streets of Frontera. It is a theoretical cartography that projects fiction as a true possibility for a reachable future. 


Frontera. THE BOOK

Frontera. A Sketch for the Creation of a Future Society, is a bilingual edition (Spanish/English) with more tan 20 texts from authors such as Sven-Olav Wallenstein, Jan de Vos, Tarek Elhaik or Gisele Lisa Bonnici, who analyze, reflect and create theory out of artistic and curatorial practices in relation with the project. Design: Rocío Mireles.

Frontera. THE DOCUMENTARY FILM;

The film puts into question the notion of truth in artistic documentation. If, for a long time, we had overpassed the objectivity in documentary film, when we look at the artistic scene, the documents appear to have still an authority over the work of art as a genuine proof of the artistic execution. Thus the documentary deals with the notion of montage, with the creation of an independent narrative that aims to distort the point of view of the artists, the curators and the people from the town whether as passive spectators or as active  participants. Hence, the film follows the agents on their divers intents to produce meaningful relations. 

The film will be presented in different venues from 2014 onwards. (2014, 107 min)

Directors: Lourdes Morales, Javier Toscano, Iván Lomelí

Producers: Javier Toscano and Daniela Wolf

Editor: Paulina del Paso


The project was based on a very strong sense of teamwork. Together with a great and enthusiastic group of artists (Néstor Batres, Carlos Bunga, Gilberto Esparza, Sandra Gamarra, Ariel Gúzik & Yolanda Gutiérrez, Pablo Helguera, Jesús "Bubú" Negrón, Enrique Jezik, Aníbal López, Isabel de Naverán & Jon Mantzisidor, Miguel Angel Madrigal, Ives Maes, Ronald Morán, Eder Castillo & René Hayashi together with Antonio O'Connell, Diego Pérez, Beatriz Santiago, Yasmin Hage, Miguel Ventura, Tercerunquinto, Héctor Zamora) and with the support of an amazing team of collaborators and supporters (private and institutional), we were able to put together a unique public art project and its documentation (film and publication).

The documentary film is ready to be sent to international festivals and screenings.

The texts are written and the book is layouted. We have a contract with a publishing house, capable of distributing the book internationally.

All we need now is your support to print the bilingual book.

Take a look at this video to see a bit more about Laboratorio 060's projects and about the book we're trying to get published...

story:
---Thanks for all the help guys, a bonus perk has been added, 9x12 archival print of this painting:



Hello and welcome to my first IndieGoGo Campaign! I'm Jason Rafferty, a young recently full-time fine artist based in Asheville, NC. I have been drawing and painting most every day and sharing that work with folks for a bit over five years now! I want to bring a ton of beauty and inspiration into the world! Why not!

"The Diplomat", detail image. Charcoal on paper. Available as a print reward.

I have dedicated a lot of time over the last several years in studying with master artists in order to learn both theory and craft from them. Apprenticing in small studios, just as artists used to. For three years I've worked in the studio of a professional landscape painter, John Mac Kah, based in Asheville, NC. I've studied in the school of Ben Long IV, a master draftsman, oil and fresco painter trained in Italy. I've also been studying at Studio Escalier in France, learning figurative drawing and painting. They offer world-class methods passed down from a historical succession of painters.

In order to really learn drawing and painting and obtain a great freedom of expression, it takes years of dedicated study, applying oneself every day. And the fruits that come from it are sweet!

My current plan is to return to Studio Escalier in Paris, France this May to study drawing for three weeks. A good friend of mine, the artist Toby Hall is teaching a figure drawing workshop there, and as soon as he told me, I went and signed up. The cost of an apartment in Paris for the month is somewhat outside of my budget, however, and I'm asking for your help in paying for it. I have found a place in Montmarte, a ten minute walk from the studio.

"Argenton Roses", oil on belgian linen. Available as a print reward.


To express my gratitude for your generous support, I have a bunch of nice donor rewards available. Original artwork and prints! 

- Prints start at 25.00. You can see a selection of all available prints on my website here.

-Check out the drawings (120.00) and oil sketches (150.00) available as rewards here.

-I am also offering finished, framed paintings, check those out  here. (300.00 & 450.00)

"Torrents of the French Broad", oil on canvas. Available as a print reward.

"Two Hummingbirds and Trumpet Vine", oil on hand-prepared panel. Available as a print reward.


So please help me to go and study with Toby in Paris this May! You'll also help enable me to study Ancient, Renaissance and Baroque paintings and sculptures in the Louvre, and observe the color of Monet's "Waterlilies" cycle in the Musee de l'Orangerie. You'll be able to follow updates about it on the blog here.


Feel free to get in touch with any questions or comments. You can reach me at info@jasonrafferty.com. My website is www.jasonrafferty.com. Thanks for reading, I hope you can help me make this happen!

If you are unable to donate, I would appreciate you sharing the campaign with friends and family who enjoy original artwork by a young emerging artist. We're not quite as well known as the big names, but many of us aspire to be, one day.

"Seven Roses" detail, graphite on paper. Drawn while working with Studio Escalier summer 2014.

"Farmer's Market Gourd", oil on hand-prepared panel. Available as a print reward.

"French Garden Shed", oil on hand-prepared panel. Available as a print reward.

"Temptation", a compilation of figures from Peter Paul Rubens paintings and statues at the Louvre in Paris, Fr. Drawn while studying with Studio Escalier.

"Silk Road", oil on canvas. Available as a "Large Finished Painting" reward. See more here.

"Dustbowl, The River Arts District", available as a "Large Finished Painting" reward.

"Vanitas", copy after Frans Hals. Available as a "Drawing" reward.


Detail of "River Arts Winter Light Study", available as an oil sketch / quick painting reward. Check them out below the drawings here.

Detail of "Study of Tree in a Winter Snowstorm", graphite and chalk on hand-gessoed, hand-toned paper. A drawing reward! More here.

Study after Rubens, pen and walnut ink on hand-gessoed paper. A drawing reward!

Study after Michelangelo, traditional conté (red chalk) on tone paper. 

Available as a drawing reward!


"Conley's Ridge at Penland", oil on belgian linen mounted on panel. Available as a framed finished painting reward (300.00) Check them out on the lower half of this page.

"Linville Gorge at Dusk", available as a framed finished painting reward (300.00). Check them out on the lower half of this page.
story_txt:
---Thanks for all the help guys, a bonus perk has been added, 9x12 archival print of this painting:Hello and welcome to my first IndieGoGo Campaign! I'm Jason Rafferty, a young recently full-time fine artist based in Asheville, NC. I have been drawing and painting most every day and sharing that work with folks for a bit over five years now! I want to bring a ton of beauty and inspiration into the world! Why not!"The Diplomat", detail image. Charcoal on paper. Available as a print reward.
I have dedicated a lot of time over the last several years in studying with master artists in order to learn both theory and craft from them. Apprenticing in small studios, just as artists used to. For three years I've worked in the studio of a professional landscape painter, John Mac Kah, based in Asheville, NC. I've studied in the school of Ben Long IV, a master draftsman, oil and fresco painter trained in Italy. I've also been studying at Studio Escalier in France, learning figurative drawing and painting. They offer world-class methods passed down from a historical succession of painters.In order to really learn drawing and painting and obtain a great freedom of expression, it takes years of dedicated study, applying oneself every day. And the fruits that come from it are sweet!
My current plan is to return to Studio Escalier in Paris, France this May to study drawing for three weeks. A good friend of mine, the artist Toby Hall is teaching a figure drawing workshop there, and as soon as he told me, I went and signed up. The cost of an apartment in Paris for the month is somewhat outside of my budget, however, and I'm asking for your help in paying for it. I have found a place in Montmarte, a ten minute walk from the studio.

"Argenton Roses", oil on belgian linen. Available as a print reward.


To express my gratitude for your generous support, I have a bunch of nice donor rewards available. Original artwork and prints! 
- Prints start at 25.00. You can see a selection of all available prints on my website here.
-Check out the drawings (120.00) and oil sketches (150.00) available as rewards here.
-I am also offering finished, framed paintings, check those out  here. (300.00 & 450.00)

"Torrents of the French Broad", oil on canvas. Available as a print reward.


"Two Hummingbirds and Trumpet Vine", oil on hand-prepared panel. Available as a print reward.

So please help me to go and study with Toby in Paris this May! You'll also help enable me to study Ancient, Renaissance and Baroque paintings and sculptures in the Louvre, and observe the color of Monet's "Waterlilies" cycle in the Musee de l'Orangerie. You'll be able to follow updates about it on the blog here.

Feel free to get in touch with any questions or comments. You can reach me at info@jasonrafferty.com. My website is www.jasonrafferty.com. Thanks for reading, I hope you can help me make this happen!
If you are unable to donate, I would appreciate you sharing the campaign with friends and family who enjoy original artwork by a young emerging artist. We're not quite as well known as the big names, but many of us aspire to be, one day.

"Seven Roses" detail, graphite on paper. Drawn while working with Studio Escalier summer 2014.

"Farmer's Market Gourd", oil on hand-prepared panel. Available as a print reward.

"French Garden Shed", oil on hand-prepared panel. Available as a print reward.


"Temptation", a compilation of figures from Peter Paul Rubens paintings and statues at the Louvre in Paris, Fr. Drawn while studying with Studio Escalier.

"Silk Road", oil on canvas. Available as a "Large Finished Painting" reward. See more here.


"Dustbowl, The River Arts District", available as a "Large Finished Painting" reward.

"Vanitas", copy after Frans Hals. Available as a "Drawing" reward.


Detail of "River Arts Winter Light Study", available as an oil sketch / quick painting reward. Check them out below the drawings here.

Detail of "Study of Tree in a Winter Snowstorm", graphite and chalk on hand-gessoed, hand-toned paper. A drawing reward! More here.

Study after Rubens, pen and walnut ink on hand-gessoed paper. A drawing reward!

Study after Michelangelo, traditional conté (red chalk) on tone paper. 
Available as a drawing reward!

"Conley's Ridge at Penland", oil on belgian linen mounted on panel. Available as a framed finished painting reward (300.00) Check them out on the lower half of this page.


"Linville Gorge at Dusk", available as a framed finished painting reward (300.00). Check them out on the lower half of this page.

story:
My name is Mark Davis

 I make pottery.

In order to keep working I need a kiln (mine died a heroic death)


 A KM 1227 will get me working and bringing handmade pottery to all of you again. At $4000 I can get a good kiln that should last me 15-20 years as well as a base supply of clay to keep me going until my bootstraps kick in. (and shelves and stilts for the kiln.)
 

 If we can go as high as $12,000 I can build a wood-burning kiln as well. A wood-burning kiln could be a cultural keystone for the area. It would allow educators, potters and historians to have first hand contact with traditional firing methods.


$4000 allows me to make a living and to keep all you in all the handmade pottery you may desire.  $12,000 allows me to build a community and create new potters.

If all the money is not raised for the KM 1227, I will take what is earned and invest it in a smaller kiln and plug forward, no matter what.  If you have been sent here by a friend ask them: I WILL keep working. Somehow. :D
