story:
Introduction

Hello, my name is Aviel Ben Yamin. I'm an artist and producer from Portland, Oregon.

For the last 2 years I have been working with many talented writers, artists, and producers which has exposed me to many different genres and styles. From performing at sold out shows, to struggling with a period of major depression, these experiences have ultimately helped my production credibility, business relationships and most importantly my understanding of who I am and what I stand for. In addition to vast networking, I gained a lot of knowledge and insight on "the ins and outs" of the music business, as well as various techniques for recording and production mixing, which ultimately led to the final touches on my debut album "Alone (Truthfully Told)." After many long hours in the studio, sleepless nights, and my self diagnosis of OCD, the album is nearing completion. Though I am releasing it a  year from the initial release date, I am confident the wait is well worth it. Currently my team and I setting up marketing campaigns, music videos, distribution options, and tour planning. 


What We Need & What You Get

Right now we are looking to raise $7,000. This money will be split up three ways The Promotional Campaign - Drip marketing, Twitter and Youtube ads, as well as various other social media and press outlets. CD Duplication & Merchandise - The design of the album cover, physical copies of the album, and the design and production of #Loners T-shirts, hoodies and crewnecks. The Tour - This includes the rental of the Tour Bus, the services of our Booking Agency, Hotel, and Gas.

The national tour will begin Fall of 2015. My fan base has increased significantly across the U.S. and The Alone Tour will be an amazing way for me to connect with my supporters.There are incentive rewards based off any monetary donation. Ranging from a single digital download all the way to a private performance in your city. We are all extremely excited to see this project come to fruition and bring you the best music we can.

The Impact

I believe that the music I have been making has the influence to change the way that we as young people have been trained to think. I believe that we have been losing our morals and our beliefs have been twisted. I am hoping to change that, and to bring common sense back into hip hop music. 

I have seen how negatively society views hip hop, and especially in Portland, where almost every hip hop show is shut down by the police, just because they are uncomfortable with minorities getting together in groups. This is wrong, and it should not be the way that free expression is viewed. 

I believe that we can change this view.

Risks & Challenges

I will be the first to admit that running a successful tour campaign is extremely difficult, there are so many factors for success. With the help of my team I know that we have looked at the risks and have done our best to plan solutions to anything that could happen.

Planning

We have been lucky enough to network with an amazing group of promoters and venues across the country as well as booking agents from NovaTalent, who will be contracted to help plan this tour, with their professional help there should be no problems in booking and planning out the tour.

Ticket Sales

One of the biggest risks with any tour is not selling enough tickets. This is a problem we factored in towards the beginning of brainstorming potential issues for this tour. As I had mentioned above, a portion of the money funded will go into the marketing and promotion of this tour. With our expanding demographic of fans across the U.S and the support of our fans on social media, we believe that every show will sell out.

Other Ways You Can Help


We completely understand that while some of you may want to support, you are not in a position to contribute monetarily. If this is the case we would still love your support by sharing our project around, and continuing to spread the word about what we are trying to do. Word of mouth goes a long way. 

I just would like to thank you all for reading through all of this and I hope to see you on the tour.

-Aviel Ben Yamin

story:
Spearheaded by a talented group of M.A students from London College of Fashion, ZOETIC is a fashion and design publication that provokes its readers to look at the industry from an analytical perspective. This aspirational and inspiring magazine also showcases emerging talent from across the globe who are redefining the fashion and design spectrum.


Let's Celebrate the Next Creative Generation, Let's Showcase it to YOU, Let's be ZOETIC.

A little more about us...

Zoetic was born out of the single idea of bringing the different aspects of the design world in one space. Yes we are fashion students and being a part of this industry we realised that fashion alone was upheld way more than other design forms. The design industry is brimming with creatives doing inspirational and cutting -edge work and not enough platforms exist which can showcase their work.

After a lot of research over the months, we decided to showcase the work of different creatives in such a manner which makes our readers question and think about the present and the future of the design industry. Because we want to start a movement with Zoetic and these questions from our readers will give us the momentum we need! The content has been decided to be spread across 4 sections :

Design & Sex i.e AGENDA - A very eye raising category that this is, we aim to talk about what sex and gender means in a fashion driven society. 

Design & Psychology i.e TONIC - Delves into the psychological aspects of the fashion and design industry. 

Design & Sustainability i.e STANCE - Promoters of sustainability across all spectrums of life, Zoetic dedicates an entire section to people who believe in the same ethos.

Design & Technology i.e RADAR - How design based categories are embracing technology and using it to giving us cutting edge products.

 All our contributors (journalists included) are young creatives from all over the globe and we plan to curate more topics related to all the categories on our online space because the talent out there is inexhaustive and we plan to curate and showcase as much of it as possible.


Risks & Challenges

Committing to a print edition is scary because it involves so many aspects of management starting from curating articles, planning photo-shoots, sending the magazine to print & shipping and getting the word out there, just to name a few. However the most important aspect is to have a strong subscriber base without which none of our aspirational goals can be reached.

We wanted strong design based content and imagery for our magazine and we believe that access to those sort of ideas and information should be free. Deciding to go ad-free is in itself a huge risk but it is one worth taking.

We are working towards getting Zoetic Issue 1 out by mid June and the deadlines are tight. We are excited to deliver the final product on time but we know that there can be unprecedented predicaments that might be unaccounted for. However we will keep all our backers updated about the progress via messages as well as through our social media websites.

How you can help

  • Please share our campaign via email and social media, Indiegogo has all the share tools!!
Help us make Zoetic a reality. 

Love, 
Team Zoetic

story:
Well we have done really well and I want to thank everyone who has helped make this happen!

There are just 3 days left in this campaign so if you were thinking of funding please do!! We are very grateful for you all!!!!

Hello! My name is Suprina, and I'm a sculptor from Harlem, NY. I'm seeking funding for my latest project called DNA Totem. I discovered that found objects, trash to most people, held a fascination and eccentricity for me that I could easily align with my art. That's exactly what I'm trying to do with this sculpture, inspire discussion about the relationship between humans and waste. By funding this sculpture, contributors will help me create a 9' high DNA molecule strand made of steel and embedded with found objects. It will be installed in Marcus Garvey Park. 

The Puffin Foundation has already awarded $1,500 that has gone to purchasing the steel spirals and base. The Parks Department will pay for the signage. This funding I'm requesting will pay for the exterior non-toxic putty, the welder who will help me build the frame and base, transportation and installation which will require three people. 

This project is valuable in that the sculpture is meant to bring up for discussion why we humans, who have such a similar DNA to all the other creatures of the Earth are destroying our habitat. All other animals only produce waste the Earth can assimilate. Why, with our higher capacity for thinking, do we choose to leave our planet in worse shape than when we found it? From our birth to our death each person creates 102 TONS of trash. I feel this is an appropriate subject for the families that will be viewing this outdoor public sculpture. 

In the past I successfully installed "The Circle of Intention", an interactive public sculpture 14' high and 12' diameter. It was funded and built completely with volunteers and shown on Governor's Island for 4 months in 2012. To view this sculpture, please follow this link to my website: http://www.suprinasculpture.com/publicart/1rfwixda217bfz5mum0opqbx5fcylc

I was in the business of giant prop making for over two decades for retailers such as Macy's, Bloomingdales, DKNY, Apple, and Hugo Boss. This gives me the unique ability to work with others, find the best solutions for the least amount of money, and problem solve efficiently. I worked for years doing on-site installations. To view works like this, please check my website for images:

http://www.suprinasculpture.com/props/

Other great ways to help would be to share this campaign on all social networks like Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, and Google+. 

Many thanks for your support!

story:
Short Summary

For four years, two young Guatemalan painters have been providing Saturday classes for up to 36 kids, a monthly food basket for the families and school supplies when the project has some "extra" money.
 
From this Saturday class, we want to select young people who have sufficient talent and interest to go further - to learn to paint in oils.   This is a viable future occupation, as San Pedro la Laguna is a town on the tourist circuit, known for its artists.  This study is a dream of a lifetime for those kids who just love to draw and scribble, for those who view the extraordinary paintings of the teachers of the program and wish they could paint like that.
 
These are children of the poor in San Pedro - of older men no longer able to gain sufficient living in the fields, of single moms who are mostly illiterate, who work selling fruit on the side of the street, or cleaning houses for others.  Several of our children have been abandoned by one or both parents, and live with aunts or grandmothers.  Many of the children have known the problems of family alcoholism.   We want these kids to hope for a future so they don't fall into the same patterns.  We believe that the time spent in the gallery, during class and especially during our proposed private classes, will be time in which our male teachers can provide a good model, and a support for these young kids.   We have already seen this in a few instances.
 
Our basic Saturday class program is covered, as is the food basket for the moms, by the contributions of our madrinas and padrinas, mostly in the U.S., who contribute $24 monthly toward the program.
 
But we don't have funding to teach those kids who are more serious about painting.   We would like to pay our dedicated young teachers for the time they would give to teaching the young artists, and the time they spend promoting their work here in Guatemala. This is a dream of these young painters - to give to other kids what they once received - and of the children, who live to paint.  And what a pleasure it is as program staff watch each of these kids develop their own personal style.
Please visit our website www.paintmyfuture.info
to see some of the teachers' and children's work.
 
PLEASE CONTRIBUTE SO THAT WE CAN HELP THESE YOUNG PEOPLE PAINT THEIR FUTURE!    Contributions thru the website receive a receipt for tax purposes.
 
PERKS FOR YOU!!
Have you ever wanted to visit Guatemala?  Stay in the home of a local family, or in one of the many beautiful but simple hotels, here?  We can help you arrange this.   We can assist you to look behind the scenes in a "3rd world"country....and make real connections with people.
 
How would you like to volunteer with our kids?  You can teach an art class if you want,or simply spend time with the younger kids, helping them with the class activity.  The rewards of this kind of personal interaction are priceless.
 
And that’s all there is to it.

campaign_city: San Pedro la Laguna, Solola, Guatemala

story:
• We are Oly Witch Crew, an art collective and affinity group from Olympia WA. We compile zines which document the intersection between punk/DIY and occult subcultures. In our past two projects, we looked at DIY fashion design (courtesy of Jalisa Ocean and Gina Hopkins), apocalyptic witchcraft (including a limited reprint of "rewilding witchcraft" generously allowed by Scarlet Imprint) Gnostic mythology, and many other topics. We compiled together reviews, rants, comics, recipes, spells, curses, and fashion shoots. Learn more here and here on Cutlines Press!       from Ashes of Irkalla, a photoshoot in Up the Witchpunks #2: Junkyard Occulture, featuring the photography of Mirror x
  • After a long hiatus, we are re-emerging to explore the subject of radical hope. Through collage, poetry, articles, spells, and photography, we want to explore what 'hope' means at a time such as this. 
  • This humble project could have a powerful impact. This is a time when the world needs hope, but not in the sentimental form that so many of us are weary of. This is a time when the world needs a hope built out of struggle, self-knowledge, and intense analysis. This is exactly what we are trying to do, and we have spent many years gathering together the tools and experiences to make such an undertaking possible. 

Some of the topics we will focus on In This Zine

Antifascist Witchcraft, Gnostic Anarchism(anarchos), uncovering crypto-fascism, the Tarot Renaissance, Queer Survivalism, Radical Economics

as well as....

  Kratom Recipes, spooki comics, sigils, Tarot portraits, punk horoscopes

We need 500 dollars! This will be enough, because we are really resourceful. 

we want to increase our print count, reaching a larger audience. Added to the small amount of money we have made from sales of other zines, (many of them we gave away) this would be enough to increase our print count. 

We have a wide variety of perks and rewards you could receive!

Mini zines: these small black and white pamphlets often have print runs of only 10-20, so this may be the only place you can get them! they include satirical christian tracts such as "the man cookie" "the why generation" and "salty revelations". You may also receive "an epistle of thistles", a mini zine featuring vignettes about my life next to some of my art and poetry.

Artifacts:  wrapped stone pendants, magick charms, witchy things, tea, incense

other: stickers, patches, and (potentially) some small 3d printed creations!

a look at some of our Styxx Tracts, our satirical gospel pamphlets: 

Please spread the word! it's important that we get the support and visibility we need to accomplish this! 

 

Up the Witchpunx  documents a new current of subculture. Many of those in radical scenes are exploring witchcraft for the first time. Many witches are radicalizing for the first time, after years in more mainstream circles. Our project tries to create a safe space where these concerns can be discussed.

You can trust us. We have high personal accountability and good reputations in the communities we are a part of. our sincere hope is that after this campaign, we will be supported well enough that it can sustain itself for many years.

Where the Money Goes!

300 dollars will be used for printing.

100 dollars will be used to pay our contributors.

100 dollars will be used for shipping costs, promotional materials and other costs of production (such as art supplies and creation of perks.)

Risks & Challenges

There are certainly challenges! This is a time when situations are unstable all over the world. That is why we are crafting a work of art and magick which is as relevant as possible to peoples everyday struggles.

This is a lot of work! We will need to strengthen our artistic capacities and expand our understanding of the tools we use. We will need to learn how to balance simplicity and complexity. We will need to communicate with our printer in a professional and effective manner. We will need to make rewards/perks that are simple but still heartfelt and beautiful.  We will need to continue developing strong time management skills. We must continue to embrace the mundane aspects of art and media, rather than just focusing on the glamorous parts. 

That being said, all of this is very possible, and with your help we will meet and overcome all of these challenges!

Our Stretch Goals

If we reach 600 dollars, we can...

pay a larger sum to our contributors!

If we reach 700 dollars we can...

the above, plus print with color covers!

if we reach 800 dollars we can...

 do all of the above, plus increase the quality of the perks, increase our print count, and print more stickers. ​

if we reach $1000 or more?

All of the above, plus an even bigger print count, and even more money we can share with our contributors! Our biggest dream is an art studio or office space so that we can make art and zines in a place other than our tiny studio apartment. What do you think?

Send us your suggestions at upthewitchpunx@riseup.net !

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are very low income, thats fine! Even a dollar helps, and gets you included in the 'thank you' section of the zine! If you cant give a dollar...

You can still spread the word! Talk about us! Share, reblog, like!

Indiegogo has some great share tools, please feel free to use them. 

If you have any need to email me...i can be reached at gg_irkalla@riseup.net

My editor Ezmyrelda can be reached at ezmyrelda@riseup.net 

Thank you!
story_txt:
We are Oly Witch Crew, an art collective and affinity group from Olympia WA. We compile zines which document the intersection between punk/DIY and occult subcultures. In our past two projects, we looked at DIY fashion design (courtesy of Jalisa Ocean and Gina Hopkins), apocalyptic witchcraft (including a limited reprint of "rewilding witchcraft" generously allowed by Scarlet Imprint) Gnostic mythology, and many other topics. We compiled together reviews, rants, comics, recipes, spells, curses, and fashion shoots. Learn more here and here on Cutlines Press!       from Ashes of Irkalla, a photoshoot in Up the Witchpunks #2: Junkyard Occulture, featuring the photography of Mirror x


After a long hiatus, we are re-emerging to explore the subject of radical hope. Through collage, poetry, articles, spells, and photography, we want to explore what 'hope' means at a time such as this. 
This humble project could have a powerful impact. This is a time when the world needs hope, but not in the sentimental form that so many of us are weary of. This is a time when the world needs a hope built out of struggle, self-knowledge, and intense analysis. This is exactly what we are trying to do, and we have spent many years gathering together the tools and experiences to make such an undertaking possible. 

Some of the topics we will focus on In This Zine
Antifascist Witchcraft, Gnostic Anarchism(anarchos), uncovering crypto-fascism, the Tarot Renaissance, Queer Survivalism, Radical Economics
as well as.... 
  Kratom Recipes, spooki comics, sigils, Tarot portraits, punk horoscopes

story:
Short Summary

Studio Vine Glass is owned and operated by newly-engaged Claire Anderson and Steven Woodruff. We spent a number of years travelling around working in other glass manufacturing plants and artistic studios before we decided we very much wanted to have a studio of our own. We are both insanely passionate about what we do and care very deeply about glass, local manufacturing and the importance of small businesses to the economy.

We began Studio Vine Glass about two and a half years ago and have finally reached a point with our customer base that it was necessary to make the next step; go from renting time to operating our own glass blowing studio. About seven months ago we bought a small, abandoned mechanic shop in Niagara Falls and have spent all of this time gutting then renovating it into our studio space. It is a really uniquely challenging experience and has proven to be the largest project we have taken on together,....and we are SO CLOSE!

Everything is built and ready, orders are lined up, but we are waiting on permitting! Turns out it is particularly difficult to get all of the proper stickers when building a glass blowing studio, and is an insanely costly process. This is where we could sure use a bit of help. 

What We Need & What You Get

We are asking for $10,000 for this final stretch. All of it will go to subsidizing building costs; we still have to re-do our public bathroom (to code), re-build our storage space, pay for all of the appropriate inspectors to come through and cover the first couple months of operational costs while we get back on our feet and into a production routine. 

We are selling all kinds of goodies, so it is easy for you to choose the donation amount you are most comfortable with. Our hand blown glass wares are for sale; primarily our infamous 'Old Fashions', but we also have decanters up for grabs, private workshops and classes and the largest donation means we will name our furnace after you!! (among other things)

The Impact

This project is important to us because this is the life we are so passionate about. We are willing to move worlds if it means we can just keep blowing glass. In a larger sense, glassblowing has been around since the Roman times and is a tradition that is beautiful and challenging. It is a difficult skill to learn, but that is where the best lessons are learned. We feel very strongly about all trades and arts and the benefits they have on not only the maker's life but for humans in general and our ability to learn and specialize.

While we have never run a crowd funding campaign before, with our determination and all of the skills we have learned this past seven months, I have no doubt we will succeed. With essentially nothing, we started our company two years ago and have grown to selling all over Canada, showcasing in gallery exhibitions all over Ontario and growing our company to a point of re-investing in property and equipment. Support local economy and creative/ entrepreneurial talent!

Risks & Challenges

There are SO MANY RISKS involved with building a glass blowing studio. Especially in a time when the economy isn't great, and our trade has already been largely taken over by robots. Fuel and raw material costs are huge, our equipment is all specialized and pretty difficult to build or source, and navigating through all of the necessary safety systems and compiling proper combustion systems is one of the most confusing tasks I have ever participated in.

But, we want this so bad and have come up with all kinds of ways to cut costs elsewhere; recycle used materials, build our own tools and equipment, and create a sleek and contemporary line of functional blown glass wares. We chose the Niagara region to partner up with the food and wine scene, as well as piggy back onto the 'local and handcrafted' marketing.  We have also found that there is a large percentage of the population looking to support businesses like ours. It's the push-back to our current throw-away culture. Our customers are the ones that value quality over quantity and that want to spend their money in ways that make a positive impact.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate, that is ok with us! We sure understand what it is like to be a little financially tight (I mean, here we are heh heh). You can still help us by sharing this video with everyone you know! Post it somewhere, email it to all your friends and family, send it to your rich uncle's brother that owns that small island....you know, whatever.

Share this for all the good karmas! And don't forget to use Indiegogo's sharing tools. And remember we appreciate every single one of you.

story:
Psychic Taxi is collaborating with MacGyver (aka Graham Linn), to incubate a brand new concept.  We are bringing to life a neighborhood of micro bars, fostering community and conversation at Burning Man 2017.  Modeled after the Golden Gai (golden district) bars in Shinjuku, Tokyo, Psychic Taxi is going to feature an alleyway of tiny bars, each only 8’x12’ and able to serve just a few patrons at a time.  Each Gai will be uniquely personalized and will offer a variety of curiosities while open: a full-service, traditional UK bar; a nautical themed sailor bar; a “Cash Only” bar (featuring music of Roseanne and Johnny Cash, of course); a Moroccan inspired lounge serving up Tea and Tantra; and more!  All funds raised will go towards building materials, art supplies, and transportation of the bars. This is Golden Guy’s pilot year and we hope to raise interest in the concept and plan on its growth over the following years with additional barkeeps/hosts.  What would the theme and concept of YOUR microbar be??  Reach out to us if you have an idea for a bar, or visit us on Playa to get inspiration for 2018!  Thank you for helping us bring an unexpected moment of beauty, joy, and serendipity to the Burning Man community!!

Golden Guy Logo © Tessa Thornberry

story:
Waist High & Elbow Deep. A series of live movement events, public body installations, and photo/video exhibitions recognizing the complexities of physical consent and resistance.  


What Have We Gotten Ourselves Into? We ask that essential question; you answer with your bodies. Games and play become saturated with the dichotomies of traditional social roles, unequal reproductive rights, and gendered expectations. Consent, resist, or question. Follow the lead or find your own way. Participate as viewer, director, or researcher with rare proximity to humans in the wild.

Waist High & Elbow Deep maintains a casual aesthetic and blends easily into the everyday. Boundaries of reality, time, and place are trumped by the sensations of exertion, awkwardness, and discovery. Events welcome uncertainty, adaptability and humanity.  We build community through experience.


More Specifically. We are seeking your support for the 2014 – 2015 project titled Waist High & Elbow Deep. It will include a collection of performances in Chicago, Cleveland, and Grand Rapids in addition to ruptural infestations of public spaces. Participatory performances hosted at small venues with limited audiences maintain the delicate framework of this inclusive work. Fundraising underwrites the actual cost of the project, so ticket prices remain low. Stagings in public spaces are presented at no charge and documented for distribution through web, artist book, and visual arts exhibitions.

All funds raised through Indiegogo may be tax deductible through Fractured Atlas. We are seeking additional project support from public and private granting organizations and your donations will help us get there. Your donations are used to match granted funds, and to show the wide base of support for this work. Funds raised cover performance space, rehearsal space, performers’ stipends, travel, costumes, advertising, and insurance costs.


Be Moved. MegLouise has been crafting performance experiences for over a decade, but we are not your typical company.  We create movement events that uphold our ideal of embodied living. Our work challenges you to become more aware of your physical instincts and to appreciate the dynamics of the physical world surrounding your everyday.  These virtues inform our deeply personal, highly sensitized movement pieces.  Your financial contribution ensures that we can continue our work, reach out to new audiences and offer an intense dose of humanity to those we serve.

MegLouise has a successful track record of performance and installation. The collective began in 2002 and has presented by invitation at the Junction Arts Festival in Toronto, DUMBO Dance Festival in New York, RADfest in Michigan, Cincinnati Fringe Festival and Ingenuity Festival in Ohio, to name only a few venues. In 2013, MegLouise was awarded an In The Works Residency at Chicago Cultural Center for the development of Watching Brief, presented at Links Hall. Learn about current and past projects on our website www.meglouise.info.


Do As Much As You Can. You can support this work in so many ways.  In addition to donating:

  • Tell Others About This Work
  • Share on Facebook, Twitter, or by Email
  • Come to WHED Events & Bring Others
  • Stay Involved - Sign Up for the online Newsletter!


Photo Credit: MB Stanton

Video Credits: Kellen Walker, Chelsey Shilling, and Megan Pitcher

Special Thanks from Collaborators: Megan Pitcher, Penelope Hearne, Angela Luem, Emily Rose, Kelly Skala, Meghan Murphey-Sanchez, and Caitlin Rafferty

story:
I'm an independent visual artist based in Vancouver, BC, on the west coast of Canada. My paintings reflect my passion about the ocean as well as my concerns about climate change, habitat loss, pollution and overfishing. With my work, I support local environmental organizations engaged in ocean advocacy.

I'm creating a full-colour 12-month eco-calendar of my ocean paintings that will be printed locally on environmentally-friendly paper. Each month will feature a different 8 x 10 image, as well as important ocean-related dates and resources. Your contribution will help cover the initial printing costs for the calendar. Raising more money would allow me to enhance the design and print a larger run. I'll sell the calendars through my studio, my website, at events, and through selected retailers. A portion of the proceeds from sales will benefit environmental organizations working to protect the BC coast from oil tankers.

What I Need & What You Get

The calendar will be a full colour, 12-month wall calendar, with each month featuring an 8" x 10" image of one of my paintings. It will be printed locally in Vancouver on environmentally-friendly paper (FSC 100% post-consumer). Because of the great relationship I have with my commercial printer, I'm able to print a short run of calendars at a unit cost that is usually only available to businesses printing 5000 or more pieces. The initial $1500 raised will cover a print run of 200 calendars. (More money = more calendars, less money = fewer calendars.)

As a supporter of this project, you'll receive your own calendar(s) and/or postcards and reproductions of the images in the final printed piece. And my gratitude!

Other Ways You Can Help

Regardless of whether you're able to make a contribution at this time, I'd love your help spreading the word about my campaign. Indiegogo has easy tools to help you share on Facebook and Twitter, and then there's plain old word of mouth and a quick email with a link to this page. I appreciate every boost! Thanks in advance for your help.

story:
"MY NAME IS BRUNI SABLAN AND I AM THE ORIGINATOR AND CREATOR OF 'THE JAZZ MASTERS SERIES BY BRUNI'. I HAVE CONTRIBUTED TO THE VISUAL BIOGRAPHY OF JAZZ IN PORTRAITURE FORM FOR THE PAST 25 YEARS. THIS IS VERY IMPORTANT TO ME BECAUSE JAZZ IS AMERICA'S CLASSICAL MUSIC. I HAVE MADE THIS MY LIFE'S WORK AND PASSION TO
DOCUMENT THESE MUSICIANS TO PRESERVE THEIR HISTORY AND CONTRIBUTION. I DEPICT THEIR LIVES ON CANVAS FROM YOUTH, TILL END OF LIFE. THEY ARE MY FRIENDS AND MY FAMILY, AND I KNOW MANY OF THEM PERSONALLY." ~BRUNI

 

BRUNI BIOGRAPHY:

The Jazz Masters Series by BRUNI' is an explosive experience of color and
soul, an emotional body of work that now numbers over 1,400 original canvases of Jazz greats. Her wildly expressionistic brush captures the very depths of their spirit. One of BRUNI's Duke Ellington Portraits is in the permanent collection of The Smithsonian Institution in Washington, D.C.

Regarded by many as “The greatest living portrait painter”, this highly acclaimed Artist has paintings in the permanent collections of these Museums:

MUSEUMS:
-The Smithsonian Institution in Washington D.C.
-Universal Studios: The Downbeat Jazz Hall of Fame Museum in Orlando, Florida -Kansas City Jazz Museum: 18th & Vine Authority in Kansas City, Missouri -The Putnam Museum – Bix Beiderbecke Hall in Davenport, Iowa
-The Los Gatos Historical Museum in Los Gatos, California

EDUCATION:

  • Figure drawing and painting studies at Villa Montalvo and the University of Mexico
  • Private color studies with Grumbacher Color Award winner Michael Linstrom
  • 20 years of owning and running her own Gallery, privately conducting intensive life drawing classes with live models. Teaching and leading workshops and lectures throughout the Bay Area.

BRUNI’s work has recently entered the “Collectors Market”, after an exhibit in New York City, which also included Franz Kline, Jean Dufy, and Miles Davis, as part of The Definitive Jazz Auction. Her work has been published worldwide in many forms: Lithographs, CD covers, Feature magazine articles, posters and more. As a testament to her profound ability to “Capture the essence; that which is intangible”, many of the greatest Musicians in history are fans and collectors: the late Miles Davis, Dizzy Gillespie, Carmen McRae, Roberta Flack, Jazz critic Leonard Feather, and numerous others.
You may view BRUNI’s work daily at her own BRUNI Gallery in Northern
California. 1171 Lincoln Ave. San Jose, CA. 95125

What We Need & What You Get:

BRUNI needs $50,000 to keep the Jazz Master Series by BRUNI going. This only covers just the cost of canvases, paints, towels, easels, frames, ALL painting supplies, sketch books, cost of rent, and electricity for just one year. The cost to keep going is actually so much more, but we feel this would at least give BRUNI some much needed help.

  • Fortunately, BRUNI has a rich body of work that has already been built through the years. The PERKS she will give are fantastic!
  • IF she does not reach her goal of $50,000, the money donated will still go to all that is listed above. Know that you are giving to a very worthy cause. We must help and support our 'artist treasures' while we have them here, not only after they have gone.

The Impact: (Here is a personally written letter by BRUNI, sharing her feelings about the 'Impact' this will have.)

"This campaign is important to me because the art work I do for Jazz has to continue. I have not painted all the musicians that need to be painted, and I feel that they should all be represented by great portraits. By your contributions,
it will help me to continue this important, educative work because since it is
of an educational nature, it is not easy to sell. I am not a non-profit. You
will be helping to keep jazz, which is America's truly original art form alive
through my portraits.  I have spent 22 years going to live gigs, drawing the musicians in sketch books as they played.  I have studied and researched
all of their lives, and when kids and local students come into my
"gallery" they learn who these great people are/were by gazing at
their portraits, and learning about them. That is priceless. I often talk to
them personally and hopefully have helped them in some inspirational way.

I feel that I need at least $50,000 to keep on going. These funds go specifically toward materials, studio maintenance, which includes rent, utilities, phones, display space for showing, assistants which allow me the freedom to paint in peace, research, time involved and freedom to paint the Jazz Series without interruptions from other work.

My unique perks are:
Signed 5"x7" reproductions, signed limited edition lithographs, and
even original sketches in pen and ink and more.

The funds will enable the 'Series' to continue whether I reach my goal or not, they will go toward materials, canvases, brushes, lights, studio, so that I may continue on my path.

My project is valuable to the contributor and to the world because there is no other artist of my caliber painting  these American Icons. I'll make it real by stating that without this Series the future generations will NOT KNOW WHO LOUIS ARMSTRONG, OR MILES DAVIS, OR MARY LOU WILLIAMS AND COUNTLESS OTHERS WERE. JAZZ WILL BE A FORGOTTEN PHOTOGRAPH BOOK IN A DEAD LIBRARY.


FINALLY FOR THOSE WHO CANNOT CONTRIBUTE YOU CAN STILL HELP BY GETTING THE WORD OUT, AND MAKING NOISE ABOUT BRUNI'S MASTERPIECES!!!  AND MAKE SURE TO USE THE INDIEGOGO SHARE TOOLS!

~BRUNI

I HAVE CONTRIBUTED TO THE VISUAL BIOGRAPHY OF JAZZ IN PORTRAITURE FORM FOR THE PAST 25 YEARS. THIS IS VERY IMPORTANT TO ME BECAUSE JAZZ IS AMERICA'S CLASSICAL MUSIC. I HAVE MADE THIS MY LIFE'S WORK AND PASSION TODOCUMENT THESE MUSICIANS TO PRESERVE THEIR HISTORY AND CONTRIBUTION. I DEPICT THEIR LIVES ON CANVAS FROM YOUTH, TILL END OF LIFE. THEY ARE MY FRIENDS AND MY FAMILY, AND I KNOW MANY OF THEM PERSONALLY." ~BRUNI

story:
Welcome!

I started Brooklyn Birdhouse to bring more birdhouses to nesting birds and to create objects inspired by birdhouses. Birdhouses are the perfect combination of my three passions: designing, building, and art-making. Brooklyn Birdhouses are designed and built by me. Each piece of wood is individually cut, drilled, and painted. Care is put into each birdhouse. My Instagram @bklynbirdhouse features some my functional and decorative pieces.

For the past 10 years, I ran my own successful small business--an art studio for children from 18m-grade 5 in Brooklyn, NY. It was a wonderful experience, and was difficult to make the decision to close. I loved being part of something bigger than me, creating with young students and bringing art to the neighborhood. But it was time to change things up. Bert from Mary Poppins said it best: “Winds in the east, there’s a mist coming in, like something is brewin’ and ’bout to begin.” After planning for many months, I created Brooklyn Birdhouse.  

I am crowdfunding to build the business. With funding, I will be able to acquire necessary saws and tools, build out my workshop (it’s micro!), develop a website/online store, and create digital/print materials. It would be amazing to go beyond the fundraising goal to create more designs for different birds (bluebirds, owls, and more) and home decor.

I plan to have the business up and running this spring, at which time I will end crowdsourcing and begin selling online and in brick and mortar shops. I welcome any leads or recommendations of shops that may be interested in carrying Brooklyn Birdhouse.

Thanks for reading!

 

Perks

When you support Brooklyn Birdhouse, you will also receive a lovely perk! 

$25

  • Your name as a supporter on brooklynbirdhouse.com

$50

  • One decorative birdhouse mirror shipped to you
  • Your name as a supporter on brooklynbirdhouse.com

$75

  • One functional or decorative birdhouse of your choice, local pickup only in Park Slope, Brooklyn
  • Your name as a supporter on brooklynbirdhouse.com

$100

  • One functional birdhouse of your choice shipped to you
  • Your name as a supporter on brooklynbirdhouse.com 

$200

  • Build your own decorative birdhouse at my micro workshop with guidance, materials, and use of tools.  This perk can be used by anyone age 10 and up.
  • Your name as a supporter on brooklynbirdhouse.com

 

Birdhouses will be available for local pickup and delivery in about a month from when you make your donation. Please be patient as I source the materials and hand-build your birdhouse.

 

Functional Birdhouses

I created three functional birdhouse (nest box) designs after months of researching, designing, tweaking, prototyping, and redesigning. These nest boxes are for use outdoors specifically for chickadees and wrens. You may also prefer to keep them indoors as a decorative element in your home. There is door for hiding treasure!

 

Functional birdhouses are designed with the bird’s needs in mind and they feature:

  • Predator guard to deter little mammal arms
  • Ventilation to reduce overheating
  • Drainage to keep interior dry, prevent hypothermia
  • Access panel (with latch) for clean out and inspections
  • No perch to deter bird predators
  • Overhang and slanted roof to shed water and keep inside dry
  • Recessed floors to prevent water seepage
  • Ladder for fledglings to climb and exit the nest box
  • Appropriately sized entrance hole for intended species
  • Thoughtful materials: low VOC paints, weather-resistant cedar, non-toxic glues

 

Decorative Birdhouses

Decorative birdhouses are for indoor use or outdoors if they are sheltered from the elements. There is no space for an actual bird to nest. Detail is put in to every birdhouse: selection of birdhouse body, roof angle and design, perch choice, and proportion of house to base. Each piece is a unique work of art, using natural materials and vintage hardware.  

 

Birdhouse Mirror

The Birdhouse Mirror is a decorative and functional piece with a mirror in place of the entrance. This birdhouse is also handmade and has a shingled roof and natural branch perch, providing a unique decoration for your home. The Birdhouse Mirror is 12-3/8" tall, 9-5/8" wide, 1-7/8" deep and is ready to hang.

 

The Need

Birdhouses on the market today are either unsafe for birds or a tad on the plain side. I wanted to design birdhouses which are both super cute and functional. In addition, each of the three functional designs are available in four different accent colors, allowing for more personalization. 

My decorative birdhouses are thoughtfully "green." They give new life to driftwood and downed trees and branches. I also source vintage hardware, to give a new appreciation to old metal findings.

The Birdhouse Mirror gives humans a fun and functional element for your home. It brings the birdhouse inside for you to enjoy. I hope to add more to this collection in the future.

 

Spread the Word!

Please let your friends know about Brooklyn Birdhouse! Indiegogo share tools are at the top of the page.

story:
Last Friday 09/27/13 Steven Knight passed from this earthly world. A beloved Husband, Dad, Son and Grandfather, and an artist that poured his soul into his creations. His death was sudden and tragic, and has affected so many people. Often beauty and tragedy are intertwined. We are still reeling from his passing, but we feel him with us and all around us. His will live on through his wife Laurel, his seven children, four grandchildren and the scores of people that he touched. His last art piece "Transcendence" will continue to inspire the art spirit in others, and his incredible body of sculptural works will impact and move people for generations to come. 

We are grieving as a family, but we will honor your contributions to our campaign, and send the perks when we find some order amongst this tragic chaos. Please be patient with us. If you prefer a refund for your contribution, please let us know. If you do not wish to receive a perk, but would like to contribute to assist our family during this difficult time, we sincerely appreciate that as well. 

We will be casting Steven's last incredible art piece "Transcendence" in the near future through a new campaign that will share his art legacy with the world. If you wish to be notified of this in the future, please send an email with your information to webforms@artbyknight.com. 

My dad's dream was to share his art with the world, bring beauty into life and help inspire others to live their art spirit. Please help us honor him by living your art spirit and embracing life and love to the fullest. Thank you. ~Tawnya Knight


  WHAT IS IT ABOUT?

"I Have the Art Spirit" was created by a family and team of artists; husband, wife and daughter.  We have combined our artistic passions of sculpture, painting and music, all with a common theme of  “I Have the Art Spirit”. We are here to start a MOVEMENT...a world wide Art Spirit movement....and it begins, with you!

We want to Inspire everyone to recognize their unique gifts.
We wish for every human being to Embrace their own creative energy, and those of others.
And we encourage each and every one of you that are still searching for your purpose, to find and Awaken your art spirit!
We are humbly inviting you to be a part of this Universal Movement.  


     WHY WE NEED YOU!

Our goal is to accomplish a life-long dream of being able to get our art directly to you -- those who embrace the Art Spirit. Through Indiegogo we can finally reach out to all of you around the world! Our journeys haven't always been focused on living our Art Spirit, as many of you can likely identify with. With this campaign, we have now laid it on the line and we are pursuing what we were born to do! But we need your help to go forward.  Your generous contributions will help the Art Spirit Movement to gain traction and provide us with the ability to continue to create meaningful art that anyone can own and enjoy.  You will also be instrumental in establishing IHaveTheArtSpirit.com.  The website will be born of this campaign, and will create the platform for people anywhere, to share, support and embrace their creativity.


MEET THE ARTISTS!

(Click names to view the individual videos for each artist's creation)

Steven L. Knight is an accomplished classical, figurative realist sculptor. He has lived a very colorful and diversified life. Steven grew up in a rural environment, spending years in the beauty of nature, surrounded by incredible wildlife and majestic horses. His connection to this special period in his life is evident in his extensive body of sculptural work. He is also a dad and grandpa, an avid outdoors-man, and loves his quiet time to reflect on the beauty of the world. Steven has shown in major galleries, has his line of relief bronze belt buckles circulating the world, and is now continuing his journey with “I Have the Art Spirit”.

Laurel Knight is a dynamic and passionate individual. She is a voracious reader, always hungry for knowledge or a new experience. Laurel takes pleasure in the little things, from the laughter of a young child, or the enjoyable antics of a mischievous squirrel, to the light breeze on a sunny summer day. She has built quite a diverse body of works, which were inspired by her many years as a mother and grandmother, as well as her love for the old masters and the great outdoors. Now that all of her children are grown, Laurel has finally turned her full creative energy to her oil painting, and is fully expressing her artistry through this campaign.

Tawnya Knight is a person of many interests as well as the Creative Director at Art by Knight. She grew up singing & performing in live musicals, and eventually turned toward the art of sales. She has since returned to her first love of music and art, and is able to express her passion through “I Have the Art Spirit”. Tawnya spent happy years growing up in the wild beauty of Montana, and after 11 years in Southern California, has found her heart in sunny Central Oregon. Tawnya spends her time with her family at Art by Knight; directing social media and creative aspects of the business, writing poetry, working on music, and making hand-crafted jewelry.


"The Spirit of Art" ~ Canvas Prints

A gorgeous Limited Edition Triptych (3 paintings) that represent the stages of the Art Spirit journey. Each is indicative of the Art Spirit, by the gesture, design, and name of the piece. Be uplifted by "Inspire", be elevated by "Embrace", and be enlightened by"Awaken".See the Perks to select the individual prints, or the complete triptych! Note: You may choose from the Full Color, the Black & White or Sepia Glow! Your specific choice will be handled in the order survey, which we'll send after the campaign ends.

"Inspire" ~ Full Size Image for Better Viewing of Details

"Embrace" ~ Full Size Image for Better Viewing of Details

"Awaken" ~ Full Size Image for Better Viewing of Details

"The Spirit of Art"  in Full Original Color

"The Spirit of Art"  in Black and White

"The Spirit of Art"  in Sepia Glow

________________________________________________________

Whatever Lifts Your Spirit ~ Canvas Prints

While we hope that "The Spirit of Art" moves you....we realize that not everyone is lifted by the same thing. So we are bringing these fan favorites to you, our contributors, at super special pricing!  These Specially Selected Prints are sure to warm your heart, bring back memories, or intrigue your guests.  Note: Your specific choice will be handled in the order survey, which we'll send after the campaign ends.


"Ocean's Symphony" a passionate and powerful seascape Fine Art Print!

"Twist of Fate" a figurative Fine Art Print portraying everyday working men, that look intriguingly familiar!  See if you can recognize them all!!

"Beyond the Bend" a colorful and vibrant idyllic landscape Fine Art Print!

________________________________________________________

Mini Masterpieces ~ Archival Canvas Prints

From the captured beauty and innocence of childhood, the special moments in life frozen in time and the majestic tranquility of mother nature and the great outdoors...get your Mini Masterpieces and own tiny treasures that will bring joy and beauty for many years to come!
These Mini Masterpieces are true fine art, yet small enough to fit anywhere! Display them all, or one-at-a-time for a fresh perspective. They make fabulous and unique gifts! Get five mini's for only $50! Christmas shopping? Knock out that list with the $100 perk and get 12 of these Mini Masterpieces!
Printed on Archival Canvas with the same level of quality as our large prints! Mounted on acid-free backer board, and UV coated for extreme longevity. Printed and signed by the Artist, Laurel Knight.

____________________________________________________________________  

"Transcendence" ~ Fine Art Bronze Sculpture

This magnificent and sweeping piece, represents your own personal creative freedom and the spiritual connection to the Art Spirit.  Spread your wings to fly, and know that because of our shared Spirits....you are never alone!  "Transcendence", shown here in the original clay, will be cast in bronze using the lost wax casting method, and mounted on a beautiful solid black granite base. Your finished Bronze Art will last the centuries.

The sizes are as follows:

Full Size (100%) Bronze Sculpture measures 22" high (on a 1 1/4" thick black granite base), and 23" wide (wing tip to wing tip).  

3/4th Size (75% reduction) Bronze Sculpture measures 16.5" high (on a 1 1/4" thick black granite base), and 17.25" wide (wing tip to wing tip). 

1/2 Size (50% reduction) Bronze Sculpture measures 11" high (on a 1 1/4" thick black granite base), and 11.5" wide (wing tip to wing tip). 

All three sizes are available in three stunning patina (color) options.  Patination: The coloring of a Bronze Sculpture accomplished by a trained craftsman/artist using various chemicals under heat to create a multitude of finishes.

________________________________________________________

Bronze Relief Medallion

High-Relief Sculptural Medallion of "Transcendence" size 10" x 10"

 Patina options same as the three dimensional "Transcendence" sculpture.  

Artistic Rendering of High-Relief Bronze Medallion 

________________________________________________________

Original Song “I Will” by Tawnya Knight

Tawnya Knight has written an original song titled "I Will".  This song represents what lifts you when you are in your darkest hours.  It is clean, classic and genre-less.  It is still to be mastered in the recording studio, so please watch the project video below, to hear a few samples of the song.  "I Will", is to be released in three (3) versions.  The original piano version, a "folksier" acoustic version, and a "full band" version with piano, perhaps a violin and more!  Tawnya will master each of these versions in the recording studio to bring you the very best quality available.  You can see the lyrics at this link: "I Will" Lyrics

Tawnya has had experience working with some very talented musicians in the past. Please sample some of these awesome songs by "Palace View", vocals by Tawnya Knight, written by Graeme Dickson (also on guitar, bass and drums) and accompanied on keyboard by Brian Dickson. 

Sorrow Hole     Tawnya Knight on vocals

Without You     Tawnya Knight on vocals

Unforsaken      Tawnya Knight on vocals

Pieces Without Me      Tawnya Knight on vocals

The fabulous piano in the song, "I Will", is written and played by the incredible Dave Finch. He will be the "Piano Man" for two versions of the song, and he is playing the piano background in the videos. 

________________________________________________________

______________________________________________________

________________________________________________________

_______________________________________________________

_______________________________________________________

_______________________________________________________

________________________________________________________

_______________________________________________________

_______________________________________________________

________________________________________________________

________________________________________________________

_______________________________________________________

________________________________________________________

_______________________________________________________

________________________________________________________

________________________________________________________

HOW DO I CONTRIBUTE?

You may contribute to our campaign by clicking on the “Contribute Now” button. You’ll be able to enter how much you want to contribute, claim your perk, and choose how you want to pay. We accept Visa, MasterCard, and American Express credit or debit cards, or you can choose to pay via PayPal. No worries...your information is secure! If you have questions please message our team, comment in the project, or see Indiegogo’s FAQ’s.      

  

We at Art by Knight, want to do something never before seen on Indiegogo. We are combining three mediums that people can enjoy in different ways. We want to move you with our art. Of course, that is what great art is all about...it speaks to YOU. 

We have some fabulous PERKS for you, from incredible Limited Edition Fine Art, to beautiful music, and awesome logoed swag! But we are also going to take you along for the journey! 

We are going to post updates to share our progress and accomplishments.  We are going to create videos of our experiences at the bronze foundries, the music studio, and other stops along the way. We are going to connect with you on Facebook, Pinterest, and on our Blog and websites. We are going to establish a Community of creative individuals that will come together and celebrate artistry and the human spirit! 

We sincerely hope you have been inspired to contribute and be part of the “I Have the Art Spirit” movement! If you haven’t yet decided on your PERKS, feel free to peruse the Gallery Tab of our project to learn more. In the meantime, please also check out our website at ArtbyKnight.com to see more About the Artists, Painter Laurel and Sculptor Steven and our Creative Director Tawnya, and explore our body of works; Bronze Sculpture, Original Oil Paintings and Canvas Prints. 

Are you looking for a long-term relationship with Fine Art? If so, definitely check out our Patron’s Pass Program at What is a Patron?  Patrons of Art by Knight enjoy a lifetime of substantial discounts on fine art, a beautiful Fine Art Print  of "Stream of Dreams" as a thank-you gift,  and many other privileges with Exclusive Membership and special access to our art! 

Thank You for Your Time 

and Your Contributions!

What If I Want More Than One Perk?

If you have already made your contribution and simply wish to increase your contribution or select an additional perk, you can do this in a separate contribution. For questions please see Indiegogo’s FAQ on How to Contribute to a Campaign.

What About the Packaging and Shipping?

-Within the USA, all packaging and shipping has been included in your already special Indiegogo pricing.

-All International Shipping is an Additional Price, listed within the PERK level

(Shipment does not include extra fees from customs, or additional costs associated with your country. We will inform you if the shipping fee exceeds the estimated cost. If it turns out that shipment to your country proves impossible, we will reimburse your order.) Please see our PDF link for more information Packaging & Shipping of Perks.

story_txt:
Last Friday 09/27/13 Steven Knight passed from this earthly world. A beloved Husband, Dad, Son and Grandfather, and an artist that poured his soul into his creations. His death was sudden and tragic, and has affected so many people. Often beauty and tragedy are intertwined. We are still reeling from his passing, but we feel him with us and all around us. His will live on through his wife Laurel, his seven children, four grandchildren and the scores of people that he touched. His last art piece "Transcendence" will continue to inspire the art spirit in others, and his incredible body of sculptural works will impact and move people for generations to come. We are grieving as a family, but we will honor your contributions to our campaign, and send the perks when we find some order amongst this tragic chaos. Please be patient with us. If you prefer a refund for your contribution, please let us know. If you do not wish to receive a perk, but would like to contribute to assist our family during this difficult time, we sincerely appreciate that as well. 
We will be casting Steven's last incredible art piece "Transcendence" in the near future through a new campaign that will share his art legacy with the world. If you wish to be notified of this in the future, please send an email with your information to webforms@artbyknight.com. 
My dad's dream was to share his art with the world, bring beauty into life and help inspire others to live their art spirit. Please help us honor him by living your art spirit and embracing life and love to the fullest. Thank you. ~Tawnya Knight

  WHAT IS IT ABOUT?
"I Have the Art Spirit" was created by a family and team of artists; husband, wife and daughter.  We have combined our artistic passions of sculpture, painting and music, all with a common theme of  “I Have the Art Spirit”. We are here to start a MOVEMENT...a world wide Art Spirit movement....and it begins, with you! We want to Inspire everyone to recognize their unique gifts.We wish for every human being to Embrace their own creative energy, and those of others.And we encourage each and every one of you that are still searching for your purpose, to find and Awaken your art spirit!We are humbly inviting you to be a part of this Universal Movement.  
     WHY WE NEED YOU!
Our goal is to accomplish a life-long dream of being able to get our art directly to you -- those who embrace the Art Spirit. Through Indiegogo we can finally reach out to all of you around the world! Our journeys haven't always been focused on living our Art Spirit, as many of you can likely identify with. With this campaign, we have now laid it on the line and we are pursuing what we were born to do! But we need your help to go forward.  Your generous contributions will help the Art Spirit Movement to gain traction and provide us with the ability to continue to create meaningful art that anyone can own and enjoy.  You will also be instrumental in establishing IHaveTheArtSpirit.com.  The website will be born of this campaign, and will create the platform for people anywhere, to share, support and embrace their creativity.



MEET THE ARTISTS!




(Click names to view the individual videos for each artist's creation)


Steven L. Knight is an accomplished classical, figurative realist sculptor.
He has lived a very colorful and diversified life. Steven grew up in
a rural environment, spending years in the beauty of nature,
surrounded by incredible wildlife and majestic horses. His connection
to this special period in his life is evident in his extensive body
of sculptural work. He is also a dad and grandpa, an avid
outdoors-man, and loves his quiet time to reflect on the beauty of the
world. Steven has shown in major galleries, has his line of relief
bronze belt buckles circulating the world, and is now continuing his
journey with “I Have the Art Spirit”.


Laurel Knight is a dynamic and passionate individual. She is a voracious
reader, always hungry for knowledge or a new experience. Laurel takes
pleasure in the little things, from the laughter of a young child, or
the enjoyable antics of a mischievous squirrel, to the light breeze
on a sunny summer day. She has built quite a diverse body of works,
which were inspired by her many years as a mother and grandmother, as
well as her love for the old masters and the great outdoors. Now that
all of her children are grown, Laurel has finally turned her full
creative energy to her oil painting, and is fully expressing her
artistry through this campaign.

Tawnya Knight is a person of many interests as well as the Creative Director
at Art by Knight.  She grew up singing & performing in live
musicals, and eventually turned toward the art of sales.  She has
since returned to her first love of music and art, and is able to
express her passion through “I Have the Art Spirit”. Tawnya spent
happy years growing up in the wild beauty of Montana, and after 11
years in Southern California, has found her heart in sunny Central
Oregon. Tawnya spends her time with her family at Art by Knight;
directing social media and creative aspects of the business, writing
poetry, working on music, and making hand-crafted jewelry.






"The Spirit of Art" ~ Canvas Prints

A gorgeous Limited Edition Triptych (3 paintings) that represent the stages of the Art Spirit journey. Each is indicative of the Art Spirit, by the gesture, design, and name of the piece. Be uplifted by "Inspire", be elevated by "Embrace", and be enlightened by"Awaken".See the Perks to select the individual prints, or the complete triptych! Note: You may choose from the Full Color, the Black & White or Sepia Glow! Your specific choice will be handled in the order survey, which we'll send after the campaign ends.



"Inspire" ~ Full Size Image for Better Viewing of Details

"Embrace" ~ Full Size Image for Better Viewing of Details

"Awaken" ~ Full Size Image for Better Viewing of Details


"The Spirit of Art"  in Full Original Color
"The Spirit of Art"  in Black and White
"The Spirit of Art"  in Sepia Glow
________________________________________________________
Whatever Lifts Your Spirit ~ Canvas Prints

While we hope that "The Spirit of Art" moves you....we realize that not everyone is lifted by the same thing. So we are bringing these fan favorites to you, our contributors, at super special pricing!  These Specially Selected Prints are sure to warm your heart, bring back memories, or intrigue your guests.  Note: Your specific choice will be handled in the order survey, which we'll send after the campaign ends. 

"Ocean's Symphony" a passionate and powerful seascape Fine Art Print!

"Twist of Fate" a figurative Fine Art Print portraying everyday working men, that look intriguingly familiar!  See if you can recognize them all!!

"Beyond the Bend" a colorful and vibrant idyllic landscape Fine Art Print!
________________________________________________________
Mini Masterpieces ~ Archival Canvas Prints

From the captured beauty and innocence of childhood, the special moments in life frozen in time and the majestic tranquility of mother nature and the great outdoors...get your Mini Masterpieces and own tiny treasures that will bring joy and beauty for many years to come!These Mini Masterpieces are true fine art, yet small enough to fit anywhere! Display them all, or one-at-a-time for a fresh perspective. They make fabulous and unique gifts! Get five mini's for only $50! Christmas shopping? Knock out that list with the $100 perk and get 12 of these Mini Masterpieces!Printed on Archival Canvas with the same level of quality as our large prints! Mounted on acid-free backer board, and UV coated for extreme longevity. Printed and signed by the Artist, Laurel Knight.




____________________________________________________________________  
"Transcendence" ~ Fine Art Bronze Sculpture

 This magnificent and sweeping piece, represents your own personal creative freedom and the spiritual connection to the Art Spirit.  Spread your wings to fly, and know that because of our shared Spirits....you are never alone!  "Transcendence", shown here in the original clay, will be cast in bronze using the lost wax casting method, and mounted on a beautiful solid black granite base. Your finished Bronze Art will last the centuries.




The sizes are as follows:
Full Size (100%) Bronze Sculpture measures 22" high (on a 1 1/4" thick black granite base), and 23" wide (wing tip to wing tip).  
3/4th Size (75% reduction) Bronze Sculpture measures 16.5" high (on a 1 1/4" thick black granite base), and 17.25" wide (wing tip to wing tip). 
1/2 Size (50% reduction) Bronze Sculpture measures 11" high (on a 1 1/4" thick black granite base), and 11.5" wide (wing tip to wing tip). 
All three sizes are available in three stunning patina (color) options.  Patination: The coloring of a Bronze Sculpture accomplished by a trained craftsman/artist using various chemicals under heat to create a multitude of finishes.
________________________________________________________Bronze Relief Medallion
High-Relief Sculptural Medallion of "Transcendence" size 10" x 10"
 Patina options same as the three dimensional "Transcendence" sculpture.  
Artistic Rendering of High-Relief Bronze Medallion 


________________________________________________________Original Song “I Will” by Tawnya Knight

Tawnya Knight has written an original song titled "I Will".  This song represents what lifts you when you are in your darkest hours.  It is clean, classic and genre-less.  It is still to be mastered in the recording studio, so please watch the project video below, to hear a few samples of the song.  "I Will", is to be released in three (3) versions.  The original piano version, a "folksier" acoustic version, and a "full band" version with piano, perhaps a violin and more!  Tawnya will master each of these versions in the recording studio to bring you the very best quality available.  You can see the lyrics at this link: "I Will" Lyrics


Tawnya has had experience working with some very talented musicians in the past. Please sample some of these awesome songs by "Palace View", vocals by Tawnya Knight, written by Graeme Dickson (also on guitar, bass and drums) and accompanied on keyboard by Brian Dickson. 
Sorrow Hole     Tawnya Knight on vocals
Without You     Tawnya Knight on vocals
Unforsaken      Tawnya Knight on vocals
Pieces Without Me      Tawnya Knight on vocals

The fabulous piano in the song, "I Will", is written and played by the incredible Dave Finch. He will be the "Piano Man" for two versions of the song, and he is playing the piano background in the videos.

HOW DO I CONTRIBUTE?
You may contribute to our campaign by clicking on the “Contribute Now” button. You’ll be able to enter how much you want to contribute, claim your perk, and choose how you want to pay. We accept Visa, MasterCard, and American Express credit or debit cards, or you can choose to pay via PayPal. No worries...your information is secure! If you have questions please message our team, comment in the project, or see Indiegogo’s FAQ’s.      











  


We at Art by Knight, want to do something never before seen on Indiegogo. We are combining three mediums that people can enjoy in different ways. We want to move you with our art. Of course, that is what great art is all about...it speaks to YOU. We have some fabulous PERKS for you, from incredible Limited Edition Fine Art, to beautiful music, and awesome logoed swag! But we are also going to take you along for the journey! 
We are going to post updates to share our progress and accomplishments.  We are going to create videos of our experiences at the bronze foundries, the music studio, and other stops along the way. We are going to connect with you on Facebook, Pinterest, and on our Blog and websites. We are going to establish a Community of creative individuals that will come together and celebrate artistry and the human spirit! 
We sincerely hope you have been inspired to contribute and be part of the “I Have the Art Spirit” movement! If you haven’t yet decided on your PERKS, feel free to peruse the Gallery Tab of our project to learn more. In the meantime, please also check out our website at ArtbyKnight.com to see more About the Artists, Painter Laurel and Sculptor Steven and our Creative Director Tawnya, and explore our body of works; Bronze Sculpture, Original Oil Paintings and Canvas Prints. 
Are you looking for a long-term relationship with Fine Art? If so, definitely check out our Patron’s Pass Program at What is a Patron?  Patrons of Art by Knight enjoy a lifetime of substantial discounts on fine art, a beautiful Fine Art Print  of "Stream of Dreams" as a thank-you gift,  and many other privileges with Exclusive Membership and special access to our art!

story:
So I'm writing a book!

If you guys have been following my channel you'll be somewhat familiar with my style of teaching and approach to learning.  After going through some of the images that i've created over the course of the last five months, I realized that I had a lot of content that could both be used and expanded on.  The book would cover a lot of the principles I've discussed thus far in much greater detail and would introduce new topics as well.  

It will take me a few months to get everything together, written, and formatted, so I'm estimating the ship out date to be in May 2018.  

A few notes for transparency:
If for some reason I am not able to complete the project by June 2018 the money will be refunded in full.

None of the funds raised will be touched until print/distribution

Funds are for: ISBN, printing and shipping hard copies, and digital distribution
 

 

I will update you guys periodically with notes from the book and some screenshots! 

The Chapter list is as follows:  
PART 1

CHAPTER 1: PRINCIPLES OF ROTATION
CHAPTER 2: LENS LENGTHS AND DISTORTIONS
CHAPTER 3: CREATING UNIQUE PRIMITIVES AND ASSESSING SUBJECTS
CHAPTER 4: ANALYZING POSE AND GESTURE WITH FORM

PART 2

CHAPTER 5: LINE QUALITY AND TYPE
CHAPTER 6: MATERIAL AND TEXTURE 
CHAPTER 7: LIGHTING AND RENDERING 

PART 3

CHAPTER 8: DIRECT DRAWING 
CHAPTER 9: CREATING MOVEMENT 
CHAPTER 10: STORYTELLING THROUGH DRAWING

story:
What is this all about?

I am Xuemei Shan, a current graduate student at Savannah College of Art and Design working towards my Masters of Arts in Arts Administration. For my degree, I am planning and curating a art exhibition as my final project. The title of the exhibition is Fragment and the theme is seeking for the pieces of memories. I have asked artists to submit works and encourage them to create artworks related to the theme. There will be paintings, installations exhibited and the artworks will be influenced by each other. Audience will have a special experience when walk through the artworks and call back their memories during the exhibition.

The exhibition will take place on August 14 through August 16 with the opening reception the night of August 14th from 5:00-9:00 pm at Non-fiction Gallery in Savannah, Georgia.

Why I need fund and you will get fun Perks!

Through this campaign I hope to gain enough funding to cover the expenses that will make Fragments successfully I require a total of $800, and the budget is broken down as follows:

$580 for gallery space rental fee

$220 for marketing materials printing and exhibition's supplies.

For donating to my project you will receive the following perks:

$5 - Shout out! A piece of Fragment

By contributing $5 you will receive a shout out on the Facebook event page for Fragment! Please leave your information that you will see a shout out and email! and if you attend the exhibition, you will get Handwritten Thank-you card from Xuemei in Non-Fiction Gallery.

$15- A part of Fragment

You will get previous benefits as $5 + 2 of different Fragment stickers+ Thank-you card. (Mail to your address)

$25 - Slightly Larger Fragment

You will get previous benefits as $5 + 4 different special Fragments stickers + Photo take during the opening reception + handwritten Thank-you letter. (Mail to your address)

$50 – A Group of Fragments

You will get previous benefits as $25 + Fragments postcard + your name listed as a recognized donor in the exhibition catalog!

$100 – Special Fragments

You will get previous benefits as $50 + a bag of gifts including Fragments poster, postcard, all of the stickers, Fragment special key ring.

$200- Super Fragments

You will get all of the previous benefits + Recognition on the wall of the exhibition's gallery!

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand if you cannot donate, but there are some other ways you can get involved!

1. Join and share the  Fragments Facebook Event Page

2. Share the Fragments Indiegogo Campaign to others.

story:
Calling all LOVERS of live music, theater, performance and dance…

Inviting ye PURVEYORS of handmade artistic endeavor...

Paging thou PATRONS of the high arts, supporters of horns, drums, and beats of heart, song line, set and setting...

Your ship is in! Come aboard the Serpent Queen for a journey of Ten Thousand Lifetimes…

 

Our beloved Steamboat, the S.S. Serpent Queen is voyaging to Black Rock City for her fifth year. While she has been a fantastic Playa Cruiser thus far, she has not yet reached her full potential, and we hope that in 2016 we will see her thru to the final phase of our extensive finale fit and finish.  We have a professional build crew of mechanics, carpenters, and techs already working diligently on her transformation. We require modest capital in order to once again safely sail the Inland Seas...

Some features of her existing fitment:

  • High elevation 12ft  wide top deck with a length of 50ft, totaling 600’ square feet of space… ample room for revelry and incredible views under soft incandescence.
  • Pilot house bar with padded observation platform above the clouds.
  • Dual flame-effect smoke-stacks that stand 26’ above the Playa.
  • Tastefully appointed decor with period lighting, bells and whistles.
  • Baby Grand piano for band leader or DJ, replete with decks & weighted keyboard.
  • 10k high-end sound system with 13k watts of clean generated power.
  • Animated victorian paddle-wheels designed by renowned artist, Carey Thompson.
  • Custom 3’ brass Spot-Lamp and Hand tooled Arclight by Victorian restoration specialist, Justinian Morton.
  • Customized cushioned wraparound bench seating. Comfortable repose for up to 60 people at a time!

Upgrades Necessary for 2016:

  • Transmission, driveline, clutch repair and maintenance. This our primary expense for 2016.
  • Bottom deck metamorphosis from bus into steamboat. Covering windows, finishing keel.
  • Finishing interior of pilot house for serving artisanal libations and elixirs, replete with sink, work station, power outlets for blenders, espresso, and tea service.
  • Installation of a removable canvas awning for comfortable, shaded daytime cruising.
  • A top-deck audio rack system for easy plug-and-play live performance of bands, djs, and assorted vaudevillians.
  • Renovation of the bottom deck’s interiors, including proper storage shelving, theatrical costume changing room, and ornate tea lounge.
  • Top deck steering wheel & pneumatic brake installation for bird’s-eye clarity while navigating the open Playa at night.
  • Heavy-duty all-weather exterior paint coating for year-round preservation of our craftsmanship.
  • Redesign of the brass fireman’s pole for exit over stern to service power station and for quick getaway.
  • Professional wiring of all power and source for our audio and lighting system.
  • All necessary scheduled maintenance of our Cummins 262 Turbo Diesel engine, the power-plant for the venerable S.S. Serpent Queen.

 

(Chief Engineer Justinian Morton)

Who We Are:

The Serpent Queen Project is managed by “Roughing It’’, a collective composed of artists, musicians, performers, builders, filmmakers, and deep-water thinkers based out of the Northern/Southern California latitudes with some members as far away as London, UK. Our core fellowship has been participating on the Playa since 1997. We are in cahoots with Collective Filmworks, The Fractal, Shaka2Ra Studio, & El Radio Fantastique.  

 

The Serpent Queen Project was conceived in 2010. She is now five years along in her journey of exploration of the noble artistic expression.  "Good Enough" isn't proving to be in our vocabulary. It is high-time to evolve her form and function, as the Muses intended, into a large scale, multifaceted 'objet d'arte'. Even if you can’t assist financially, please don’t hesitate to contact us on how you can crew up with us. From the poly-technical to artistic/performance based, our collaborative opportunities are myriad in scope. All participants will be provided a rich and productive experience through the Noble Disciplines during the greatest festival in the Solar System. Check out our Facebook page and Website for more information and drop us a line.

A Thousand Thanks for your support!

 

Sincerely,

JB Henderson, Captain/Artistic Director

Cristina Valverde, Chief Mate/Project Coordinator

 

https://www.facebook.com/serpentqueensteamboat/

http://serpentqueen.org


 

& a Peak at the Thank You mementos...

Bumper Sticker :

SQ Paddlewheel Patch design, Gold-threaded Embellishments to be added :

Ye Olde Tyme Banjo Lesson with Pendleton Lunchbox :

 

An approximation of the Formal Jackets, to be decorated : 

 

Hope to see you Fine folks on the Playa this year!
